Description: PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYPROJECT TITLE: GEOLOGIC MAPPING EFFORTS TOWARD INCREASING GEMS-COMPLIANT COVERAGE OF ARIZONA PROJECT PERIOD: 09 05 2023 - 09 04 2023PURPOSE:THE ARIZONA GEOLOGICAL SURVEY HAS A LONG HISTORY OF PRODUCING GEOLOGIC MAPS IN ARIZONA. THISPROJECT CONTINUES THAT TRADITION WITH NEW GEOLOGIC MAPPING IN NORTHWESTERN ARIZONA, COMPILATIONOF INTERMEDIATE-SCALE MAPS OF THE SAFFORD AREA AND SANTA CRUZ RIVER VALLEY SOUTH OF TUCSONALONGSIDE A SYNTHESIS OF ALLUVIAL DEPOSITS AND AGGREGATE RESOURCES, AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF AREGIONAL SCALE GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE COLORADO PLATEAU THAT IS THE FIRST STEP TOWARDS A NEW GEOLOGICMAP OF ARIZONA.ACTIVITIES:1. GEOLOGICAL MAPPING ALONG I-40 EAST OF KINGMAN  2 QUADRANGLES 2. COMPILATION GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THE SANTA CRUZ RIVER VALLEY AND SYNTHESIS OF ALLUVIALDEPOSITS AND AGGREGATE RESOURCES OF THE SANTA CRUZ RIVER VALLEY AND TUCSON BASIN3. COMPILATION GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THE SAFFORD 30 X 60 QUADRAGLE4. COMPILATION GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THE COLORADO PLATEAU REGION WORKING TOWARDS A NEW1:500,000-SCALE GEOLOGIC MAP OF ARIZONADELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES:1. GEOLOGIC MAP AND LEVEL 3 GEMS-COMPLIANT GEODATABASE OF THE RATTLESNAKE HILL 7 QUADRANGLE, MOHAVE COUNTY, ARIZONA2. GEOLOGIC MAP AND LEVEL 3 GEMS-COMPLIANT GEODATABASE OF THE HUALAPAI SPRING 7 QUADRANGLE, MOHAVE COUNTY, ARIZONA3. SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAP AND LEVEL 3 GEMS-COMPLIANT DATABASE OF PART OF THE SANTA CRUZRIVER VALLEY, PIMA AND SANTA CRUZ COUNTIES, ARIZONA4. GEOLOGIC MAP AND LEVEL 3 GEMS-COMPLIANT DATABASE OF ALLUVIAL DEPOSITS AND AGGREGATERESOURCES OF THE TUCSON BASIN5. GEOLOGIC MAP AND LEVEL 3 GEMS-COMPLIANT DATABASE OF ALLUVIAL DEPOSITS AND AGGREGATERESOURCES OF THE SANTA CRUZ RIVER VALLEY6. GEOLOGIC MAP AND LEVEL 3 GEMS-COMPLIANT DATABASE OF THE SAFFORD 30 X 60QUADRANGLE, GRAHAM COUNTY, ARIZONA7. DRAFT GEOLOGIC MAP AND LEVEL 3 GEMS-COMPLIANT GEODATABASE OF THE COLORADOPLATEAU REGION, ARIZONA8. GEMS LEVEL 3 GEODATABASE OF THE CERBAT 7  QUADRANGLE, MOHAVE COUNTY, ARIZONA(HTTPS:  NGMDB.USGS.GOV PRODESC PRODDESC 19926.HTM)INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:ARIZONA GEOLOGICAL SURVEY MAPS ARE INTENDED TO BE USED BY NUMEROUS STAKEHOLDERS, INCLUDINGDECISION POLICYMAKERS, PROFESSIONAL GEOLOGISTS IN ENGINEERING, ENVIRONMENTAL, AND MINERALSGEOLOGY, STUDENT AND ACADEMIC GEOLOGISTS, AND MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC INTERESTED IN THEIR LOCALGEOLOGY. THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES THE MAP PRODUCTS BEING PARTICULARLY USEFUL TO PLANNERS AND ENGINEERINGGEOLOGISTS INTERESTED IN RESOURCES FOR INFRASTRUCTURE DEVELOPMENT, ENVIRONMENTAL HYDROGEOLOGISTSINTERESTED IN WATER RESOURCES, EXPLORATION MINE GEOLOGISTS LOOKING FOR MINERAL RESOURCES, ANDCOMMUNITY MEMBERS WANTING TO IDENTIFY EXISTING GEOLOGIC HAZARDS.

PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYPROJECT TITLE: NEW GEOLOGIC MAPPING IN WASHINGTON STATEPROJECT PERIOD: 07 01 2023 - 06 30 2025PURPOSEWASHINGTON DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOUCES (WA-DNR) WILL COMPLETE DETAILED SURFICIAL AND BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THREE-AND-A-HALF 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLES IN THREE GEOGRAPHIC AREAS. EACH AREA WILL ALSO BENEFIT FROM DETAILED GEOPHYSICAL STUDIES. THE MAPPING EFF ORTS WILL HAVE CONSIDERABLE IMPACT ON THE PUBLIC THROUGH THE CHARACTERIZATION OF GEOLOGIC HAZARDS AND THE RESPONSIBLE USE OF NATURAL RESOURCES. THE NEW GEOLOGIC MAPPING WILL ALSO PROVIDE MUCH-NEEDED INFORMATION TO TEST MODELS OF HOW STRAIN FROM AN OBLIQUE SUBDUCTION ZONE DEFORMS THE UPPER CRUST AND IS TRANSFERRED BETWEEN THE FOREARC AND BACKARC.ACTIVITIESWA-DNR WILL CONDUCT GEOLOGIC MAPPING AND GEOPHYSICAL (GRAVITY) DATA ACQUISITION STARTING ON JULY 1, 2023. FIELD WORK WILL CONCLUDE BY EARLY NOVEMBER. DATA PROCESSING, MAP CREATION, SAMPLE ANALYSIS, AND WRITING WILL BEGIN AFTER FI ELD WORK AND CONTINUE THROUGH APRIL, 2024. EDITING, PEER REVIEW, MAP AND PAMPHLET REVISION, AND FURTHER ANALYSIS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH JUNE, 2024. FINAL MAP LAYOUT, REVIEW, AND PUBLICATION WILL OCCUR THROUGH THE SUMMER AND FALL OF 2024 AND FINAL PUBLICATION IS SCHEDULED FOR DECEMBER, 2024.DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMESNEW GEOLOGIC MAPPINGWA-DNR WILL PUBLISH DETAILED SURFICIAL AND BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAPS AT 1:24,000 SCALE, TECHNICAL REPORTS, AND GIS DATABASES PRIOR TO DELIVERY TO THE PROGRAM OFFICER BY JUNE 30, 2025. THIS WILL INCLUDE THE EATONVILLE, ELLENSBURG SOUTH, COUGAR MOUNTAIN, AND EAGLE GORGE 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLESSTATUS MAPSWA-DNR WILL ALSO DEVELOP PDF AND GIS-BASED STATUS MAPS SHOWING THE COVERAGE OF COMPLETED GEOLOGIC MAPPING AT SCALES OF 1:24,000, 1:100,000, 1:250,000, AND 1:500,000 FOR THE STATE OF WASHINGTON. THE MAPS WILL INDICATE WHICH PUBLISHED PRODUCTS WERE FUNDED BY STATEMAP. WA-DNR WILL ALSO DELIVER A STATE FACT SHEET OUTLINING THE SAME DATA WITH A TABLE SHOWING STATEMAP FUNDS RECEIVED BY YEAR FOR EACH PROJECT. THESE PRODUCTS WILL BE DELIVERED TO THE PROGRAM OFFICER BY JUNE 30, 2025.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESOUR SELECTION OF THESE AREAS FOR MAPPING AND STUDY IS BASED ON THE RECOMMENDATION OF A BROAD-BASED PANEL OF STAKEHOLDERS, INCLUDING REPRESENTATIVES FROM COUNTIES AND PLANNERS, AGGREGATE AND MINING INDUSTRIES, ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS, NON-GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS, RESEARCH GEOLOGISTS AND HYDROGEOLOGISTS AT THE USGS, THE U.S. BUREAU OF RECLAMATION, OTHER STATE AGENCIES (DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES), CONSULTANTS AND ENGINEERS, AND OTHERS. AS A RESULT, PROJECTS OFTEN HAVE MULTIPLE BENEFICIARIES. IN GENERAL OUR WORK IS USED BY A WIDE VARIETY OF GEOSCIENTISTS, POLICY MAKERS, PLANNERS, AND OTHERS TO: 1) IDENTIFY AND CHARACTERIZE GEOLOGIC HAZARDS  2) BUILD UNDERSTANDING OF WATER AND EARTH RESOURCES TO IMPROVE GROWTH MANAGEMENT ACT PLANNING  3) PROVIDE MAPPING IN AREAS OF EMERGING SOCIETAL NEED, AND  4) UNDERSTAND GEOLOGIC PROCESSES.THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS AWARD.

PROJECT TITLE: GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF SE 1 2 OF CHESTNUT HILL, RUSSELLVILLE, AND WILDER, LANE, DRILLING ON MISTON, TN 7.5  QUADRANGLES, COMPILATION OF 2 DERIVATIVE MAPS, AND CREATING 3 GEMS LEVEL 3 DATABASES PROJECT PERIOD: 07 01 2023- 06 30 2024PURPOSE: MAPPING THE GEOLOGY, GEOLOGIC HAZARDS, AND MINERAL RESOURCES OF SELECTED GEOGRAPHIC AREAS (QUADRANGLES) IN TENNESSEE COVERING ABOUT 65 SQUARE MILES EACH AT A SCALE OF 1-INCH EQUALS 2,000 FT.ACTIVITIES: USING GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM DEVICES WITH GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM SOFTWARE GEOLOGIC FIELD MAPPERS WILL ACCURATELY RECORD THE LOCATION OF SURFACE EXPOSURES OF ROCK LAYERS AND THEIR ASSOCIATED CHARACTERISTICS AND MINERAL RESOURCES AT NUMEROUS OBSERVATION POINTS. GEOLOGIC HAZARDS, SUCH AS LANDSLIDES AND SINKHOLES, WILL BE MAPPED AND ENTERED INTO A DATABASE, BUT WILL NOT BE SHOWN ON A FINAL GEOLOGIC MAP AS WILL SPRINGS AND SEEPS. ALL THESEADDITIONAL DATA WILL BE INCORPORATED INTO DATABASES THAT WILL BE USED IN THE FUTURE TO CREATE SMALLER SCALE DERIVATIVE MAPS OF THE REGION THAT FOCUS ON GEOLOGIC HAZARDS, GROUNDWATER, AND MINERAL RESOURCES.DELIVERABLES: GEOLOGIC MAPS IN COLOR OF THE EQUIVALENT OF 2.5QUADRANGLES, MAP OF DRILLING LOCATIONS AND CROSS SECTIONS PLUS A SUMMARY REPORT ACCOMPANIED BY SUBSURFACE DATA ON ONE QUADRANGLE, MINERAL RESOURCES MAPS ON ONE PREVIOUSLY PUBLISHED QUADRANGLE, AND DIGITAL FILES AND DATABASES FOR TWO PREVIOUSLY PUBLISHED GEOLOGIC MAPS. ALL MAP PRODUCTS AND ASSOCIATED DATABASES WILL BE UPLOADED TO THE NATIONAL COOPERATIVE GEOLOGIC MAPPING PROGRAM PORTAL FOR ACCESS TO ONLINE USERS. COMPLETION OF THE GEOLOGIC MAPS WILL APPRISE INTERESTED PARTIES OF POTENTIAL GEOLOGIC HAZARDS SUCH AS ACID-PRODUCING RUNOFF, EARTHQUAKES, LANDSLIDES, SINKHOLES, AND OTHER FORMS OF GROUND INSTABILITY, GROUNDWATER, MINERAL RESOURCES INCLUDING COAL, OIL, AND NATURAL GAS, AS WELL AS FOR AGGREGATE AND POTENTIAL SOURCES OF RARE EARTH ELEMENTS. THE MINERAL RESOURCES MAPS WILL SUPPORT THE U.S. GEOFRAMEWORK INITIATIVE, THE GOAL OF WHICH IS TO PRODUCE A SEAMLESS GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE UNITED STATES BY 2030, BY PROVIDING ENHANCED DATABASES TO SUPPORT SCIENTIFIC DISCOVERY AND INFORMED DECISION MAKING. COMPLETING THESE MINERAL RESOURCES MAPS ALSO SUPPORTS AN ONGOING INVESTIGATION OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN COAL FIELDS AS PART OF THE DEPARTMENT OF ENERGYS CARBON ORE, RARE EARTH, AND CRITICAL MINERALS INITIATIVE. THE INITIATIVE IS FOCUSED ON EXPANDING AND TRANSFORMING THE USE OF COAL AND COAL-BASED RESOURCES TO PRODUCE RARE EARTH ELEMENTS, CRITICAL MINERALS AND NOVEL HIGH-VALUE, NONFUEL, CARBON-BASED PRODUCTS, AS PART OF OUR NEXT GENERATION OF DOMESTIC U.S. MATERIALS.BENEFICIARIES: PEOPLE WHO LIVE NEAR TENNESSEES MAJOR TRANSPORTATION CORRIDORS, WHICH ARE AREAS OF RESIDENTIAL AND COMMERCIAL DEVELOPMENT REQUIRING INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS AND POTENTIALLY AFFECTING THE QUALITY AND QUANTITY OF LOCAL GROUNDWATER RESOURCES. PEOPLE LIVING WITHIN THE EAST TENNESSEE AND NEW MADRID SEISMIC ZONES, WHICH HAVE THE POTENTIAL FOR PRODUCING DAMAGING EARTHQUAKES GREATER THAN MAGNITUDE 6, WILL BE BETTER INFORMED ABOUT THE POTENTIAL FOR AMPLIFICATION OF EARTHQUAKE GROUND MOTION AND LIQUEFACTION OF NON-LITHIFIED GEOLOGIC MATERIALS IN ORDER TO BE ABLE TO BUILD NEW OR MODIFY EXISTING STRUCTURES TO BE MORE EARTHQUAKE RESISTANT. PEOPLE WHO LIVE IN TENNESSEES COALFIELDS WILL BE BETTER INFORMED ABOUT LEGACY COAL MINING ACTIVITY AND RELATED DISTURBANCES AND OIL AND GAS EXPLORATION THAT LEFT BEHIND ABANDONED WELLS THAT NEED TO BE IDENTIFIED AND PLUGGED IN ORDER TO PREVENT CONTINUING OR FUTURE CONTAMINATION OF GROUNDWATER. PEOPLE LIVING IN THE BIG SOUTH FORK NATIONAL RIVER AND RECREATION AREA WILL BENEFIT FROM THE MAPPING OF IMPORTANT AQUIFERS IN A REGION CHARACTERIZED BY NUMEROUS CAVES AND SINKHOLES VULNERABLE TO CONTAMINATION, ACID ROCK DRAINAGE CAPABLE OF CONTAMINATING BOTH GROUNDWATER AND SURFACE STREAMS, AND ABANDONED COAL MINE SUBSIDENCE AND LANDSLIDES FROM PAST MINING ACTIVITY.

PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYUTAH GEOLOGICAL SURVEYPROJECT TITLE: UTAH 2023 STATEMAP PROPOSALPROJECT PERIOD: 07 01 2023 - 06 30 2025PURPOSE: THE PROPOSED PROJECTS ADDRESS BASIC NEEDS FOR GEOLOGIC MAPPING AT SCALES INCLUDING 1:24,000, 1:100,000, AND 1:500,000 ACROSS UTAH. ADDITIONAL PROJECTS ADDRESS STATE AND FEDERAL NEEDS FOR 3D GEOSCIENCE, STRATIGRAPHIC CORRELATION, GEMS WORKFLOW, GEOHERITAGE, AND UPDATING NGMDB DATABASES.ACTIVITIES: THE UTAH GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (UGS) PROPOSES PROJECTS FOR THE NATIONAL COOPERATIVE GEOLOGIC MAPPING PROGRAM STATEMAP FUNDING OPPORTUNITY. ALL PROJECTS WILL HAVE 24 MONTHPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE THAT ENDS ON JUNE 30, 2025. IN PART I (NEW MAPPING), GUIDANCE CRITERIA (GC) 1, THE UGS PROPOSES TO COMPLETE 6 NEW MAPS THAT INCLUDE 4 7.5  QUADRANGLES (HUNTSVILLE, FRANCIS, BLANDING NORTH, AND A REVISED AND SCOPE REDUCED 60  OF DROMEDARY PEAK), PART OF ONE 30 X60  QUADRANGLE (WILDCAT MT. W), AND A REVISION OF ONE 30 X60  QUADRANGLE (PANGUITCH). THE UGS WILL ALSO COMPLETE CORRELATIVE GEMS CONVERSIONS FOR 6 PUBLISHED MAPS (LYMAN, LAKE MOUNTAIN, FARMINGTON, ALLENS RANCH 7.5 QUADS AND THE LOA W AND RUSH VALLEY 30 X60  QUADRANGLES). IN PART II U.S. GEOFRAMEWORK INITIATIVE (USGI), UTAH GEOLOGICAL SURVEY PROPOSE THE FOLLOWING: IN GC3, DEVELOP A WORKFLOW TO DIGITIZE SELECT CROSS SECTIONS IN 3D AND PROVIDE THESE DATA IN A GEMS-FORMATTED DATABASE. IN GC4, TO ADDRESS EXISTING GEOLOGIC AND CARTOGRAPHIC COMMENTS AND REVISIONS ON THE STATE 1:500,000-SCALE GEOLOGIC MAP. IN GC5, TO COMPLETE THE FINAL PUBLICATION AND CREATION OF A GEMS LEVEL 3 DATABASE OF THE GROUSE CREEK 30 X60  GEOLOGIC MAP. IN GC7, REVISE AND REDUCE THE SCOPE ORIGINALLY PROPOSED TO ONLY INCLUDE IMPROVING UTAH DATA AND LINKS TO DATA IN THE NATIONAL GEOLOGIC MAP DATABASE(NGMDB). IN GC9, TO FURTHER REFINE AND UPDATE OUR GEMS CAPABILITIES AND WORKFLOWS. IN GC10, TO COMPILE A DATABASE OF RANKED GEOHERITAGE SITES IN UTAH. IN GC14, TO INVESTIGATE AND RESOLVE STRATIGRAPHIC CORRELATION AND NOMENCLATURE FOR THE FLAGSTAFF AND WASATCH-COLTON FORMATIONS IN THE SOUTHWESTERN PART OF THE UINTA BASIN AND WASATCH PLATEAU.DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES: DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES FOR ALL PART 1 PROJECTS WILL INCLUDE PDFS OF THE 1:24,000- AND 1:62,500-SCALE GEOLOGIC MAPS WITH ACCOMPANYING EXPLANATORY MATERIALS. SUBMISSION GEMS LEVEL 3 DATABASES OF THE ACCOMPANYING MAPS MENTIONED ABOVE TO THE NGMDB. PART 2 DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE PDF MAPS, ACCOMPANYING EXPLANATORY MATERIALS, REPORTS, GEMS AND OTHER DATABASES AS ENUMERATED IN THE PROPOSAL.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PROPOSED PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT A RANGE OF CONSTITUENTS THAT INCLUDE 1) THE CITIZENS OF UTAH, 2) THE CITIZENS OF THE U.S.A, 3) PRIVATE INTERESTS RELATED TO DEVELOPMENT,ENERGY AND MINERAL RESOURCES, WATER RESOURCES, AND OTHER BUSINESS INTERESTS, AND 4) VARIOUS STATE, LOCAL, AND FEDERAL GOVERNING BODIES.

PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYPROJECT TITLE: NEW JERSEY GEOLOGICAL AND WATER SURVEY 2023 STATEMAP PROPOSALPROJECT PERIOD: 07 01 2023 - 06 30 2025PURPOSE: TO COMPLETE GEOLOGIC MAPS OF TWO 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLES IN NEW JERSEY, TO COMPLETE A KARST-SUSCEPTIBILITY MAP OF ONE 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE IN NEW JERSEY, TO COMPLETE A BIBLIOGRAPHY OF BEDROCK-SURFACE ELEVATION AND SURFICIAL THICKNESS MAPS FOR NEW JERSEY, AND TO COMPLETE GEMS LEVEL 3 COMPLIANT GIS DATASETS OF THREE PREVIOUSLY PUBLISHED 7.5-MINUTE GEOLOGIC QUADRANGLE MAPS IN NEW JERSEY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: COMPILATION AND GEOLOGIC INTERPRETATION OF AERIAL IMAGERY, TOPOGRAPHIC IMAGERY, AND WELL AND BORING DATA  FIELDWORK TO IDENTIFY AND DESCRIBE GEOLOGIC MATERIALS AND TO VERIFY AND REVISE INTERPRETATIONS  COMPILATION OF FIELD DATA  CONSTRUCTION OF MAP AND SECTIONS  WRITING OF EXPLANATORY TEXT  MAP REVIEW AND EDITING  CONDUCT LITERATURE SEARCH OF BEDROCK-SURFACE ELEVATION AND SURFICIAL THICKNESS MAPS  CONSTRUCTION OF GIS DATASETS COMPLIANT WITH GEMS LEVEL 3.DELIVERABLES: COMBINED BEDROCK AND SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE ALLOWAY QUADRANGLE, COMBINED BEDROCK AND SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE OCEANVILLE AND BRIGANTINE INLET QUADRANGLES (COMBINED AS A SINGLE MAP), KARST SUSCEPTIBILITY MAP OF THE HACKETTSTOWN QUADRANGLE, BIBLIOGRAPHY OF BEDROCK-SURFACE ELEVATION AND SURFICIAL THICKNESS MAPS FOR NEW JERSEY, GEMS LEVEL 3 DATASET OF THE BEDROCK GEOLOGY OF THE CLEMENTON QUADRANGLE (NJGWS GMS 21-5), GEMS LEVEL 3 DATASET OF THE GEOLOGY OF THE NEW GRETNA QUADRANGLE (NJGWS OFM 137), GEMS LEVEL 3 DATASET OF THE BEDROCK GEOLOGY OF THE LAKEWOOD QUADRANGLE (NJGWS OFM 121). EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PDFS AND GIS DATASETS FOR EACH MAP AVAILABLE FREE TO THE PUBLIC ON THE N. J. GEOLOGICAL AND WATER SURVEY WEBSITE IN OUR OPEN-FILE MAP, GEOLOGIC MAP SERIES, AND DIGITAL GEODATA PUBLICATION SERIES. BIBLIOGRAPHIC DATA ON BEDROCK-SURFACE ELEVATION AND SURFICIAL THICKNESS MAPS FOR NEW JERSEY READY TO BE ENTERED IN THE NATIONAL GEOLOGIC MAP DATABASE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: LAND-USE AND WATER-RESOURCE MANAGERS, ENGINEERING AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONSULTANTS, GEOLOGIC-RESOURCE AND GEOLOGIC-HAZARD PROFESSIONALS, EDUCATORS AND CITIZENS INTERESTED IN NATURAL HISTORY AND RESOURCES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

PROPOSAL ABSTRACT SUMMARYPROJECT TITLE: 23-25 VERMONT GEOLOGICAL SURVEY STATEMAP PROPOSALPROJECT PERIOD: 07 01 2023 - 06 30 2025THE PURPOSE OF VERMONTS FY2023 STATEMAP WORKPLAN IS TO PERFORM 2D AND 3D SURFICIAL AND BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAPPING TO SUPPORT COMMUNITIES IN THE SCIENTIFICALLY UNDERSERVED NORTHEASTERN PART OF OUR STATE THAT ARE DEALING WITH ISSUES RANGING FROM WATER SUPPLY DEFICITS, DETERIORATING LAKES, AND GEOLOGIC HAZARDS. THE SURFICIAL GEOLOGY OF THE AREA HAS NOT BEEN MAPPED IN OVER 50 YEARS, AND THE BEDROCK MAPPING HAS NOT BEEN UPDATED SINCE THE 1950S  OUR PROPOSED TASKS TO CHARACTERIZE, INTERPRET, AND DISSEMINATE GEOLOGIC FRAMEWORK INFORMATION FOR THE NORTHEAST KINGDOM (NEK) DIRECTLY RESPONDS TO THE GREATEST NEEDS IDENTIFIED BY OUR STATEMAP ADVISORY COMMITTEE AND SUPPORTS THE MISSION OF THE NCGMP. BASED ON OUR AWARD, THE VERMONT GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (VGS) STILL PROPOSES THREE PROJECTS IN THE NEK. PROJECT 1 (GUIDANCE CRITERION 1) FOCUSES ON NEW SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAPPING AT 1:24,000 SCALE. ORIGINALLY PROPOSED FOR FOUR 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLES, THE SCOPE HAS BEEN REDUCED TO THREE QUADRANGLES (NEWPORT, NEWPORT CENTER, SUTTON) BASED ON FUNDING. PROJECT 2 (GUIDANCE CRITERION 1) INCLUDES NEW BEDROCK MAPPING OF COMPLEXLY DEFORMED BEDROCK AT 1:24,000 SCALE IN THE NEWPORT QUADRANGLE  THE SCOPE OF THAT PROJECT REMAINS UNCHANGED, BUT THE VERMONT GEOLOGICAL SURVEY DID NOT RECEIVE ADEQUATE FUNDING TO SUPPORT THREE STUDENT FIELD ASSISTANTS AND THEY HAVE BEEN REMOVED. PROJECT 3 (GUIDANCE CRITERION 3) PROPOSES 3-DIMENSIONAL SUBSURFACE GEOLOGIC MAPPING VIA BOREHOLE GEOPHYSICAL SURVEYS WITHIN THE NEWPORT AND NEWPORT CENTER QUADRANGLES TO MAP HYDROGEOLOGICALLY IMPORTANT BEDROCK SURFACES AND STRUCTURES. ORIGINALLY SCOPED AT 20 BOREHOLES, THE SCOPE HAS BEEN REDUCED TO 17 BASED ON THE AWARD. PROJECTS 1, 2, AND 3 SYNERGISTICALLY ALLOW FOR A COMPREHENSIVE CHARACTERIZATION OF THE REGIONAL FRACTURED ROCK AQUIFER, INCLUDING RECHARGE FROM AND INTERACTION WITH THE SURFICIAL AQUIFER. THE DELIVERABLES ASSOCIATED WITH PROJECT 1 INCLUDE DIGITALLY PREPARED SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAPS, CROSS-SECTIONS AND LEVEL-3 GEMS-COMPLIANT GEODATABASES FOR THE NEWPORT, NEWPORT CENTER, AND CRYSTAL LAKE 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLES. A GOAL AND EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THE PROPOSED SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAPPING IS A REEVALUATION OF THE GLACIAL AND DEGLACIAL HISTORY OF NORTHERN VERMONT. THE DELIVERABLES FOR PROJECT 2 INCLUDE ONE DIGITALLY PREPARED BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAP, CROSSSECTIONS AND A LEVEL-3 GEMS-COMPLIANT GEODATABASE FOR THE NEWPORT QUADRANGLE  THIS MAPPING WILL HELP TO LINK THE TECTONIC TERRANE OF NORTHERN VERMONT TO NEW ENGLAND AND SOUTHERN QUBEC. FOR PROJECT 3, THE DELIVERABLE PACKAGE WILL INCLUDE A CSV FILE CONTAINING XYZ COORDINATES AND GEOLOGIC ATTRIBUTES FOR BEDROCK FORMATIONS AND HORIZONS OF REGIONAL HYDROGEOLOGIC SIGNIFICANCE. ALL DATA WILL ADDITIONALLY BE UPLOADED TO A WEB-BASED DATA REPOSITORY BUILT BY THE VGS, MAKING IT AVAILABLE FOR USE BY LOCAL, STATE, FEDERAL, AND PRIVATE SECTOR SCIENTISTS INVOLVED IN WATER QUANTITY AND QUALITY PLANNING DECISIONS IN VERMONT. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF OUR PROJECT WORK INCLUDE PRIVATE CONSULTANTS, GOVERNMENT SCIENTISTS, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC ENGAGED IN A NUMBER OF GROUNDWATER, SURFACE WATER, AND LAKE WATER ISSUES, PREPARING TRANSPORTATION RESILIENCE PLANS, IDENTIFYING LANDSLIDE-PRONE AREAS, AND IDENTIFYING MINERAL RESOURCES. NOW MORE THAN EVER, SOCIETY RELIES ON GEOSCIENTISTS TO HELP SOLVE THESE PERSISTENT AND CHALLENGING ISSUES, AND THE VERMONT GEOLOGICAL SURVEY SIMPLY CANNOT ADDRESS THEM WITHOUT THE BASELINE FRAMEWORK INFORMATION GENERATED BY OUR STATEMAP-FUNDED MAPPING ACTIVITIES.

PROJECT TITLE:  STATEMAP 2023PROJECT PERIOD: 07 01 2023 - 06 30 2024PURPOSETHE PROJECTS PROPOSED BY THE MISSISSIPPI GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (MOG) ARE QUADRANGLES FOUND IN MULTIPLE COUNTIES IN NORTHWEST-CENTRAL AND WEST-CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI THAT CONTAIN CENOZOIC DEPOSITS OF THE GULF COASTAL PLAIN. PROJECT 1 IS A CONTINUATION OF STATEMAP PROJECTS COMPLETED PREVIOUSLY IN WEST-CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI TO DELINEATE AQUIFER SANDS AND LIMESTONE UNITS IN THE VICKSBURG GROUP FROM THE SANDS AND GRAVELS OF PRE-LOESS TERRACE DEPOSITS IN WARREN, YAZOO, AND HINDS COUNTIES, MISSISSIPPI.ACTIVITIESTHE LITERATURE REVIEW AND FIELD MAP CONSTRUCTION WILL BEGIN AT THE BEGINNING OF THE GRANT YEAR. ONE MONTH HAS BEEN ALLOCATED PRIMARILY FOR THE CONSTRUCTION AND FINALIZATION OF THE FIELD BASE MAPS. THREE MONTHS HAS BEEN ALLOCATED FOR ANALYSIS OF ALL GEOPHYSICAL DATA AVAILABLE FOR PROPOSED MAPPING AREAS, PRIMARILY AS BOREHOLE DATA. SIGNIFICANT INTERVALS IN THESE LOGS WILL BE NOTED AND PROJECTED TO THE SURFACE. WHERE DATA IS LACKING, DRILLING LOCATIONS WILL BE SELECTED, APPROVED, DRILLED, AND LOGGED BY MOG STAFF AS PART OF EIGHT MONTHS ALLOCATED FOR FIELDWORK. PROJECTED FORMATIONAL CONTACTS WILL BE NOTED ON THE FIELD MAPS AND THE PRIMARY LOGS SELECTED BY MOG STAFF ON A QUADRANGLE BASIS WILL BE DIGITIZED IN ARCGIS. DIGITAL DRAFTING OF CROSS-SECTIONS WILL CHANGE DEPENDING ON GROUND-TRUTHING DONE THROUGH FIELDWORK.THUS, THE TIME ALLOCATED FOR THE DIGITAL DRAFTING OF CROSS-SECTIONS BEGINS AT THE ONSET OF FIELDWORK AND ENDS WITH THE COMPLETION OF DRAFTED MAPS. FIELDWORK IS PROJECTED TO BE COMPLETED BY MARCH OF 2024. THE DIGITAL DRAFTING OF MAPS WILL BEGIN FOR A FINAL CARTOGRAPHIC AND FIELD REVIEW THREE MONTHS PRIOR TO THE DELIVERABLE DATE TO LEAVE TIME FOR NECESSARY CHANGES THAT MIGHT BE UNCOVERED DURING THE REVIEW STAGE AS WELL AS TWO MONTHS OF ALLOCATED TIME FOR CONVERSION TO LEVEL 3 GEMS FORMAT.DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMESPROJECT 1 DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE SURFICIAL GEOLOGICAL MAPS OF THE ELDORADO, OAK RIDGE, AND QUEENS HILL LAKE 7.5 MINUTE QUADRANGLES, WARREN, YAZOO, AND HINDS COUNTIES, MISSISSIPPI WITH ACCOMPANYING CROSS SECTIONS AND LEVEL 3 GEMS DATABASE.

PROJECT TITLE:  2023 STATEMAPPROJECT PERIOD:  07 01 2023 - 06 30 2025PURPOSE:THE INDIANA GEOLOGICAL AND WATER SURVEY (IGWS) PROPOSED A BOLD NEW MAPPING CAMPAIGN IN 2021, CONTINUING INTO THE 2030S. ALTHOUGH THE DETAILS OF INDIANA S STRATIGRAPHIC ARCHITECTURE HAVE BEEN LARGELY ADDRESSED, THE LEVEL OF DETAIL OF GEOLOGICAL MAPS IS NOT OF SUFFICIENT RESOLUTION TO MEET TODAY S NEEDS. THE ONLY COHESIVE STATEWIDE EFFORT OCCURRED BETWEEN 1958 AND 1972. THAT MAPPING PRODUCED 24 1:250K GEOLOGICAL MAPS OF BEDROCK, UNCONSOLIDATED SEDIMENTS, AND COMBINED BEDROCK AND UNCONSOLIDATED USING NEGATIVE SCRIBING, SCREENING, PHOTO NEGATIVES, AND OFFSET PRINTING. THIS MAPPING WAS LATER COMBINED AND REVISED AT THE 1:500K SCALE IN THE 1980S.ACTIVITIES: THE CURRENT PLAN IS TO COMPLETE 1:100K MAPS FOR INDIANA BY 2030, ALIGNING WITH THE 20162017 NATIONAL COOPERATIVE GEOLOGIC MAPPING PROGRAM (NCGMP) VISION AND THE USGS GEOFRAMEWORK INITIATIVE (GFI).THROUGH 2025, THE SCOPE COMPRISES ALL 1:100K QUADRANGLES SOUTH OF THE 40TH PARALLEL TO THE OHIO RIVER, ENCOMPASSING VIRTUALLY ALL BEDROCK EXPOSURES IN INDIANA  THE WISCONSIN AND PRE-WISCONSIN GLACIAL LIMITS  ICONIC KARST LANDSCAPES  AND AVAILABLE COAL, BLACK SHALE, OIL AND GAS, AND INDUSTRIAL MINERAL RESOURCES.THE IMPACT OF THIS PLAN WILL BE TO: 1) CONTINUE TO TRAIN NEW GEOLOGICAL MAPPERS IN INDIANA TO PRODUCE DERIVATIVE MAPS THAT ADDRESS VITAL SOCIETAL NEEDS SUCH AS NATURAL HAZARDS, GROUNDWATER RESOURCES, AND INDUSTRIAL AND CRITICAL MINERALS  2) COMPLETE GEOLOGICAL MAPS IN AREAS OF STATE EMPHASIS, INVESTMENT, AND INFRASTRUCTURE DEVELOPMENT ENHANCE COLLABORATIVE ENVIRONMENTS AT THE IGWS, ENGAGING DATA SCIENTISTS AND MAKING OUR PRODUCTS MORE ACCESSIBLE  AND 4) ENGAGE RURAL COMMUNITIES AND UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS IN URBAN CENTERS THROUGH DIRECTED OUTREACH AND FIELDWORK.DELIVERABLES:THE SIX PROPOSED PROJECTS REPRESENT A SIGNIFICANT MAPPING, COLLECTIONS MANAGEMENT, AND DATA ADMINISTRATION EFFORT AND WILL INCLUDE FULL-TIME RESEARCH GEOLOGISTS AND MAPPERS, BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION STAFF, AND INFORMATION SPECIALISTS.

PROJECT TITLE: USGS IDAHO STATEMAP GEMS FY23PROJECT PERIOD:07 01 2023 - 06 30 2024PURPOSE MODERN GEOLOGIC MAPS IDENTIFY AND DESCRIBE ROCK UNITS AND SURFACE DEPOSITS, FAULTS, AND LANDSLIDES, AS WELL AS SHOW SUBSURFACE INTERPRETATIONS. IDAHO HAS ONE OF THE HIGHEST RELATIVE GROWTH RATES OF ANY STATE WITHIN THE U.S. ISSUES SUCH AS WATER RESOURCES, AGGREGATE SUPPLY, AND GEOLOGIC HAZARDS CONTINUE TO BE TOP PRIORITY AND GEOLOGIC MAPS PROVIDE ESSENTIAL INFORMATION FOR ADDRESSING THESE PROBLEMS. MINERAL RESOURCES ALSO REMAIN CRITICAL FOR THE ECONOMIC HEALTH OF THE STATE  THESE RESOURCES INCLUDE PHOSPHATE, SILVER, COBALT, AND GOLD. EXPLORATION FOR GOLD, SILVER, RARE-EARTH ELEMENTS, COBALT, AND COPPER IS ONGOING, AS IS EXPLORATION FOR GEOTHERMAL AND HYDROCARBON RESOURCES. GEOLOGIC MAPS PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE GEOLOGIC SETTING FOR THESE INDUSTRIES WHICH AID IN THEIR DRILLING AND SAMPLING PROGRAMS. TIMBER PRODUCTION, IN THE PRIVATE SECTOR AND FOR STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES, HAS ALWAYS BEEN AN IMPORTANT INDUSTRY IN IDAHO. FORESTERS AND SOIL SCIENTISTS HAVE FOUND GEOLOGIC MAPS VITAL FOR HELPING GUIDE FERTILIZATION AND LAND MANAGEMENT AND MITIGATE PROBLEMS THAT ARISE FROM INSECT INFESTATIONS AND DISEASES. ACTIVITIES GEOLOGIC MAPPING IN FOUR PROJECT AREAS (PRESTON, WEISER-BOISE, SALMON, AND ELK CITY). GEOLOGIC MAP DATABASE UPDATES IN FOUR AREAS (WEISER-BOISE, SALMON, NORTHERN IDAHO, AND PRESTON) AND INITIATION OF A NEW DATABASE IN SOUTHERN IDAHO (OAKLEY).  DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES FOUR 1:24,000 SCALE GEOLOGIC MAPS WITH SUBSURFACE INTERPRETATIONS (CROSS SECTIONS)TWO 1:75,000 SCALE GEOLOGIC MAPS WITH SUBSURFACE INTERPRETATIONS (CROSS SECTIONS)DATABASES FOR SIX PREVIOUSLY COMPLETED GEOLOGIC MAPSUPDATE TO GEOLOGIC MAP DATABASES OF THE WEISER-BOISE, SALMON, NORTHERN IDAHO, AND PRESTON PROJECT AREAS

PROJECT TITLE: CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF CONSERVATIONPROJECT PERIOD: 07 01 2023 - 06 30 2024PURPOSE: THIS PROPOSED MAPPING WILL BUILD UPON DETAILED WORK BY CGS AS PART OF OUR STATEMAP-FUNDED WORK THATSTARTED IN THE UKIAH 30  X 60  MAP IN 2020. EARLIER, SMALL-SCALE MAPPING OF THE AREA INCLUDES BEDROCKCOMPILATION MAPPING BY DURHAM (1979) AND QUATERNARY MAPPING BY CARDWELL (1965) AND FARRAR (1986).LARSEN AND KELSEY (2005) MAPPED THE QUATERNARY GEOLOGY AT 1:24,000-SCALE, BUT THIS WORK WAS COMPLETED PRIOR TO AVAILABLE HIGH-RESOLUTION LIDAR. ADDITIONALLY, A STUDENT THESIS (WOOLACE, 2005) RESEARCHED THE QUATERNARY STRATIGRAPHY AND TECTONIC EVOLUTION OF LITTLE LAKE VALLEY THAT WILL PROVIDE VALUABLE DATA AND INSIGHT FOR THIS STATEMAP PRODUCT.ACTIVITIES:CGS GEOLOGISTS WILL BEGIN WITH THE ACQUISITION AND EVALUATION OF EXISTING PUBLISHED AND UNPUBLISHEDGEOLOGIC MAPS AND REPORTS, INCLUDING LANDSLIDE MAPPING FROM TIMBER HARVEST REPORTS, RECENTLY COMPLETEDSTATEMAP PROJECTS WITHIN THE UKIAH 30  X 60  QUADRANGLE, AND FRAMEWORK STUDIES OF THE REGION BY THEUSGS. LIDAR DATA WILL BE PROCESSED FOR SHADED RELIEF, SLOPE, AND ELEVATION CONTOURS FOR ANALYSIS, COMBINEDWITH HIGH-RESOLUTION COLOR IMAGERY, USED AS GIS BASE LAYERS FOR HEADS-UP DIGITAL MAPPING OF LANDSLIDES,QUATERNARY SURFICIAL GEOLOGY, FAULTS, AND STRUCTURAL TRENDS.DELIVERABLES:THIS WORK WILL ADVANCE CGS TOWARD THE LONG-TERM GOAL OF COMPLETING 1:100,000-SCALE SEAMLESS DIGITALGEOLOGIC MAPS OF THE ENTIRE STATE IN SUPPORT OF THE USGI. PROJECT TITLE:  FY23 OREGON GEOLOGIC MAPPING, WALLA WALLA SUBBASIN, HARNEY BASINPROJECT PERIOD:  06 01 2023 THROUGH 05 31 2024AWARD PURPOSE  THE OREGON DEPARTMENT OF GEOLOGY AND MINERAL INDUSTRIES (DOGAMI) CONDUCTS GEOLOGIC MAPPING, CREATES, AND MAINTAINS DIGITAL GEOLOGIC DATABASES, AND COLLECTS HIGH-RESOLUTION AERIAL LIDAR IN ORDER TO CHARACTERIZE THE STATE S UNIQUE GEOLOGY AND TO ENHANCE UNDERSTANDING OF THE STATES GEOLOGIC RESOURCES AND HAZARDS. FOR THE FY23 U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (USGS) STATEMAP AWARD, THE RESEARCHERS WILL FOCUS ON GEOLOGIC MAPPING INVESTIGATIONS IN THE WALLA WALLA RIVER BASIN OF NE OREGON AND THE HARNEY BASIN OF SE OREGON. THESE PROPOSED PROJECTS RESPOND TO STATEMAP GUIDANCE CRITERIA 1.1 TO CREATE AND SUBMIT TO THE NATIONAL COOPERATIVE GEOLOGIC MAPPING PROGRAM GEMS-COMPLIANT (LEVEL 3) NEW GEOLOGIC MAPS. THE WORK SUPPORTS THE U.S. GEOFRAMEWORK INITIATIVE BY PROVIDING NEW GEOLOGIC MAPPING, LEVERAGE EXISTING DATA, AND USING ENHANCED DATABASES TO ENHANCE SCIENTIFIC DISCOVERY, PUBLIC USABILITY, AND INFORMED DECISION MAKING.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  FOR THE FY23 STATEMAP PROPOSAL, DOGAMI WILL CONSTRUCT DETAILED GEOLOGIC MAPS OF THE PROPOSED 7.5 QUADRANGLES BASED ON DETAILED FIELD WORK AND DESKTOP INTERPRETATION OF ALL AVAILABLE GEOLOGIC DATA SETS. MAPPING WILL BE SUPPORTED BY THIN-SECTION PETROGRAPHY, XRF GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSES OF VOLCANIC ROCK SAMPLES, AND 40AR 36AR AGE-DATING. GEMS (LEVEL 3) ESRI ARCGIS ARCMAP GEODATABASES WILL BE CONSTRUCTED FOR EACH MAP.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES  DELIVERABLES OF THIS PROPOSAL INCLUDE: PROJECT 1) 1:24,000-SCALE GEOLOGIC MAP, CROSS-SECTIONS, AND TIME-ROCK CHART FOR THE WATERMAN 7.5 QUADRANGLE IN THE WALLA WALLA RIVER BASIN  AND PROJECT 2) 1:24,000-SCALE GEOLOGIC MAP AND , CROSS-SECTIONS, AND TIMEROCK CHARTS FOR THE CAPEHART LAKE, MOON RESERVOIR, LAKE ON THE TRAIL, AND IRON MOUNTAIN FLAT 7.5 QUADRANGLES IN THE HARNEY BASIN. ALL MAPS WILL BE DELIVERED AS HIGH-QUALITY PDF FILES ACCOMPANIED BY COMPLETE GEMS (LEVEL 3) ESRI ARCGIS ARCMAP GEODATABASES. AT THE COMPLETION OF THE PROJECT, SUBMISSION TO THE USGS, AND EXTERNAL PEER REVIEW, RESULTS WILL BE DISSEMINATED THROUGH A DIGITAL PUBLICATION IN THE GEOLOGICAL MAP SERIES (GMS). FIVE PUBLISHED GEMS LEVEL 3 DATABASES WILL BE DELIVERED TO THE NGMDB CONCURRENTLY WITH THE FIVE PROPOSED QUADRANGLE DATABASES CITED ABOVE FOR PROJECTS 1 AND 2.INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)  1) STAKEHOLDERS AND DECISION MAKERS IN STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS IN OREGON  2) INDUSTRY WITH ONGOING EXPLORATION ACTIVITIES IN OREGON FOR CRITICAL MINERALS AND METALLIC AND NON-METALLIC MINERALS  3) ACADEMIC AND OTHER GEOSCIENCE PROFESSIONALS INTERESTED IN UNDERSTANDING THE GEOLOGIC AND ASSOCIATED MINERALIZATION HISTORY IN OREGON.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  NONE.

TITLE: CONVERTING PUBLISHED MAPS TO GEMS, 2023PROJECT PERIOD: 05 15 2023 - 05 14 2024PURPOSETHIS PROJECT WILL CONVERT FOUR PREVIOUSLY PUBLISHED GEOLOGICAL SURVEY OF ALABAMA (GSA) 7.5-MINUTE GEOLOGIC QUADRANGLES INTO THE GEOLOGIC MAP SCHEMA (GEMS)-FORMATTED GEODATABASE FILES. THESE FILES ARE A TYPE OF GEOSPATIAL DATA THAT CAN BE OPENED AND USED IN GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM (GIS) SOFTWARE. THE FOUR PREVIOUSLY PUBLISHED MAPS (EXISTING AS HARD COPY AND AS PORTABLE DOCUMENT FORMAT (PDF) FILES) WERE PREVIOUSLY FUNDED BY THE U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY STATEMAP PROGRAM, AND CONVERTING THESE MAPS INTO GEMS-FORMATTED DATA WILL PROVIDE A GEOLOGICALLY SPECIFIC GEOSPATIAL DATASET USEFUL FOR END USERS.ACTIVITIESTHE ORIGINAL PUBLISHED MAPS WERE GENERATED BY DIFFERENT GEOLOGISTS USING DIFFERENT SOFTWARE OVER TIME, AND BECAUSE OF THIS, EACH QUADRANGLE MAP WILL VARY SLIGHTLY IN TIME REQUIRED TO CONVERT TO GEMS. TASKS REQUIRED TO CONVERT PUBLISHED MAPS INTO THE FINAL GEMS PRODUCTS INCLUDE BUILDING AND EDITING GIS FILES, COMPILING TABLES, POPULATING TABLES WITH DATA ATTRIBUTES, RUNNING INTERNAL TOPOLOGICAL QUALITY ASSESSMENTS, AND WRITING METADATA FOR EACH QUADRANGLE. ALL NEW DATA WILL BE GENERATED BY A GEOLOGIST SPECIALIZING IN GEMS AND REVIEWED BY A DIVISION MANAGER. UPON COMPLETION, THE DATA PRODUCTS WILL BE UPLOADED TO THE INTERNET AND MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMESTHE DELIVERABLES WILL BE HIGH QUALITY GEOLOGICALLY BASED GEOSPATIAL DATA (LEVEL 3 GEMS FORMATTED GIS FILES) THAT WILL BE SHARED WITH THE PUBLIC. INTERNALLY, THIS WILL HELP PROGRESS GSA S GOALS OF CONVERTING ALL GSA MAPS TO GEOSPATIAL DATA, THUS, INCREASING ANALYTICAL CAPABILITY AND APPLICATION OF THE MAPS IN OTHER PROJECTS. EXTERNALLY, WE EXPECT THESE DATA TO BE USED AND APPLIED IN VARIOUS LOCAL AND STATE GEOLOGIC, HYDROLOGIC, ENVIRONMENTAL, DEVELOPMENT, AND PLANNING PROJECTS. WITHIN THE LAST TEN YEARS, REQUESTS FROM THE PUBLIC FOR GSA S GEOLOGIC MAPS HAS GROWN, WITH INCREASING NUMBERS OF REQUESTS FOR THE MAPS  GIS DATA SPECIFICALLY. WE ANTICIPATE THIS PROJECT WILL HELP SUPPLY THE PUBLIC WITH THE MAP FORMAT THAT THEY NEED THE MOST FOR USE IN THEIR OWN WORK.INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)BENEFICIARIES OF OUR GEOLOGIC MAPS HAVE INCLUDED CITY, STATE, AND FEDERAL AGENCIES  GEOLOGIC, HYDROLOGIC, AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONSULTING FIRMS  MINERAL EXPLORATION COMPANIES  LOCAL AND REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSIONS  EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCIES  URBAN DEVELOPERS, CIVIL ENGINEERS, AND BUILDERS  HOMEOWNERS AND FARMERS  AND UNIVERSITY RESEARCHERS. THE END USERS OFTEN INCORPORATE GEOLOGIC MAPS AS PART OF THEIR DECISION-MAKING PROCESSES IN PROJECTS RELATED TO ENVIRONMENT, NATURAL RESOURCES, GEOLOGIC HAZARDS, LAND MANAGEMENT, AND MORE.

PROJECT TITLE: MULTICOMPONENT MAPPING OF HYDROTHERMAL SYSTEMS TO EXPLORE SURFACE SUBSURFACE INTERACTIONS IN AN ACTIVE CALDERAPROJECT PERIOD: 05 03 2023 THROUGH 05 02 2024THE VALLES CALDERA IN THE JEMEZ MOUNTAINS, NEW MEXICO (VALLES SAN ANTONIO QUADRANGLE) EXHIBITS MODERN HYDROTHERMAL AND FUMAROLIC ACTIVITY. THE  22-KM-DIAMETER CALDERA PRODUCED LARGE ERUPTIONS ( 300 KM3) AT LEAST TWICE. RECENT ERUPTIONS ( 50-73 KA) ALONG WITH THE PRESENCE OF HOT SPRINGS INDICATE AN ACTIVE MAGMA BODY. THE EXISTING GEOLOGIC INFORMATION FOR THE CALDERA HAS NOT BEEN INTEGRATED WITH PREVIOUS INVESTIGATIONS DOCUMENTING THE GAS AND HOT SPRING GEOCHEMISTRY. THUS, IT IS NOT WELL KNOWN HOW THE SHALLOW GEOLOGY AND HYDROTHERMAL GEOCHEMISTRY ARE RELATED WITHIN THE VALLES MAGMATIC SYSTEM. THERE ARE FEW STUDIES THAT PROVIDE THIS TYPE OF COMPREHENSIVE UNDERSTANDING FOR ANY HYDROTHERMAL SYSTEM. THE HYPOTHESIS MOTIVATING THIS PROPOSAL IS AS FOLLOWS: WATER CHEMISTRY AND GAS FLUXES ARE DIRECTLY CONTROLLED BY THE MAGMA BODY AND SUBSEQUENT INTERACTIONS WITH THE SHALLOW GEOLOGY. THEREFORE, MR. JACOB KRAMER UNDER THE GUIDANCE OF PROFESSORS HILAIRY HARTNETT AND AMANDA CLARKE, WILL CREATE A HIGH-RESOLUTION, MULTI-PARAMETER MAP OF THE SULFUR SPRINGS AREA WITHIN THE VALLES CALDERA NATIONAL PRESERVE. THE MAP WILL INCLUDE GEOLOGIC UNITS, STRUCTURAL FEATURES, LOCATIONS AND CHARACTERISTICS OF GEOTHERMAL FEATURES SUCH AS WARM SPRINGS, FUMAROLES, AND HOT MUD PITS. OVERLAIN WILL BE WATER AND GAS CHEMISTRY AND QUANTITATIVE GAS CONCENTRATIONS AND FLUXES. THE GOAL IS TO CHARACTERIZE THE INTERACTIONS BETWEEN THE MAGMA BODY, UNDERLYING GEOLOGY, AND MIGRATING FLUIDS  CHARACTERISTICS OF THE MAGMA BODY ARE CONSTRAINED BY THE YOUNGEST VOLCANIC UNITS. IF THE FLUID SYSTEMS ARE INDEED CONTROLLED BY THE MAGMA BODY, THEY COULD BE USED TO MONITOR ACTIVE CALDERAS. FURTHERMORE, THE PROPOSED WORK WILL PROVIDE IMPORTANT CONTEXT FOR FUTURE ASTROBIOLOGICAL STUDIES OF THE VALLESS MICROBIAL SYSTEM, WHICH MAY HAVE IMPLICATIONS FOR HYDROTHERMAL AND VOLCANIC SYSTEMS ON OTHER WORLDS.

PROJECT TITLE:  GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF PRIORITY AREAS IN WISCONSIN PROJECT PERIOD:  06 01 2023 THROUGH 05 31 2025AWARD PURPOSE THIS AWARD PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE WISCONSIN GEOLOGICAL AND NATURAL HISTORY SURVEY TO COMPLETE GEOLOGIC MAPPING PROJECTS IN PRIORITY AREAS AS IDENTIFIED BY THEIR LONG-RANGE MAPPING PLAN AND SUPPORTED BY THE WISCONSIN GEOLOGIC MAPPING ADVISORY COMMITTEE. FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE AWARD IS MATCHED BY AT LEAST 1:1 WITH STATE-PROVIDED FUNDING. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED PLANNED ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MAPPING OF QUATERNARY AND BEDROCK GEOLOGY, DIGITIZATION OF PRIOR AND ONGOING MAPPING, FIELD WORK AND SAMPLING, DRILLING AND DOCUMENTATION OF ROCK AND SEDIMENT CORES, LABORATORY ANALYSIS OF THE MINERALOGY GEOCHEMISTRY OF ROCK AND SEDIMENT SAMPLES, TRAVEL TO CONFERENCES TO PRESENT WORK AND ENGAGE IN PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND THE PREPARATION AND PUBLICATION OF THE RESULTING GEOLOGIC MAPS AND REPORTS. DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES DELIVERABLES FOR THIS AWARD PERIOD INCLUDE UNPUBLISHED, PRELIMINARY GEOLOGIC MAPS AND AN ACCOMPANYING TECHNICAL REPORT FROM THE BARABOO HILLS REGION, A PORTION OF WESTERN CRAWFORD COUNTY, AND COUNTY-SCALE MAPS OF LAFAYETTE, SAUK AND SOUTHWESTERN JUNEAU, HALF OF JACKSON, HALF OF GREEN, AND JEFFERSON COUNTIES IN WI. NON-MAP DELIVERABLES INCLUDE DIGITAL GEOLOGIC MAP DATABASES OF PREVIOUSLY-PUBLISHED (PAPER ONLY) GEOLOGIC MAPS FROM THE COUNTIES BORDERING LAKE SUPERIOR, AS WELL AS ONEIDA, VILAS, FLORENCE, LANGLADE, FOREST, MARATHON, TAYLOR, OZAUKEE, WASHINGTON, AND WINNEBAGO COUNTIES. ADDITIONAL NON-MAP DELIVERABLES INCLUDE AN UNPUBLISHED, PRELIMINARY DIGITAL RASTER SURFACE OF THE BASE MAQUOKETA FM IN NE WI, A PRELIMINARY, REGIONAL-SCALE QUATERNARY GEOLOGY MAP OF THE SOUTHERN DRIFTLESS AREA, A SPREADSHEET COMPILATION OF ALL AVAILABLE WGNHS DOWNHOLE BEDROCK STRATIGRAPHIC DATA FROM ACROSS THE STATE, AND INDEX MAPS SHOWING THE INVENTORY OF ALL BEDROCK AND QUATERNARY GEOLOGY GIS DATA AVAILABLE FROM WGNHS. FUTURE OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE THE PUBLICATION OF THE PRELIMINARY GEOLOGIC MAPS LISTED ABOVE FOLLOWING COMPLETION OF THE MAPPING AND SUCCESSFUL PEER REVIEW. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE, BROADLY, ALL RESIDENTS OF WISCONSIN INCLUDING PUBLIC, PRIVATE, AND ACADEMIC ORGANIZATIONS. SPECIFICALLY, THE PRODUCTS WILL BENEFIT LAND USE PLANNERS, ENVIRONMENTAL CONSULTANTS, SCIENTISTS INTERESTED IN THE GEOLOGIC HISTORY OF THE REGION, INTERESTED RESIDENTS, AND STATE AND FEDERAL GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES NO SUBRECIPIENTS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS AWARD.

PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYPROJECT TITLE: QUATERNARY GEOLOGY, BEDROCK TOPOGRAPHY, AND DRIFT THICKNESS MAPPING OF WESTERN LICKING COUNTY, OHIOPROJECT PERIOD: 08 01 2023 - 07 31 2025PURPOSETHE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO CONDUCT GEOLOGIC MAPPING IN THE WESTERN HALF OF LICKING COUNTY. THE OHIO GEOLOGICAL SURVEY WILL BE PUBLISHING THREE NEW MAPS THAT DEPICT THE STRATIGRAPHIC RELATIONSHIPS OF GLACIAL SEDIMENTS, THE ELEVATION OF THE BEDROCK SURFACE, AND THE TOTAL THICKNESS OF GLACIAL AND POST-GLACIAL UNCONSOLIDATED MATERIALS. THESE MAPS AND ASSOCIATED DATA INFORM PLANNERS, ENGINEERS, SCIENTISTS, LANDOWNERS, AND GOVERNMENT AGENCIES HOW BEST TO CONSERVE NATURAL RESOURCES AND PROTECT VULNERABLE GROUNDWATER AQUIFERS. AGGREGATE RESOURCES, WHICH CAN BE DERIVED FROM GLACIAL SAND-AND-GRAVEL, IS A VALUABLE COMMODITY FOR THE CONSTRUCTION INDUSTRY, ESPECIALLY IN AN AREA LIKE WESTERN LICKING COUNTY THAT IS EXPERIENCING RAPID POPULATION GROWTH CENTERED AROUND THE CONSTRUCTION OF HIGHLY SPECIALIZED MANUFACTURING. THIS SAME POPULATION GROWTH ALSO INCREASES THE DEMAND FOR GROUND WATER, WHICH IS PRIMARILY SOURCED FROM GLACIALLY DERIVED GROUNDWATER AQUIFERS IN WESTERN LICKING COUNTY.ACTIVITIESTHE OHIO GEOLOGICAL SURVEY WILL BE USING TRADITIONAL FIELD MAPPING TECHNIQUES, DRILLING, AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA COLLECTION TO CHARACTERIZE AND STUDY GLACIAL SEDIMENTS IN WESTERN LICKING COUNTY. SURVEY GEOLOGISTS WILL VISIT FIELD SITES WHERE OUTCROPS, OR EXPOSURES OF SUBSURFACE GEOLOGIC UNITS, ARE AVAILABLE TO DESCRIBE THE STRATIGRAPHIC RELATIONSHIPS AND CHARACTERIZE THE TEXTURE AND LITHOLOGY OF THESE SEDIMENTS. WHERE OUTCROPS ARE NOT AVAILABLE, SURVEY GEOLOGISTS WILL CONDUCT SUBSURFACE INVESTIGATIONS BY DIGGING SOIL PITS OR HAND AUGERING TO DESCRIBE AND CHARACTERIZE SEDIMENTS. THREE DEEP ROTOSONIC CORES WILL BE COLLECTED ACROSS WESTERN LICKING COUNTY WHERE BURIED VALLEYS ARE FILLED WITH THICK PACKAGES OF GLACIAL MATERIALS. THESE BURIED BEDROCK VALLEYS WILL BE MAPPED USING A PASSIVE SEISMIC GEOPHYSICAL TECHNIQUE THAT MEASURES THE DEPTH TO BEDROCK. A TOTAL OF 853 GEOPHYSICAL FIELD STATIONS ARE PLANNED ACROSS WESTERN LICKING COUNTY TO MODEL THE ELEVATION OF THE BURIED BEDROCK SURFACE.DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMESTHE DATA COLLECTION DESCRIBED ABOVE WILL BE COMBINED WITH EXISTING DATASETS TO PRODUCE THREE NEW GEOLOGIC MAPS: QUATERNARY GEOLOGY OF WESTERN LICKING COUNTY, OHIO  BEDROCK TOPOGRAPHY OF WESTERN LICKING COUNTY, OHIO  AND DRIFT THICKNESS OF WESTERN LICKING COUNTY, OHIO. THESE THREE INDIVIDUAL MAP PRODUCTS WILL BE PUBLISHED AT 1:62,500 SCALES AND AUTHORED AT 1:24,000 SCALES. TOGETHER THESE THREE MAPS WILL FULLY CHARACTERIZE THE THREE-DIMENSIONAL STRATIGRAPHIC FRAMEWORK OF THE UNCONSOLIDATED GLACIAL SEDIMENTS AND THE ELEVATION OF UNDERLYING PALEOZOIC BEDROCK IN WESTERN LICKING COUNTY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESTHE PRIMARY INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS WORK ARE THE CITIZENS AND LOCAL (MUNICIPAL AND COUNTY) GOVERNMENTS WHO ARE CONCERNED ABOUT THE IMPACT OF POPULATION GROWTH ON THE AVAILABILITY OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND GROUNDWATER. SCIENTISTS, ENGINEERS, PLANNERS, CONSULTANTS, AND OTHERS INVOLVED IN THE SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT OF THIS AREA WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS MAPPING AND IMPROVED STRATIGRAPHIC FRAMEWORK.

PROJECT TITLE: NOVEL LIDAR-XRF STRUCTURAL GEOCHEMICAL MAPPING OF THE KINGS PALACE, CARLSBAD CAVERNSPROJECT PERIOD: 08 1 2023- 07 31 2024 AWARD PURPOSE CARLSBAD CAVERNS,NEW MEXICO, IS A WORLD HERITAGE SITE AND AS SUCH IS ONE OF THE MOST ACCESSIBLE SITES FOR BOTHPUBLIC ACCESS AND SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH. EARLY RESULTS BY OTHER RESEARCHES HAVE CONFIRMED THEEFFICIENCY OF LIDAR MAPPING IN THE CAVE FOR ARCHEOLOGICAL INCENTIVES, BUT THE RESEARCH TOPICSTHIS EDMAP PROPOSAL ADDRESSES AND WHICH WILL IN A NEW WAY INTEGRATE STATE-OF-THE-ART LIDARAND XRF TECHNOLOGY ARE THE ACQUISITION OF FUNDAMENTAL SCIENTIFIC INFORMATION AS A 2023BENCHMARK OF THE SPATIAL DISTRIBUTION AND POTENTIAL STRATIGRAPHIC RELATIONSHIPS WITHIN THE KINGSPALACE OF 1) SPELEOTHEM MINERAL COMPOSITION, 2) SPELEOTHEM AND KARST GEOMORPHOLOGY ANDPALEO-PIEZOMETRIC SURFACES, 3)ANCIENT SOLUTION FLUTES DEMARKING THE SULFURIC ACID DIGESTIONPATHWAYS, 4) FAULT AND FRACTURES ESPECIALLY WELL PRESERVED ON THE CAVERN CEILING. IT MAY BEPOSSIBLE FROM THESE DATA TO PERFORM PALEOSTRAIN ORIENTATIONS WHICH LED TO THE CREATION AND CLOSURE OF DISSOLUTION CONDUITS AND COMPOSITIONAL PRECIPITATION VARIANTS AS WELL AS POTENTIALLY HIGHLIGHT AREAS OF FRACTURE INTERSECTIONS WHICH MAY BE ZONES OF STRUCTURAL WEAKNESS AND FUTURE INSTABILITIES WITHIN THE CAVERN IF SEISMICALLY INITIATED. ACTIVITIES PI PROPOSES TO SPATIALLY MAP THE INTERIOR OF PORTIONS OF CARLSBAD CAVERNS WITH RESOLUTION HIGHER THAN 5MM AT 800M VIA RIEGLVZ-400 CALIBRATED WITH THERMO NITON XL3T XRF. THE PROJECT WILL SEEK TO ADDRESS THE RELATIONSHIP OF MINERAL COMPOSITION TO SPELEOTHEM DISTRIBUTION, CEILING FRACTURE- FAULT ORIENTATIONS, AND SULFURIC ACID FLUTE TRAJECTORIES WHICH COULD HELP RESEARCHERS WITH THE FUNDAMENTAL SCIENCE QUESTIONS PREVIOUSLY POSED. IN ADDITION, THROUGH PROCESSING OF THE 3D MESH OF POINT CLOUD DATA, RECIPIENT MAY BE ABLE TO DESIGNATE FRACTURE DENSITIES AND HIGHLIGHT ZONES OF POTENTIAL STRUCTURAL WEAKNESS FOR FUTURE LOCAL-REGIONAL SEISMIC EVENTS. TO CONDUCT THIS RESEARCH, RECIPIENT PLANS TO HAVE FOUR FIELD RESEARCH PERIODS AT CARLSBAD SEPARATED BY A FOLLOW-UP RETURN TO FACILITIES AT THE UNIVERSITY OF OKLAHOMA (OU) TO CONDUCT THE REQUISITE COMPUTER PROCESSING. IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THE ACTUAL DATES FOR PLANNING THE FIELD VISITS WILL BEAT THE CONVENIENCE OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE. THE FIRST RECONNAISSANCE VISIT WILL BE FOR 5 DAYS, IDEALLY AT NIGHT TO AS TO MINIMIZE THE IMAGING OF TOURISTS BY THE LIDAR, WITH RANGER SUPERVISION AND, AS HAS BEEN PREVIOUSLY COMMUNICATED TO THE NEW MEXICO BUREAU OF GEOLOGY AND MINERAL RESOURCES, ONE OR MORE OF THEIR STAFF AS GUESTS. THIS FIRST VISIT WILL BE PRIMARILY FOR TESTING AND LOOKING AT TARGET REFLECTOR LOCATIONS. THEN RECIPIENT WILL RETURN TO OU, PROCESS THE ACQUIRED DATA, AND THEN PLAN AT THE PARKS CONVENIENCE THE FOLLOWING THREE PHASES OF DATA ACQUISITION. PHASES I AND II WILL BE FOR 10 DAYS EACH AND FINALLY PHASE III WILL BE A WRAP UP FOR 5 DAYS.  DELIVERABLESTHE DELIVERABLES WHICH WILL BE PROVIDED TO THE USGS, NEW MEXICO BUREAU, AND NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, ARE ENVISIONED TO BE THE FOLLOWING TRI-AUTHORED PRODUCTS: 1. LIDAR REFLECTANCE POINT CLOUD DATA OF KINGS PALACE AND CONNECTION TO BIG ROOM2. LIDAR 3D AND 2D MAPS3. POINT CLOUD MESH TRIANGULATION FOR FRACTURE AND FAULT ANALYSIS AND STEREONET OUTPUT4. 3D AND 2D MAPS OF STRUCTURES, SPELEOTHEM AND VARIOUS KARSTIC MORPHOLOGIES5. MINERALOGIC HETEROGENEITIES IN COLOR6. DELINEATION OF FLUTES ON CEILING INDICATING PALEOACID FLOW DIRECTIONS INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)  THE BENEFITS OF THIS MAPPING PROJECT AND ASSOCIATED SCIENTIFIC INVESTIGATIONS WILL BE: MENTORING OF THE SUPPORTED STUDENT.  ADDITIONALLY, THE PROPOSED ACTIVITY WILL BENEFIT THE USGS, THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, AND THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO IN MAKING AVAILABLE THESE RESULTS DURING THE 100TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE OPENING OF CARLSBAD CAVERNS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES NONE

TITLE:  A DEPTH-TO-BEDROCK MAP OF THE PUUMAKAALA 7.5 QUADRANGLE TO INFORM LAND MANAGEMENT DECISIONS ON THE ISLAND OF HAWAII, USAPROJECT PERIOD:  06 01 2023 - 05 31 2024PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO MENTOR MASTERS STUDENTS TO INTEGRATE FIELD- BASED SOIL AND GEOPHYSICAL DATA COLLECTION WITH LABORATORY ANALYSES IN A GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM TO PRODUCE A DEPTH-TO-BEDROCK MAP OF THE PUUMAKAALA 7.5 QUADRANGLE AND AN ACCOMPANYING REPORT.ACTIVITIES: THE PROJECT WILL INVOLVE FIELD-BASED COLLECTION OF SOIL CORES, AND GROUND-PENETRATING RADAR (GPR) DATA GUIDED BY EXISTING SOIL SURVEY MAPS. LAB WORK WILL CHARACTERIZE SOILS FOR TAXONOMY AND COMPARISON WITH EXISTING SOIL MAPS. PROCESSED DATA WILL BE USED TO ASSEMBLE GRIDDED CROSS SECTIONS, FROM WHICH SUBSURFACE CHARACTERIZATIONS AND DEPTH TO BEDROCK CONTOURS WILL BE INTERPOLATED.DELIVERABLES: THESE DELIVERABLES WILL INFORM LAND AND WATER MANAGEMENT DECISIONS AS WELL AS HAZARD MITIGATION PLANS BY PROVIDING IMPORTANT HIGH-RESOLUTION DETAILS ABOUT THE DISTRIBUTION OF SOIL THICKNESS RESULTING FROM THE INTERACTIONS OF PARENT ROCK AND THE INTENSE CHEMICAL WEATHERING FOUND IN THE TROPICAL CLIMATE OF THE WINDWARD (WET) SIDE OF THE ISLAND.

PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYPROJECT TITLE: BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE MOUNTAIN AND SHAY LAKE 7.5 QUADRANGLES SOUTH AND EAST OF THE 1837 CEDED TERRITORY LINEPROJECT PERIOD: 07 15 2023- 07 14 2023AWARD PURPOSE THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A MENTORED FIELD MAPPING EXPERIENCE FOR A STUDENT ATTENDING THE UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN - GREEN BAY, WHO OTHERWISE WOULD NOT RECEIVE SUPPORT FOR FIELDWORK INSIDE OF THE EXISTING UNIVERSITY COURSE CURRICULUM AND RESOURCES. THE STUDENTS WILL MAP AREAS SOUTH AND EAST OF THE CEDED TERRITORIES (1837) LINE IN THE SOUTHERN MOUNTAIN AND SHAY LAKE 7.5 QUADRANGLES IN NORTHEASTERN WISCONSIN, EXPLORING VARIED LITHOLOGIC AND STRUCTURAL UNITS COMMON TO THIS REGION. THIS WORK WILL EXTEND A PREVIOUS USGS MAP OF PRECAMBRIAN BEDROCK, AND WILL ATTEMPT TO FURTHER CONSTRAIN THE CONTACT BETWEEN THE WAUPEE VOLCANICS AND THE WOLF RIVER BATHOLITH. THE STUDENT WILL LEARN THE PROCESS AND DETAILS OF PRODUCING A FINAL, DIGITIZED PRODUCT, INTEGRATE LAB DATA WITH MAPS, AND EXECUTE MANAGEMENT ASPECTS OF FIELD WORK.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED SPRING 2023: JUNIOR   SENIOR RANKED UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT WILL TAKE GEOSCI 301  INTRODUCTION TO FIELD METHODS AND BE RECRUITED FROM THIS COURSE. THIS WILL INTRODUCE THE UNDERGRADUATE MAPPER TO THE BASICS OF FIELD METHODOLOGY AND SAFETY, AND FAMILIARIZE THEM WITH THE CONCEPTS NEEDED TO CREATE A GEOLOGIC MAP. SUMMER 2023: ORIENTATION, TRAINING, AND FIELD MAPPING WILL TAKE PLACE FOR TWO WEEKS IN LATE SUMMER OF 2023. THE ANTICIPATED START TIME FOR MAPPING IS 15 JULY, BUT MAY BE SHIFTED TO 1 AUGUST DEPENDING ON CONDITIONS, FUNDING LIMITATIONS, ETC. THE MAPPING PERIOD IS SET FOR 14 DAYS, WITH TWO DAYS OF ORIENTATION AND RECONNAISSANCE, TWO DAYS OF CLOSELY MENTORED MAPPING, AND 10 DAYS OF STUDENT-DIRECTED MAPPING. FALL 2023: THROUGHOUT THE FALL SEMESTER, THE STUDENT WILL BE TRAINED AND SUPERVISED IN COLLATION OF FIELD NOTES AND MAPS FOR DIGITIZATION AND MAP GENERATION, PREPARATION AND EXAMINATION OF THIN SECTIONS FOR DETAILED PETROGRAPHIC DESCRIPTIONS, AND PROCESSING OF SAMPLES FOR U PB GEOCHRONOLOGY. SPRING 2024: IN THE SPRING SEMESTER, THE RECIPIENT ANTICIPATES PERFORMING ZIRCON IMAGING AND ANALYSES FOR PAGE 6 OF 8 GEOCHRONOLOGY, PRODUCING THE DIGITIZED GEOPDF MAP AND FINAL REPORT, AND PREPARING AN ABSTRACT AND POSTER FOR NORTH-CENTRAL GSA OR INSTITUTE FOR LAKE SUPERIOR GEOLOGY MEETINGS. FINAL MATERIALS WILL BE SUBMITTED TO USGS BY LATE SPRING SEMESTER.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES THE DELIVERABLE WILL BE A GEOPDF OF THE BEDROCK GEOLOGY OF THE MAP AREA SOUTH AND EAST OF THE 1837 CEDED TERRITORY, CONSTRUCTED ON THE MOST RECENT (MOUNTAIN, WI: 2018  SHAY LAKE, WI: 2022) USGS 1:24,000 TOPOGRAPHIC BASE MAP. A NORTH-CENTRAL GSA ABSTRACT AND POSTER FEATURING THE MAP AND ASSOCIATED LABORATORY FINDINGS WILL BE GENERATED AS WELL, ANTICIPATED FOR THE 2024 SECTION MEETING. DELIVERABLES WILL BE SENT TO THE USGS UPON THE CONCLUSION OF THE PROJECT.INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES) WISCONSIN IS A POPULAR TOURIST DESTINATION IN LARGE PART TO THE NATURAL BEAUTY OF THE LAND, AND MANY OF THESE VISITORS ARE INTERESTED IN THE NATURAL HISTORY OF THE LANDSCAPE THEY ENJOY WHILE VISITING PUBLIC LANDS. THE PROPOSED MAP AREA WILL DOCUMENT THE BEDROCK GEOLOGY AND GEOLOGIC HISTORY OF PORTIONS OF CHEQUAMEGONNICOLET NATIONAL FOREST AND OCONTO COUNTY FOREST LAND. AREAS OF PUBLIC INTEREST INCLUDE THE BAGLEY RIVER CAMPGROUND AND BUTLER ROCK, A NATURAL FEATURE VISITED BY MANY TOURISTS TO THE REGION. IN ADDITION, STRUCTURAL MEASUREMENTS MADE OVER THE COURSE OF MAPPING, SUCH AS THE DOCUMENTATION OF BEDROCK FRACTURE NETWORKS IN THE BEDROCK, MAY PROVIDE INSIGHTS INTO THE HYDROGEOLOGY OF THE REGION BEYOND THE SURFICIAL AQUIFER DEPOSITS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES, IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT THE TIME OF AWARD. NONE

TITLE: BEDROCK AND SURFICIAL GEOLOGICAL MAPPING OF THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE GRAYS PEAK 7.5 QUADRANGLE, CENTRAL COLORADO FRONT RANGEPROJECT PERIOD: 05 15 2023 - 05 14 2024PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO PRODUCE A 1:24,000 BEDROCK AND SURFICIAL GEOLOGICAL MAP OF THESOUTHERN HALF OF THE GRAYS PEAK 7.5 QUADRANGLE IN THE CENTRAL COLORADO FRONT RANGE, AND TO INVESTIGATETHE GEOLOGICAL HISTORY FROM THE PALEOPROTEROZOIC TO THE QUATERNARY. MAPPING WILL BE CONDUCTED DURINGTHREE MONTHS IN THE SUMMER OF 2023. ONE OR MORE FELSIC IGNEOUS ROCKS WITH CLEAR STRUCTURALRELATIONSHIPS WILL BE SAMPLED TO CONSTRAIN THE AGE OF FOLDS. ZIRCON WILL BE SEPARATED FROM SELECTEDSAMPLES, MOUNTED IN EPOXY, POLISHED, AND IMAGED USING CATHODOLUMINESCENCE.DELIVERABLES:DEVELOPMENT OF A GEOLOGICAL MAP OF THE MONTEZUMA QUADRANGLE WITH A DIGITAL TOPOGRAPHICAL BASE MAP. USGS STATEMAP GUIDELINES WILL BE FOLLOWED (HTTP:  NGMDB.USGS.GOV INFO STANDARDS DATAEXCH STATEMAPGUIDELINES.HTML  HTTP:  NGMDB.USGS.GOV INFO CARTORES ) IN PREPARATION FOR PUBLICATION.

PROJECT TITLE:  MAPPING AND STRUCTURAL ANALYSIS OF THE CAROLINA TERRANE  CHURCHLAND PLUTON CONTACT IN THENORTH CAROLINA PIEDMONTPROJECT PERIOD: 08 1 2023- 07 31 2024 AWARD PURPOSE THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE PROPOSED MAPPING IS TO MAP THE CONTACT BETWEEN THE CAROLINATERRANE AND THE CHURCHLAND PLUTON, WHICH IS THE SOUTHERN CONTINUATION OF THE HYCO SHEAR ZONE.THE PROJECT WILL DOCUMENT LITHOTECTONIC AND STRUCTURAL TRENDS ALONG THIS MAJOR TERRANE BOUNDARYIN THE PIEDMONT PROVINCE OF NORTH CAROLINA, AND PROVIDE TWO NEW HIGH-PRECISION ID-TIMSZIRCON U-PB GEOCHRONOLOGY AGES ON THE CHURCHLAND PLUTON AND PROXIMAL DIORITIC INTRUSIONS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED THE PROPOSED MAPPING AREA IS A NE-SW ZONE COMPRISING THE CONTACT BETWEEN THE CAROLINA TERRANE IN THE SOUTHEAST WITH THE CHURCHLAND PLUTON TO THE NORTHWEST. PRIOR TO THE FIELDWORK, RECIPIENT WILL CONTACT ANY PRIVATE LANDOWNERS AND COORDINATE WITH NCGS GEOLOGISTS TO OBTAIN NECESSARY PERMITS AND PERMISSIONS. RECIPIENT WILL START IN THE LAKE BRANDT QUADRANGLE, UTILIZING THE OUTCROPS IDENTIFIED IN THE CITIZEN SCIENTIST CONTRIBUTION, THEN MAP NORTHEAST INTO THE BROWNS SUMMIT QUADRANGLE. SUBMITTED CITIZEN SCIENTIST SAMPLES INDICATE INCREASING MYLONITIZATION IN THE CHURCHLAND PLUTON NEAR THE CAROLINA TERRANE CONTACT AS WELL AS STRONG FOLIATIONS IN THE CAROLINA TERRANE. INITIAL MAPPING GOALS ARE TO 1) ESTABLISH THE RELATIVE ORIENTATIONS OF STRUCTURAL FABRICS ACROSS THE CONTACT AND 2) ASSESS THE CURRENT MAPPED CONTACT LOCATION. NCGS GEOLOGISTS WILL ASSIST IN INITIAL FIELD AREA ORIENTATION AND RECOGNITION OF KEY LITHOLOGIES. RECIPIENT WILL UNDERTAKE BEDROCK MAPPING TO GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE CONTACT BETWEEN THE CAROLINA TERRANE AND CHURCHLAND PLUTON AS IT CORRESPONDS TO THE SOUTHWEST EXTENT OF THE HYCO SZ. RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT STRUCTURAL ORIENTATIONS INCLUDING ROCK FABRICS (FOLIATIONS AND LINEATIONS), BRITTLE FEATURES (FAULTS, FRACTURES), AND ANY OTHER KINEMATIC INDICATORS OBSERVED IN THE ROCKS (S-C FABRICS, PORPHYROCLASTS, AND OTHER SHEAR-SENSE INDICATORS). SAMPLES WILL BE COLLECTED OF ALL LITHOLOGIES TO OBSERVE MICROSTRUCTURALLY AND PETROLOGICALLY IN THIN SECTION. WILL ALSO COLLECT TWO SAMPLES TO DATE USING HIGH-PRECISION IDTIMS ZIRCON U-PB. WILL TARGET THE CHURCHLAND PLUTON AND INTRUSIVES WITHIN THE CAROLINA TERRANE FOR GEOCHRONOLOGY. GEOCHRONOLOGIC ANALYSIS WILL BE COMPLETED BY THE STUDENT MAPPER AT UNC-CHAPEL HILL IN DR. DREW COLEMANS ISOTOPE GEOCHRONOLOGY LABORATORY. DELIVERABLE PRODUCTS UPON COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT THE STUDENT MAPPER WILL PRODUCE AN APPROXIMATELY 50 MI2STRIP MAP OF THE CAROLINA TERRANE-CHURCHLAND PLUTON CONTACT AT THE 1:50,000 SCALE SPANNING THE BROWNS SUMMIT AND LAKE BRANDT 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLES. THE DIGITAL COMPILATION OF FIELD MAPPING WILL BE DONE USING ARCPRO  STRUCTURAL FIELD DATA (ROCK FABRICS, KINEMATIC INDICATORS) WILL BE COMPILED USING ROSE DIAGRAMS AND STEREONETS PRODUCED IN STEREONET COMPUTER PROGRAM (ALLMENDINGER ET AL., 2013). THE STUDENT WILL ALSO ACQUIRE TWO NEW HIGH PRECISION ID-TIMS ZIRCON U-PB AGES ON SAMPLES FROM THE CHURCHLAND PLUTON AND INTRUSIVES IN THE CAROLINA TERRANE TO ESTABLISH THE TEMPORAL RELATIONSHIP OF THE PLUTON TO PALEOZOIC DEFORMATION. THE FINAL MAP AND REPORT WILL BE DELIVERED AS A HIGH-QUALITY PDF TO THE EDMAP COORDINATOR BY JULY 2024. WILL ALSO SUBMIT GIS-BASED DATA IN THE GEMS SCHEMA TO THE NCGS FOR LATER INCORPORATION INTO THE NCGS FUTURE GREENSBORO 100K MAPPING PROJECT. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)  THE BENEFITS OF THIS MAPPING PROJECT AND ASSOCIATED SCIENTIFIC INVESTIGATIONS WILL BE: MENTORING OF THE SUPPORTED STUDENT.  ADDITIONALLY, THE PROPOSED MAPPING WILL BENEFIT THE NCGS IN HELPING TO PROGRESS TOWARDS A COHESIVE MAP AND MODEL FOR THIS MAJOR TERRANE BOUNDARY IN THE GREENSBORO 100K THAT WILL BE USED BY NCGS STAFF IN FUTURE COMPILATION EFFORTS IN DIRECT SUPPORT OF THE USGS GEOFRAMEWORK INITIATIVE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES, IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT THE TIME OF AWARD. NONE

PROJECT TITLE:  GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE SHELL RESERVOIR 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE, WYOMINGPROJECT PERIOD:  07 01 2023 - 06 30 2024PURPOSE: GOALS FOR THE PROPOSED PROJECT ARE TO 1) CONSTRUCT A DETAILED GEOLOGIC MAP (1:24,000 SCALE) OF THE SHELL RESERVOIR, 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE LOCATED NEAR SHELL, WY  AND 2) DETERMINE THE AGES AND GEOCHEMISTRY OF THE BASEMENT ROCK UNITS PRESENT. THE BROADER GOALS ARE TO CONTINUE TO DEFINE THE STRUCTURE, GEOCHRONOLOGY, AND GEOCHEMISTRY OF THE BIGHORN MOUNTAINS AND WYOMING ARCHEAN PROVINCE. IN ADDITION TO EXPOSED BASEMENT ROCKS, THIS MAP INTENDS TO ALSO COVER ANY LANDSLIDES THAT HAVE AFFECTED THE AREA.ACTIVITIES: THE GEOLOGY OF THE SHELL RESERVOIR QUAD. IS RIGOROUS, AND AS SUCH, THE SIX-PERSON FIELD PARTY WILL WORK TOGETHER FOR THE ENTIRE FIELD SEASON. THE TEAM  WILL ACCESS THE QUADRANGLE FROM VARIOUS 4WD ROADS AND SET UP A BASE CAMP AT EITHER THE SHELL RESERVOIR OR THE RANGER CREEK CAMPSITES FOR 3-4 DAYS AT A TIME. BOTH CAMPGROUNDS ARE LOCATED WITHIN (SHELL RESERVOIR) OR NORTH (RANGER CREEK) OF THE MAPPING AREA AND WILL MINIMIZE TRAVEL TIME. EACH MEMBER OF THE FIELD PARTY WILL BE TRAINED IN THE BASIC ELEMENTS OF WILDERNESS FIRST AID.DELIVERABLES: THE FINAL GEOLOGIC MAP WILL BE PREPARED AS A GEOPDF ON THE 2018 USGS DIGITAL TOPOGRAPHIC BASE MAP OF THE SHELL RESERVOIR QUAD. COMPILATION AND ANALYSIS WILL BE DONE ON ESRI ARCGIS SOFTWARE (V. 10.1.1) AND ADOBE ILLUSTRATOR GRAPHICS SOFTWARE. THIS DIGITAL FORMAT IS PARTICULARLY SUITABLE AS VARIOUS THEMES THAT ARE AVAILABLE ON THE MAP, SUCH AS BOUNDARIES, CONTOURS, LAND COVER, ETC. CAN BE TURNED OFF OR ON AS NEEDED. ACCOMPANYING CROSS SECTIONS, EXPLANATIONS OR OTHER THEMES WILL BE PROVIDED AS SEPARATE LAYERS.

PROJECT TITLE: GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THE BARTON 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE, NORTHWESTALABAMA: SEARCHING FOR EVIDENCE OF CRYPTIC STRUCTURES IN THE HIGHLAND RIMPROJECT PERIOD: 08 1 2023- 07 31 2024 AWARD PURPOSE THE SCIENTIFIC JUSTIFICATION FOR THIS PROJECT INCLUDES 3 MAJOR POTENTIAL OUTCOMES. DUE TO THE LIMITED SPATIAL STUDY SUPPORTED BY THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, PROJECT PERSONNEL WERE UNABLE TO DETAIL THE MAGNITUDE, AGE, AND REGIONAL DISTRIBUTION OF STRUCTURES IN THE AREA. BY MOVING INTO THE BARTON QUADRANGLE AREA, PERSONNEL WILL BE ABLE TO (1) ASSESS THE DISTRIBUTION OF GEOLOGIC STRUCTURES IN THE AREA AND HOW THAT MAY AFFECT ROCKS IN THE SUBSURFACE, WHICH INCLUDES MULTIPLE PETROLEUM RESERVOIRS AND AQUIFERS. MAPPING THE BASE OF THE HARTSELLE SANDSTONE WILL PROVIDE AN AGE CONTROL ON THE STRUCTURES BECAUSE (2) IF THE STRUCTURES ARE OUACHITA IN ORIGIN, THEY MAY BE MISSISSIPPIAN IN AGE, WITH THE HARTSELLE SANDSTONE EITHER FOLDED (FOLDS ARE LATE MISSISSIPPIAN OR YOUNGER) OR INFILLING PREEXISTING STRUCTURES (FOLDS ARE MISSISSIPPIAN). THE LATER DEVELOPMENT OF THE TENNESSEE RIVER AND HYPOTHESIS THAT THE TENNESSEE RIVER FOLLOWS SUBTLE STRUCTURES WILL BE TESTED, (3) PROVIDING INSIGHT INTO BEDROCK-RIVER INTERACTIONS IN A MAJOR SHIPPING CORRIDOR. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED GEOLOGIC MAPPING IN NORTHWEST ALABAMA WILL BEGIN IN AUGUST 1, 2023 AND CONCLUDE JULY3 1, 2024.  GEOLOGIC MAPPING IN NORTHWEST ALABAMA IS DIFFICULT IN SUMMER AND SPRING MONTHS DUE TO THICK VEGETATION. HUNTING SEASON ALSO LIMITS WORKING IN LATE NOVEMBER THROUGH EARLY FEBRUARY. THEREFORE, MAPPING IN FOREST AREAS IS LIMITED TO OCTOBER-NOVEMBER AND FEBRUARY-MARCH FOR SAFETY. PRELIMINARY ROAD-SIDE GEOLOGIC MAPPING WILL BEGIN WITH THE PI AND THE STUDENT MAPPERS IN AUGUST. A FIRST-YEAR GRADUATE STUDENT AND UNDERGRADUATE FIELD ASSISTANTS WILL CONDUCT FIELD MAPPING. THE PI WILL SPEND 2 WEEKS WITH THE PRIMARY MAPPERS AT THE END OF THE SUMMER AND INTO EARLY FALL TO FACILITATE EARLY MAPPING EFFORTS. THE PI WILL SPEND A THIRD WEEK DEDICATED TO TRAINING THE FIELD ASSISTANT IN THE AREA. AFTER TRAINING IN THE FALL SEMESTER, THE PRIMARY MAPPER AND FIELD ASSISTANT WILL CUMULATIVELY SPEND  14 DAYS IN THE FIELD IN THE FALL (BEYOND THE 3 WEEKS OF TRAINING) BEFORE FOCUSING ON DIGITIZATION OF FIELD DATA AND CONSTRUCTION OF THE GEOLOGIC MAP. AN ADDITIONAL  14 DAYS OF FIELD WORK WILL BE CONDUCTED IN JANUARY AND FEBRUARY, BEFORE THE VEGETATION RETURNS AND OBSCURES OUTCROPS. THE PI WILL BE PRESENT DURING THE FINAL WEEK IN NORTHWEST ALABAMA TO IDENTIFY DATA GAPS, RESOLVE ANY FINAL QUESTIONS, AND FIELD CHECK THE MAP TO ENSURE THEY ARE CONSISTENT WITH DEFINED UNITS AND NEARBY MAPS PRODUCED BY THE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY OF ALABAMA AND BY THE PI DURING THE NPS PROJECT. THE PRIMARY MAPPER WILL SPEND A MINIMUM OF 8 WEEKS TOTAL ACTIVELY MAPPING THEIR QUADRANGLE. DELIVERABLE PRODUCTS THE FOLLOWING MAPPING PRODUCTS WILL BE DELIVERED TO THE USGS AND ALABAMA GEOLOGICAL SURVEY FOLLOWING THE COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT:1. GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE BARTON 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE, ALABAMA, PDF PLATE 2. TECHNICAL REPORT, GEOLOGY OF THE BARTON 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE, NW ALABAMA GEOLOGIC MAP PLATES WILL INCLUDE 1:24,000 SCALE GEOLOGIC MAPS WITH BEDROCK UNITS, OVERLYING COLLUVIUM, HIGH TERRACE DEPOSITS, AND ALLUVIUM  CROSS SECTIONS THROUGH THE MAJOR STRUCTURES  CORRELATION OF MAP UNITS  AND DESCRIPTION OF MAP UNITS. GEOLOGIC MAPS WILL COVER 100  OF THE AREAL EXTENT OF THE PROPOSED QUADRANGLE. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)  THE BENEFITS OF THIS MAPPING PROJECT AND ASSOCIATED SCIENTIFIC INVESTIGATIONS WILL BE: MENTORING OF THE SUPPORTED STUDENT.  THIS PROJECT WILL FORM THE CORE OF A MASTERS STUDENTS THESIS RESEARCH, INVESTIGATING THE LINK BETWEEN APPALACHIAN-OUACHITA TECTONISM AND THE EVOLUTION OF THE TENNESSEE RIVER, BENEFITTING THE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY OF ALABAMA THROUGH COORDINATION AND COLLABORATIVE MAPPING EFFORTS IN THIS PRIORITY MAPPING AREA. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES, NONE

TITLE:  EXPLORING DYNAMIC ARC PROCESSES IN A TECTONICALLY REORGANIZED CRUSTAL SECTION THROUGH GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THE IRON MOUNTAIN PENDANT, WEST-CENTRAL SIERRA NEVADA, CALIFORNIAPROJECT PERIOD: 06 16 2023 - 06 15 2024PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE RESEARCH PROJECT IS TO GENERATE NEW 1:10,000 GEOLOGIC MAPS, CENTERED ON THE IRON MOUNTAIN PENDANT, THROUGH THE TRAINING OF GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT MAPPERS OVER 5 FIELD WEEKS. STUDENTS WILL BE TRAINED IN GEOLOGIC MAPPING IN REMOTE AREAS, IN GRID MAPPING COMPLEX OUTCROPS, AND WILL DEVELOP ANALYTICAL SKILLS THROUGH SUPPORTING PETROGRAPHY, GEOCHEMISTRY AND GEOCHRONOLOGY, AS WELL AS DIGITIZATION SKILLS USING ARCGIS.ACTIVITIES: PRIMARY GRADUATE (MS) MAPPERS WILL START IN MID-JUNE 2023 BY COMPILING EXISTING QUADRANGLE MAP DATA, SATELLITE IMAGERY, AND TOPOGRAPHIC MAPS OF THE STUDY AREA IN ARCGIS PRO, WITH TRAINING FROM THE PI IN THESE STEPS (FIG. 2A,B, OUTLINED). STUDENTS WILL ALSO HAVE ACCESS TO THE RECONNAISSANCE SAMPLE SET, COLLECTED IN 2016, TO GAIN ADDITIONAL TRAINING IN METAVOLCANIC ROCK IDENTIFICATION. IN PARALLEL, LOGISTICAL ARRANGEMENTS FOR TRAVEL, ACCOMMODATION, AND FIELDWORK SUPPLIES WILL BE MADE, WITH COORDINATION BETWEEN THE PI, GRADUATE STUDENT MAPPERS, AND UNDERGRADUATE FIELD ASSISTANTS. FIELDWORK PREPARATION IS EXPECTED TO TAKE 2 WEEKS.DELIVERABLES:  PRIMARY STUDENT GRADUATE MAPPERS WILL EACH GENERATE A  25 KM2 1:10,000 SCALE FIRST-AUTHOR GEOLOGIC MAP CENTERED ON THE IMP AND SURROUNDING PLUTONIC ROCKS (MAP BOUNDARIES IN FIG. 2).UNDERGRADUATE FIELD ASSISTANTS WILL BE SECONDARY AUTHORS OF THE MAP. EACH MAP WILL BE BUILT INTO AN ARCGIS DATABASE CONTAINING SAMPLE DATA (E.G., GEOCHRONOLOGY) AND GRID MAP DATA (AS APPROPRIATE).

PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYPROJECT TITLE: GEOLOGICAL MAPPING OF THE BORREGO SPRINGS SHEAR ZONE IN ANZA BORREGO DESERT STATE PARKPROJECT PERIOD: 07 20 2023- 07 19 2024 AWARD PURPOSE THE PRIMARY GOALS OF THE RESEARCH PROPOSED HERE, LED BY MS STUDENT LOVE AND BS STUDENT KABBARA, ANDTHEIR UNDERGRADUATE FIELD ASSISTANTS UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF PI AKCIZ ARE:1. TO PRODUCE PUBLISHABLE DIGITAL AND PAPER BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAPS WITH GEOLOGIC CROSS SECTIONS AT 1:24,000-SCALE OF THE BORREGO PALM CANYON 7.5 QUADRANGLE AND SOUTHERN QUARTER OF THE COLLINSVALLEY 7.5 QUADRANGLE. EXISTING BEDROCK MAPS OF THE REGION ARE AT SMALL SCALES.2. PROVIDING A UNIQUE, HANDS-ON EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE FOR ONE MS STUDENT AND THREE UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS WHO ADDRESS A SPECIFIC GEOLOGICAL QUESTION THROUGH GEOLOGICAL MAPPING, CHRONOLOGICAL AND MICROSTRUCTURAL ANALYSES, AN EXPERIENCE TYPICALLY NOT POSSIBLE WITHOUT SUCH A FUNDING THAT EMPHASIZES GEOLOGICAL FIELD MAPPING. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED THE PROPOSED PROJECT CONSISTS OF THREE COMPONENTS: (1) BEDROCK GEOLOGICAL MAPPING OF THE BORREGO PALM CANYON 7.5 QUADRANGLE AND THE SOUTHERN QUARTER OF THE COLLINS VALLEY 7.5 QUADRANGLE AT 1:24,000  (2) KINEMATIC AND STRAIN ANALYSES OF SAMPLES COLLECTED FROM WITHIN THE BSSZ  AND (3) U PB GEOCHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSES OF ZIRCONS SEPARATED FROM THE PROTOLITH OF THE BSSZ AS WELL AS THE DIFFERENT GENERATIONS OF SILLS AND CROSS-CUTTING DIKES TO DETERMINE THE INITIATION, DURATION AND TERMINATION OF SHEARING ALONG THE BSSZ.THIS RESEARCH WILL BUILD ON PRELIMINARY RESEARCH CONDUCTED BY PI AKCIZ AND TWO OF HIS UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS, ADAM WELLS AND JEREMY TORRES, WHO CONDUCTED PRELIMINARY STRUCTURAL AND GEOCHRONOLOGICAL INVESTIGATIONS ALONG THE MONTEZUMA HIGHWAY, JUST SOUTH OF THE BOREGO PALM CANYON QUADRANGLE. DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES  THE BEDROCK GEOLOGY OF THE BORREGO PALM CANYON 7.5 QUADRANGLE AND SOUTHERN QUARTER OF THE COLLINS VALLEY 7.5 QUADRANGLE WILL BE MAPPED AT 1:24,000. MAPS WILL BE PRODUCED DIGITALLY USING ARCMAP FOLLOWING THE GEMS GEODATABASE TEMPLATE PROVIDED BY CALIFORNIA GEOLOGICAL SURVEY. LOVE AND KABBARA WILL ALSO SUBMIT TECHNICAL REPORTS AND TRANSMITTAL LETTER IN PDF FORMAT TO THE EDMAP PROGRAM OFFICER BY JULY 19, 2024. ALL STRUCTURAL AND LITHOLOGIC DATA WILL BE UPLOADED ONTO THE STRABOSPOT ONLINE DATABASE. NEW AND EXISTING SAMPLE LOCATIONS AND GEOCHRONOLOGIC AGES WILL BE ADDED TO THE GEOCHRON.ORG DATABASE. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)  AND THE BENEFITS OF THESE MAPPING PROJECTS AND ASSOCIATED SCIENTIFIC INVESTIGATIONS WILL ADD DETAIL TO AN UNDERSTUDIED PART OF CALIFORNIA GEOLOGY AND PROVIDE THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY WITH A DETAILED, FIELD-BASED, ASSESSMENT OF THE TIMING AND SIGNIFICANCE OF THE BORREGO SPRINGS SHEAR ZONE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES, IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT THE TIME OF AWARD. NONE

PROJECT TITLE:  GEOLOGIC MAP OF PARTS OF THE EAGLE MOUNTAINS SE AND LOBO SW QUADRANGLES: COMPLEX LARAMIDE DEFORMATION IN THE INDIO MOUNTAINS, WESTERN TEXASPROJECT PERIOD:  07 01 2023 THROUGH 06 30 2024PURPOSE: THE INDIO MOUNTAINS REMAIN AN IMPORTANT, BUT POORLY INVESTIGATED RECORD OF CENOZOIC CONTRACTION THAT DOMINATED THE WESTERN U.S. PRIOR TO THE WORK OF CONLEY ET AL. (2022), SEVERAL THESIS PROJECTS HAD BEEN COMPLETED IN THE INDIO MOUNTAINS THAT INVOLVED A MAPPING COMPONENT (ROHRBAUGH, 2001  GUERRERO, 2015  SAHIN, 2015  RAMIREZ, 2018). ONLY ONE MAP HAD BEEN PUBLISHED OF THIS REGION, AND THIS WAS PART OF A LARGER SYNTHESIS OF THE ENTIRE INDIO MOUNTAINS AND EAGLE MOUNTAIN TO THE NORTH (FIG. 1) (UNDERWOOD, 1962). THE SCALE (1:48,000) OF THIS MAP DOES NOT ALLOW FOR DETAILED ANALYSISACTIVITIES: ALL MAPPING WILL BE COMPILED AND STORED ON DESKTOP COMPUTERS AND EXTERNAL HARD DRIVES AT UTEP. WHILE RAW DATA WILL BE STORED IN QGIS, ALL DATA WILL ALSO BE IMPORTED INTO ARCGIS TO BUILD POLYGONS FOR DIFFERENT FORMATIONS. THESE DATA WILL THEN BE EXPORTED TO ADOBE ILLUSTRATOR TO CONSTRUCT A FINALIZED GEOLOGIC MAP WITH ALL SYMBOLOGY AND MAP EXPLANATION.DELIVERABLES: MAPPING CONDUCTED DURING THIS PROJECT IN THE INDIO MOUNTAINS WILL YIELD SEVERAL BENEFITS TO SOCIETY. COMMUNITIES IN AND AROUND RIO GRANDE RIFT BASINS RELY ON THE AQUIFER SYSTEM WITHIN RIFT BASINS (E.G., PLUMMER ET AL., 2012). CONTINUOUS GROUNDWATER WITHDRAWALS IN HIGHLY POPULATED REGIONS HAVE RESULTED IN A DECLINE IN GROUNDWATER LEVELS IN EXCESS OF 120 FEET SINCE THE 1940 S (BEXFIELD AND ANDERHOLM, 2002), WHICH IS PROBLEMATIC BECAUSE A CONCEPTUAL MODEL OF THE TIMESCALES AND PROCESSES BY WHICH THE AQUIFER SYSTEM IS RECHARGED IS INCOMPLETE. AQUIFER SYSTEMS ARE HIGHLY DEPENDENT ON GEOLOGIC STRUCTURES, WHICH CAN EITHER ACT AS LEAKS OR SEALS WITHIN THE SYSTEM.

TITLE:  COMBINING SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAPPING, REMOTE SENSING, AND NUMERICAL MODELING FOR FAULT HAZARD ASSESSMENT IN THE NORTHERN TULAROSA BASIN, NEW MEXICOPROJECT PERIOD:  06 01 2023 - 05 31 2024PURPOSE: THIS DATA SYNTHESIS PROJECT WILL INTEGRATE NEOTECTONIC FIELD MAPPING, DIGITAL ELEVATION MODEL ANALYSIS, AND GEODYNAMIC MODELING TO IMPROVE MAP QUALITY, UNCERTAINTY, AND SEISMIC HAZARD ANALYSIS IN THE 1:200000 SOCORRO COUNTY GEOLOGIC MAP AND THE BULL GAP QUADRANGLES IN LINCOLN COUNTY, NEW MEXICOACTIVITIES: A FURTHER GOAL OF THIS COLLABORATION IS TO DESIGN WORKFLOWS FOR COMBINING REMOTE MAPPING AND MODELING IN ORDER TO (I) OPTIMIZE FIELD WORK FOCUS, (II) CONSTRAIN DEFORMATION MECHANISMS AND SEGMENTATION OF SLIP IN SLOWLY DEFORMING REGIONS, AND (III) CREATE A SERIES OF TESTABLE HYPOTHESES FOR 3D FAULT STRUCTURE AND ACTIVITY RATES THAT CAN BE REVISITED AND UPDATED IN FUTURE INVESTIGATIONS. CENTRAL NEW MEXICOS SLOWLY DEFORMING TECTONIC SETTING IS NOT AS HIGH-PRIORITY A TARGET FOR EARTHQUAKE HAZARD MODELING AS MORE SEISMICALLY ACTIVE REGIONS OF THE UNITED STATES.DELIVERABLES: DELIVERABLES TO BE SUBMITTED AT THE CONCLUSION OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL INCLUDE: (I) A 1:48000 MAP OF POSSIBLE FAULT SCARPS AND FAULT-RELATED DEFORMATION COVERING THE STUDY REGION (FIG. 1A), (II) NEOTECTONIC MAPS (1:10000) AT TWO LOCATIONS DOCUMENTING QUATERNARY FAULT ACTIVITY (FIGS. 1B AND 1C), AND A SET OF THERMO-MECHANICAL GEODYNAMIC MODELS OF SLIP TRANSFER PATHWAYS THROUGH THE TULAROSA BASIN, MODELED USING THE ASPECT SOFTWARE PACKAGE

PROJECT TITLE:  TERRANE, GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE HUNTER MESA 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE, WYOMINGPROJECT PERIOD:  07 01 2023 THROUGH 06 30 2024PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL INVOLVE THE CONSTRUCTION OF A DETAILED GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE HUNTER MESA, WYOMING 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE. THIS RESEARCH PROMISES TO ADVANCE THE SCIENTIFIC UNDERSTANDING OF THE ARCHEAN, PALEOGENE, AND QUATERNARY GEOLOGY OF THE EASTERN SUMMIT OF THE BIGHORN MOUNTAINS IN NORTH-CENTRAL WYOMING. TRADITIONAL GEOLOGIC MAPPING TECHNIQUES WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY STRUCTURAL ANALYSIS OF ROCK FABRIC AND ISOTOPIC AGE DETERMINATIONS. PALEOGENE STRATA OF THE WHITE RIVER GROUP AND GLACIAL SEDIMENTS OF THE PINEDALE FORMATION ALSO OCCUR IN THE QUADRANGLE.ACTIVITIES: MAPPING THE GEOLOGY OF THE BALD MOUNTAIN QUADRANGLE WILL BE LABORIOUS, AND AS SUCH, THE FOUR-PERSON FIELD PARTY WILL WORK TOGETHER FOR THE ENTIRE FOUR-WEEK FIELD SEASON. DELIVERABLES: THE DELIVERABLE WILL BE A GEOPDF OF THE BEDROCK GEOLOGY OF THE HUNTER MESA 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE CONSTRUCTED ON THE MOST RECENT USGS DIGITAL BASE MAP OF THE QUADRANGLE. THE FINAL REPORT WILL BE IN THE FORM OF A MOUNTAIN GEOLOGIST PUBLISHED PAPER. DELIVERABLES (GEOPDF AND MANUSCRIPT PDF AS THE TECHNICAL REPORT) WILL BE SENT TO THE U.S. GEOLOGICAL.

PROJECT TITLE:  STRUCTURAL EVOLUTION AND UPLIFT HISTORY OF MULTIPLE GENERATIONS OF RHYOLITE FLOWS IN THE SURVEY PEAK 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE: GRAND TETON NATIONAL PARK, NORTHWEST WYOMINGPROJECT PERIOD:   07 01 2023 - 06 30 2024PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT AIMS TO TEST THE HYPOTHESIS THAT (A) COLLAPSE OF THE NORTHERN PALEO-TETON RANGE INTO THE YELLOWSTONE CALDERA TRACK IS RECORDED BY PROGRESSIVE TILTING OF MAP UNITS THAT PREDATE THE COLLAPSE EVENTS, AND (B) THAT RESTORATION OF NORMAL FAULTS, UNIT TILTING, AND OTHER STRUCTURES ACCOMMODATING TOPOGRAPHIC COLLAPSE OF THE NORTHERN TETON RANGE CAN BE RESTORED IN A SEQUENCE THAT EITHER CONFIRMS OR INVALIDATES THE TETON COLLAPSE HYPOTHESIS.ACTIVITIES: MAPPING WILL BE CONDUCTED BY COLLECTING DATA ALONG TRAVERSES THAT ARE STRATEGICALLY TARGETED TO RESOLVE THE DETAILED STRUCTURAL ARCHITECTURE OF THE SURVEY PEAK QUADRANGLE AND THUS DIRECTLY ADDRESS THE MAPPING OBJECTIVES OF THIS STUDY. GEOLOGIC MAPPING WILL LEVERAGE PREVIOUS 1:62,500 MAPPING, LIDAR IMAGERY (NATIONAL PARK SERVICE 2014), AND AERIAL PHOTOGRAPHS. DATA WILL BE RECORDED USING A GPS-ENABLED IPAD (BACKED UP BY BLUE-TOOTH LINKED BAD ELF GPS PRO ) RUNNING FIELDMOVE SOFTWARE FROM PETROLEUM EXPERTS, WHICH ALLOWS FOR IMPORTING AND LAYERING OF MULTIPLE DATASETS (LIDAR AND TRADITIONAL USGS TOPOGRAPHIC BASE MAPS, AERIAL PHOTOS, EXISTING GEOLOGIC MAPS, ETC.), MEASUREMENT OF AND GPS LOCATION OF STRUCTURAL DATA, CAPTURE OF GEO-LOCATED AND ORIENTED FIELD PHOTOS AND NOTES, AND TOOLS FOR DIRECT EXPORT TO ARCGIS.DELIVERABLES: THE PROPOSED FIELD WORK WILL GENERATE A 1:24,000 SCALE BEDROCK MAP OF THE SOUTHERN 2 3 OF THE SURVEY PEAK QUADRANGLES IN THE PROPOSED MAPPING AREA, TO INCLUDE A PDF OF THE MAP WITH ACCOMPANYING PHOTOS, STRUCTURAL DATA, FULLY GEOREFERENCED SPATIAL DATA, AND A GEOLOGIC REPORT. ADDITIONALLY, A DIGITAL MAP WILL BE CONSTRUCTED IN ARCGIS FOR USE IN GIS PLATFORMS. BOUNDINGCORNERS OF THE MAP

TITLE:  BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THE WESTERN PHILLIP SMITH MOUNTAINS A-1 NW QUADRANGLE, BROOKS RANGE, ALASKAPROJECT PERIOD:  05 02 2023 - 05 01 2024PURPOSE: THE PROJECT WILL DEFINE THE DETAILED STRUCTURE AND STRATIGRAPHY OF DEVONIAN CLASTIC UNITS IN THE CENTRAL BROOKS RANGE, ALASKA AND PROVIDE A BASIS FOR DETAILED GEOCHRONOLOGIC AND GEOCHEMICAL CHARACTERIZATION.
