A TEAM OF THREE STUDENTS IS PLANNED BASED ON SAFETY CONSIDERATIONS FOR FIELD WORK IN REMOTE AREAS.DELIVERABLES: THE PRIMARY DELIVERABLES FROM THIS PROJECT WILL BE A PUBLISHED GEOLOGIC MAP, TECHNICAL REPORT, AND ARCGIS METADATA FOR THE WESTERN PHILLIP SMITH MOUNTAINS A-1 NW 7.5 QUADRANGLE (1: 25,000 SCALE), ALASKA.

PROJECT TITLE: BRADLEY LAKE WATERSHED MAPPINGPROJECT PERIOD: 08 1 2023- 07 31 2024 AWARD PURPOSE THE PRIMARY GOALS OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO CAPTURE AERIAL IMAGERY USING AN EXISTING ALASKA PACIFIC UNIVERSITY MAPPING SYSTEM TO CREATE BOTH AN ORTHOMOSAIC (A GEOREFERENCED PHOTO MOSAIC DRAPED OVER A DEM) AND A DIGITAL ELEVATION MODEL (DEM) USING STRUCTURE FROM MOTION (SFM) METHODS OF THE OF BRADLEY LAKE WATERSHED. ADDITIONALLY, THE PROPOSED PROJECT WITH PROVIDE HANDS-ON TRAINING TO BOTH A GRADUATE STUDENT WITHIN GEOSPATIAL TECHNOLOGIES (REMOTE SENSING, GIS, AND GNSS) AND AN UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT IN SURFICIAL GEOLOGICAL MAPPING WHILE CONDUCTING RESEARCH THAT ADDRESSES THE IMPLICATIONS OF GLACIER ICE LOSS FROM A WARMING CLIMATE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED THIS PROJECTS PURPOSE IS TWO-FOLD, 1) TO CREATE AN ORTHOMOSAIC IMAGE AND DIGITAL ELEVATION MODEL (DEM) USING AN EXISTING MAPPING SYSTEM AND 2) USE COLLECTED GEOSPATIAL DATA AND FIELD SITE VISITS TO PRODUCE A SURFICIAL GEOLOGY MAP OF THE GREATER BRADLEY LAKE WATERSHED. BRADLEY LAKE AND ADJACENT WATERSHEDS ARE LOCATED WITHIN ALASKAS SELDOVIA C2, C3, D2, AND D3 1:63,360 QUADRANGLES. THE BRADLEY LAKE HYDROELECTRIC PROJECT (120-MEGAWATT) PROVIDES  10  OF ALASKAS POWER AND IS FED MELTWATER FROM MULTIPLE GLACIERS. THESE GLACIERS CONTRIBUTE MELTWATER TO THE LAKE WITH A PLANNED FUTURE DIVERSION TO RESULT IN A 50  ELECTRICAL PRODUCTION INCREASE. GLACIERS THROUGHOUT ALASKA ARE THINNING AND RETREATING AS CLIMATE WARMS. KNOWLEDGE OF HOW GLACIERS ARE THINNING, AND THE RESULTANT MELTWATER CONTRIBUTIONS WOULD JUSTIFY THE PLANNED FUTURE DIVERSION PROJECT. GEOSPATIAL PRODUCTS CREATE FROM PROPOSED PROJECT WOULD ALLOW GLACIER GEODETIC MASS BALANCE CALCULATIONS USING DEM DIFFERENCING METHODS FROM EARLIER DEMS. ADDITIONALLY, A SURFICIAL GEOLOGICAL MAP WOULD BE USED AS MODEL INPUT FOR A HYDROLOGICAL WATERSHED TO DETERMINE PAST AND FUTURE WATER FLOWS INTO BRADLEY LAKE.THUS, PRODUCTS CREATED FROM THIS PROPOSED WORK WILL BE UTILIZED BY ADDITIONAL STUDENTS TO FURTHER STUDY IMPACTS GLACIER WASTAGE WILL HAVE ON STREAM FLOW. DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES  DATA SYNTHESIS PROJECT:ORTHOMOSAIC IMAGE METADATA (RESOLUTION:  15 CM, UTM, ZONE 6, WGS84)DIGITAL ELEVATION MODEL METADATA (RESOLUTION:  15 CM, UTM, ZONE 6, WGS84)MAP PRODUCT DEPICTING ORTHOMOSAIC FIRST AUTHORED BY APU GRADUATE STUDENTFIELD FOCUSED PROJECT:GIS LAYER METADATA DEPICTING STUDY SITE SURFICIAL GEOLOGYMAP PRODUCT DEPICTING SURFICIAL GEOLOGY FIRST AUTHORED BY APU UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)  THE BENEFITS OF THIS MAPPING PROJECT AND ASSOCIATED SCIENTIFIC INVESTIGATIONS WILL BE: MENTORING OF THE SUPPORTED STUDENT.  ADDITIONALLY, THIS WORK WILL SUPPORT THE ALASKA ENERGY AUTHORITY, CURRENTLY INVESTIGATING THE DIVERSION OF MELT WATER FROM DIXON GLACIER TO BRADLEY LAKE TO INCREASE POWER PRODUCTION BY 50 . KNOWLEDGE OF HOW DIXON IS CHANGING IN A WARMING CLIMATE WILL AID DECISION TO INVEST IN THIS PLANNED FUTURE DIVERSION PROJECT AS A BENEFIT TO LOCAL RESIDENTS. ADDITIONALLY, A SURFICIAL GEOLOGY MAP MAY BE USED IN HYDROLOGICAL MODELING APPLICATIONS TO DETERMINE HISTORICAL AND FUTURE STREAM FLOW PATTERNS INTO BRADLEY LAKE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES, IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT THE TIME OF AWARD. NONE

TITLE: GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THE JACKASS LAKES PLUTON, SIERRA NEVADA, TO UNRAVEL PLUTON EMPLACEMENT AND VOLCANIC-PLUTONIC CONNECTIONS.PROJECT PERIOD:  06 01 2023 - 05 31 2024PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS MAPPING PROJECT IS THREE-FOLD: (1) TO COMPLETE GEOLOGIC MAPPING WHERE DETAILED MAPS ARE NOT AVAILABLE  (2) WHILE TRAINING TWO GRADUATE MAPPERS AND TWO FIELD ASSISTANTS IN GEOLOGIC MAPPING, AND (3) USE THE DETAILED MAPPING AS A FOUNDATION TO INVESTIGATE INCREMENTAL PLUTON GROWTH OF AN IRREGULARLY SHEETED PLUTON AND ITS MAGMATIC EVOLUTION OVER TIME. ONE OF THE REAL BENEFITS OF MAPPING PLUTONS IN THIS AREA IS THAT IT IS LOCATED IN THE HIGH SIERRA AT 8,500-10,500 FT WHERE RECENT GLACIATIONS HAVE EXPOSED FRESH ROCK. FRESH EXPOSURES ARE BENEFICIAL WHEN MAPPING OUT SUBTLE TEXTURAL AND COMPOSITIONAL DIFFERENCES IN PLUTONS, ESPECIALLY FOR INEXPERIENCED MAPPERS.ACTIVITIES: UNDER THE PIS GUIDANCE, THE TWO MS GRADUATE STUDENT PRIMARY MAPPERS WILL SPEND ONE WEEK IN JULY 2023 PREPARING TOPOGRAPHIC FIELD MAPS, GEOLOGIC REFERENCE MAPS, CAMPING GEAR AND FOOD, AND ORGANIZE TRAVEL LOGISTICS TO THE SIERRA NATIONAL FOREST, ANSEL ADAMS WILDERNESS. THE TWO STUDENTS WILL SPEND 3-4 WEEKS IN JULY AUGUST MAPPING THEIR RESPECTIVE, CA. 25 KM2 LARGE FIELD AREAS EACH AT 1:10,000 SCALE IN THE CENTRAL PART OF THE JLP (FIG. 3B). THE TWO STUDENTS WILL COLLABORATE ON MAPPING THE TRANSITION BETWEEN THE TWO MAPS AND ADDING THE MAPPING FROM THIS YEAR INTO AN 80 KM2 COMPILATION MAP. STUDENTS WILL RECORD STATIONS CA. EVERY 100 METERS OR LESS AS THE GEOLOGY REQUIRES, DETERMINE GPS COORDINATES, AND EXAMINE ALL LITHOLOGIES PRESENT (MINERAL TYPE, SIZE, ABUNDANCE, TEXTURE), INCLUDING VOLCANIC HOST ROCK BLOCKS AND MAGMATIC ENCLAVES.DELIVERABLES: THE PLAN IS TO SUBMIT THREE GEOLOGIC MAP DELIVERABLES OF A TOTAL OF CA. 80 KM2 OF THE JLP AND ITS HOST ROCKS AT 1:10,000 SCALE DIGITIZED IN ARCGIS. EACH GRADUATE PRIMARY MAPPER WILL AUTHOR A 25 KM2 GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE CENTRAL JLP AND COLLABORATE ON THE CA. 80-90 KM2 COMPILATION MAP INCLUDING BOTH NEW STUDENT MAPS OF CA. 50 KM2, THE FIRST YEARS MAP OF 30 KM2, AND KRUEGER AND YOSHINOBUS (2018) SING PEAK PENDANT MAP (FIG. 3B, C). THE MAPS WILL BE ACCOMPANIED BY CROSS SECTIONS AND TECHNICAL REPORTS INCLUDING FIELD OBSERVATIONS, PETROGRAPHY, GEOCHEMISTRY, AND ZIRCON GEOCHRONOLOGY, AND A MODEL FOR JLP EMPLACEMENT

PROJECT TITLE: UNEARTHING THE CORDILLERAN MAGMATIC PERIPHERY OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO THROUGH MULTISCALE GEOLOGIC MAPPING.PROJECT PERIOD: 08 1 2023- 07 31 2024 AWARD PURPOSE THE GOALS OF THE PROPOSED WORK ARE TO (1) CHARACTERIZE DISTAL IGNEOUS ROCKS OF SE NM AND THEIR INTRUSIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITH SURROUNDING STRATA, (2) SET THE STAGE FOR BROADER WORK ON THE CORDILLERAN MAGMATIC PERIPHERY OF EASTERN NM AND CO, AND (3) TRAIN THE GRADUATE STUDENT MAPPER TOWARDS BEING ABLE TO CONDUCT INDEPENDENT, FIELD- AND MAP-BASED RESEARCH.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED PRIOR TO MAPPING, THE GRADUATE MAPPER WILL REVIEW RELEVANT LITERATURE ON EASTERN NM GEOLOGY, ALKALINE MAGMATISM, THE AMB, CORDILLERAN TECTONICS, AND AR-AR DATING  CREATE NEEDED DATABASES  AND DIGITALLY COMPILE PREVIOUS WORK. ATTIA AND NMBGMR GIS SPECIALISTS WILL GUIDE THE STUDENT IN USING THE NMBMGR IMPLEMENTATION OF GEMS AS A TEMPLATE FOR CREATING FGDC-COMPLIANT MAP DOCUMENTS AND DATABASES IN ARCGIS THAT INCLUDE CROSS-SECTIONS, MAP UNIT CORRELATION CHART, AND UNIT DESCRIPTIONS. THE GRADUATE MAPPER WILL CONDUCT ABOUT 10 WEEKS OF FIELDWORK FROM FALL 2023 TO SPRING 2024, SUPPORTED BY 40 DAYS OF PER DIEM. DISTRIBUTIONS AND NATURE OF ROCK UNITS, PLANAR AND LINEAR FEATURES, AND OTHER FIELD OBSERVATIONS WILL BE RECORDED AND REFLECTED ON MAPS.  FIELD NOTES WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY PHOTOS, SKETCHES, AND SAMPLES AND REVIEWED DAILY. MAPPING, NOTES, AND SAMPLES WILL BE CONTINUOUSLY COMPILED AND INTEGRATED WITH EXISTING DATA IN THE ARCGIS GEODATABASES AND RELATED DATABASES IN A TIMELY MANNER.  THE GRADUATE MAPPER WILL SPEND ABOUT SIX TO SEVEN WEEKS ON THIS 1:24,000 MAPPING, CARRIED OUT BY ANALOGUE MAPPING METHODS USING PAPER, PENCIL, PEN, BRUNTON COMPASS, AND GPS. THE MAPPER WILL BUILD UPON THIS WORK WITH ABOUT TWO TO THREE WEEKS OF DETAILED 1:10,000-SCALE MAPPING, WHICH WILL FOCUS ON EXPOSURES OF THE DUNLAP SILL ITSELF AND PROXIMAL STRATA, STRUCTURES, AND SURFICIAL DEPOSITS. THIS MAPPING WILL BE CARRIED OUT BY DIGITAL MAPPING TECHNIQUES ON A GPS-ENABLED TABLET. DIGITAL METHODS WILL COMBINE FIELD NOTES AND OUTCROP DOCUMENTATION IN STRABOSPOT2 AND FIELD MAPPING USING MAPBOARD GIS. TRADITIONAL APPROACHES WILL BE USED TO VALIDATE DIGITAL METHOD RESULTS. THE SECONDARY YESO HILLS DIKES 1:5,000-SCALE MAP AREA LIES IN THE WESTERN RATTLESNAKE SPRINGS 7.5-QUAD.  DELIVERABLES THE DELIVERABLES TO BE AUTHORED BY THE GRADUATE MAPPER AND SUBMITTED TO EDMAP AS HIGH-QUALITY PDFS ARE: (1) GEOLOGIC MAP SHEET OF THE DUNLAP SILL AREA AS DESCRIBED ABOVE WITH BOTH THE 1:24,000-SCALE AND NESTED 1:10,000-SCALE MAPS  (2) 1:5,000-SCALE GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE YESO HILLS DIKES AS DESCRIBED ABOVE  (3) GIS DATABASES AND MAP DOCUMENTS CONTAINING ALL DATA GENERATED  AND (4) AN ACCOMPANYING TECHNICAL REPORT OUTLINING PROJECT ACTIVITIES, RESULTS, AND INTERPRETATIONS. GEOLOGIC MAPS WILL BE CREATED IN A GEMS COMPLIANT TEMPLATE MEETING FGDC STANDARDS, AND WILL INCLUDE CROSS-SECTIONS, MAP UNIT CORRELATION CHARTS, MAP UNIT DESCRIPTIONS, MAP SYMBOLOGIES, ALL COLLECTED DATA, AND OTHER REQUIRE CARTOGRAPHIC ELEMENTS. SUBMITTED DELIVERABLES WILL SERVE AS FIRST DRAFTS FOR NMBGMR OPEN-FILE SERIES PUBLICATIONS. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)  THE BENEFITS OF THIS MAPPING PROJECT AND ASSOCIATED SCIENTIFIC INVESTIGATIONS WILL BE: THISWORK WILL PROVIDE EXCELLENT SCIENTIFIC AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR THE GRADUATE MAPPER DUE TO THE EXCELLENT EXPOSURE, MULTISCALE APPROACH, COMBINATION OF TRADITIONAL AND DIGITAL MAPPING, USE OF GIS, AND SCIENCE COMMUNICATION OPPORTUNITIES. ATTIAS EXPERIENCE AS A NMBGMR MAPPER AND IN STRUCTURAL RELATIONSHIPS OF MAGMATIC SYSTEMS WILL MAKE HIS MENTORSHIP ESPECIALLY USEFUL. ATTIA WILL HELP DIRECT THE GRADUATE MAPPER PREPARE BEFORE ENTERING THE FIELD, MENTOR THEM DIRECTLY DURING INITIAL FIELDWORK, AND PROVIDE GUIDANCE AND FEEDBACK THROUGHOUT THE FOLLOWING INTERPRETATION, DRAFTING, AND SUPPORTING RESEARCH.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES, IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT THE TIME OF AWARD. NONE

TITLE: BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAPPING AND GEOCHRONOLOGY OF PORPHYRY INTRUSIONS ON THE LINE CREEK PLATEAU, SOUTHEASTERN BEARTOOTH MOUNTAINS, MONTANAWYOMINGPROJECT PERIOD: 05 01 2023 - 04 30 2024PURPOSE: THE BEARTOOTH MOUNTAINS IN SOUTH-CENTRAL MONTANA ARE A BASEMENT-INVOLVED STRUCTURAL ARCH THAT FORMED DURING THE LATE CRETACEOUSPALEOGENE LARAMIDE OROGENY. THIS ENIGMATIC EVENT DROVE DEFORMATION ANDMAGMATISM  1000 KM INBOARD OF THE ACTIVE OCEAN-CONTINENT CONVERGENT MARGIN. SPATIOTEMPORALCONSTRAINTS ARE IMPORTANT PROXIES FOR DELINEATING WHAT PROCESSES FACILITATED LARAMIDE TECTONISM, BUT HARDCONSTRAINTS ON THE TIMING OF BEARTOOTH MOUNTAINS FORMATION REMAIN ELUSIVE.ACTIVITIES: 1.MAP THE OCCURRENCE, DISTRIBUTION, AND ALTERATION ZONES OF PORPHYRY INTRUSIONS AMONGSTPRECAMBRIAN BASEMENT AND LARAMIDE FAULTS ON THE LINE CREEK PLATEAU.2.    CONDUCT GEOCHRONOLOGY ON UNDATED PORPHYRY INTRUSIONS TO COMPARE CONTRAST WITH PREVIOUSLYCOLLECTED DATES AND ESTABLISH A CHRONOLOGY OF MAGMATISM AND TECTONISM.3.    PROVIDE SEAMLESS GEOLOGIC MAPPING ACROSS THE MONTANA WYOMING STATE LINE.DELIVERABLES:THIS PROJECT WILL BE THE FIRST MODERN STUDY (TO THE PIS KNOWLEDGE) TO FOCUS SOLELY ONPORPHYRY INTRUSIONS IN RELATION TO LARAMIDE RANGE-FRONT FAULTS. LARGE-SCALE GEOLOGIC MAPPING WILL PROVIDE THE FUNDAMENTAL DATASET TO FURTHER EXAMINE THESE FEATURES, AND TO POSSIBLY DISCOVER MORE OCCURRENCES (MORE LIKELY IN WYOMING). THE PERIPHERAL ALTERATION ZONES ASSOCIATED WITH INTRUSIONS HAVE ALSO NOT BEEN EXAMINED, AND THE POTENTIAL FOR OCCURRENCES OF SOCIETALLY IMPORTANT ECONOMIC MINERALS (E.G., CRITICAL MINERALS) IS POSSIBLE WITHIN THE ALTERATION ZONES AND OR THE PORPHYRIES THEMSELVES.

PROJECT TITLE: MAPPING SURFACE DEPOSITS WITH DRONE IMAGERY AND MACHINE LEARNING: A CASE STUDY IN THE BIG MARIA EMBAYMENTPROJECT PERIOD:  07 01 2023 - 06 30 2024PURPOSE: MACHINE LEARNING ALGORITHMS CAN NOW MAP EVERYTHING FROM AGRICULTURAL YIELD TO SEDIMENTARY FACIES BY INTELLIGENT CLUSTERING OF CONTIGUOUS PIXELS IN VERY LARGE IMAGE AND ELEVATION DATASETS. THESE ALGORITHMS ARE WELL POSITIONED FOR AUTONOMOUS MAPPING OF SURFACE GEOLOGY, AND CAN BE USED TO DISTINGUISH FLUVIAL, EOLIAN AND ALLUVIAL FAN DEPOSITS BASED ON PARAMETERS LIKE ELEVATION, COLOR, SLOPE AND SURFACE ROUGHNESS. COMMERCIAL DRONES ARE NOW CAPABLE OF IMAGING EARTHS SURFACE AT RESOLUTIONS OF ONLY A FEW CENTIMETERS PER PIXEL AND HIGH PERFORMANCE COMPUTERS USING STRUCTURE-FROM-MOTION PHOTOGRAMMETRY SOFTWARE CAN PRODUCE ULTRA-HIGH RESOLUTION ELEVATION PRODUCTS ( 10 CM VERTICAL RESOLUTION) FROM DRONE IMAGERY IN A MATTER OF HOURS.ACTIVITIES: THIS PROJECT WILL USE ULTRA-HIGH RESOLUTION DRONE IMAGERY AND MACHINE LEARNING TO MAPTHE SURFACE GEOLOGY OF A PORTION OF THE BIG MARIA EMBAYMENT (BIG MARIA MOUNTAINS SEQUADRANGLE, CA). THE 25 KM2 FIELD AREA INCLUDES A SEQUENCE OF INTERBEDDED ALLUVIAL FAN, EOLIANAND FLUVIAL DEPOSITS AS WELL AS FLUVIAL ESCARPMENTS AND FAN TERRACES THAT COLLECTIVELY RECORDMIGRATION OF THE LOWER COLORADO RIVER SINCE THE LATE MIOCENE.DELIVERABLES: THIS PROJECT WILL USE ULTRA-HIGH RESOLUTION DRONE IMAGERY AND MACHINE LEARNING TO MAP THE SURFACE GEOLOGY OF A PORTION OF THE BIG MARIA EMBAYMENT (BIG MARIA MOUNTAINS SEQUADRANGLE, CA). THE 25 KM2 FIELD AREA INCLUDES A SEQUENCE OF INTERBEDDED ALLUVIAL FAN, EOLIANAND FLUVIAL DEPOSITS AS WELL AS FLUVIAL ESCARPMENTS AND FAN TERRACES THAT COLLECTIVELY RECORDMIGRATION OF THE LOWER COLORADO RIVER SINCE THE LATE MIOCENE.

PROJECT TITLE: MAPPING BEDROCK GEOLOGY OF CENTRAL PART OF THE FULKS RUN 7.5 QUADRANGLE, VIRGINIA AND PREPARING A VIRTUAL GEOLOGICAL MAPPING EXERCISEPROJECT PERIOD: 08 15 2023- 08 14 2024 AWARD PURPOSE THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL HAVE TWO MAIN PURPOSES 1) TO TRAIN GEOLOGY UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS IN GEOLOGIC MAPPING USING THE CENTRAL PART OF THE FULKS RUN QUADRANGLE AS A STUDY SITE. THE STUDENTS WILL HAVE TAKEN STRUCTURAL GEOLOGY AND STRATIGRAPHY BY THE START OF PROJECT. THE STUDENTS WILL BE CLOSELY MENTORED BY PI YONATHAN ADMASSU AND CO-PI JOHN HAYNES ON TRADITIONAL AS WELL AS DIGITAL GEOLOGIC MAPPING METHODS. MENTORING STUDENTS WILL INVOLVE INTRODUCING STUDENTS ON HOW TO TAKE QUALITY FIELD NOTES, COLLECTING STRATIGRAPHIC AND STRUCTURAL DATA, AND PLOTTING DATA ON DIGITAL MAPS, AND 2) TO PREPARE A COMPUTER DESKTOPBASED DIGITAL GEOLOGICAL MAPPING EXERCISE THAT WILL BE USED TO INTRODUCE FUTURE STUDENTS TO GEOLOGIC MAPPING AS A PRE-FIELD GEOLOGY ACTIVITY AND TO STUDENTS WITH DISABILITIES THAT HINDER FIELD BASED ACTIVITIES. THE EXERCISE WILL BE SUBMITTED TO BE POSTED ON THE WEB FOR THE EARTH SCIENCE TEACHING COMMUNITY. THE PI WILL TRAIN STUDENTS ON GEOLOGICAL MAPPING METHODOLOGIES AND ON THE TECHNIQUES OF CREATING 3D MODELS OF OUTCROPS USING PHOTOGRAMMETRY AND TERRESTRIAL LIDAR.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED THREE STUDENTS WHO WILL BE TAKING JMUS ADVANCED STRUCTURE, STRATIGRAPHY, TECTONICS (ASST) AND GIS COURSES WILL BE SELECTED FOR THE PROJECT. ONCE THE STUDENTS ARE SELECTED, THE PI AND CO-PI WILL OPENLY DISCUSS WITH THEM JMUS POLICY AND COMMITMENT ON JUSTICE, EQUITY, DIVERSITY, AND INCLUSION (JEDI) ISSUES. STUDENTS WILL ALSO START THE TRAINING ON GATHERING PREVIOUS WORKS AND WILL BE REQUIRED TO SUMMARIZE THEIR FINDINGS. STUDENTS WILL THEN GATHER REMOTELY SENSED DATA SUCH AS GOOGLE EARTH IMAGERY AND HIGH RESOLUTION DEM DATA AND BEGIN GEOLOGICALLY INTERPRETING TOPOGRAPHIC MODELS. THE INTERPRETED MAPS WILL BE USED TO STRATEGIZE A SELECTION OF MAPPING TRAVERSES. THE PI AND CO-PI WILL MENTOR ALL THREE STUDENTS ON DATA COLLECTION IN THE FIELD USING BOTH TRADITIONAL AND MOBILE-DIGITAL METHODS. TWO STUDENTS WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR FIELD DATA COLLECTION THAT WILL INCLUDE LITHOLOGICAL DESCRIPTIONS, COLLECTION OF ROCK SAMPLES FOR THIN SECTIONING, MEASURING STRIKE AND DIP, AND FOLD AND FAULT STRUCTURAL DATA. THE THIRD STUDENT WILL COLLECT DATA THAT WILL BE USED FOR THE VIRTUAL GEOLOGIC MAPPING EXERCISE. THAT STUDENT WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH THE TWO STUDENTS TO LOCATE OUTCROPS FROM WHICH STEREOGRAPHIC PHOTOGRAPHS LIDAR DATA WILL BE COLLECTED. AFTER THE NECESSARY FIELD DATA COLLECTION AND SAFETY TRAINING IS OFFERED, THE STUDENTS WILL COLLECT DATA ON THEIR OWN AND MEET WITH THE PI AND CO-PI EVERY WEEK. THE PIS WILL CLOSELY FOLLOW THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE GEOLOGIC MAP. THE PI WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR CREATING THE VIRTUAL GEOLOGIC MAPPING EXERCISE.  DELIVERABLE PRODUCTS THE STUDENTS WILL PRODUCE DIGITAL BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE CENTRAL PART OF THE FULKS RUN, VIRGINIA 7.5 QUADRANGLE  BOUNDING COORDINATES: NORTH: 384320N, SOUTH: 383930N, EAST: 785900W, WEST: 785200W. DIGITAL MAP DELIVERABLES WILL BE IN PDF FORMAT, WITH DIGITAL SHAPEFILES IN ARCGIS, AND GOOGLE EARTH KMZ FORMATS. MAP DATA SPREADSHEET WILL BE PREPARED IN MICROSOFT EXCEL. A FINAL REPORT ON THE RESULT OF THE MAPPING ACTIVITY WILL SUBMITTED BOTH IN HARD AND SOFT COPIES. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)  THE BENEFITS OF THIS MAPPING PROJECT AND ASSOCIATED SCIENTIFIC INVESTIGATIONS WILL BE: MENTORING OF THE SUPPORTED STUDENTS.  ADDITIONALLY, THE PROJECT WILL OFFER A GREAT EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY AND IT WILL ADD TO THE AVAILABLE GEOLOGIC DATA FROM THE AREA THAT CAN BE USED DURING A FUTURE STATE MAPPING PROJECT. THE VIRTUAL GEOLOGIC MAPPING EXERCISE WILL BE A GREAT CONTRIBUTION TO THE GEOSCIENCE EDUCATION COMMUNITY.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES, IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT THE TIME OF AWARD. NONE

PROJECT TITLE: MAPPING THE INTERSECTING MARGINS OF A NESTED CALDERASYSTEM IN THE TOQUIMA RANGE, NEVADAPROJECT PERIOD: 08 1 2023- 07 31 2024 AWARD PURPOSE  THE TOQUIMA CALDERA COMPLEX IS A NESTED CALDERA SYSTEM OF OLIGOCENE AGE IN THE TOQUIMA RANGE OF CENTRAL NEVADA. PREVIOUS MAPPING IN THIS AREA HAS SHOWN THAT AT LEAST THREE CALDERA FORMING ERUPTIONS OCCURRED. THIS EDMAP PROJECT FOCUSES ON THE EASTERN MARGINS OF THIS NESTED CALDERA SYSTEM TO DIFFERENTIATE BETWEEN THE MAIN ERUPTIVE EVENTS AND POTENTIALLY SMALLER ERUPTIVE EVENTS IN BETWEEN THE CALDERA FORMING EVENTS. THIS MAPPING PROJECT WILL CONSTITUTE THE FIRST PART OF THE PHD THESIS OF THE STUDENT MAPPER, WHERE THE MAPPING PROJECT WILL SERVE TWO MAJOR PURPOSES  1) REFINE EXISTING MAPPING EFFORTS ESPECIALLY AROUND THE CALDERA MARGINS  AND 2) BUILD A FOUNDATIONAL UNDERSTANDING OF THE STRATIGRAPHY OF THIS NESTED CALDERA SYSTEM IN ORDER TO FOLLOW UP WITH A MODERN GEOCHEMICAL AND PETROLOGIC STUDY OF THE MAGMA SYSTEM THROUGH SPACE AND TIME. THE MAP WILL BE PRODUCED AT THE 1:24,000 SCALE AND COMPRISE PARTS OF THE MOUNT JEFFERSON AND PINE CREEK RANCH QUADRANGLES. THIS MAPPING PROJECT WILL GREATLY ENHANCE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF NESTED CALDERA SYSTEMS, WHICH ARE COMMON IN THE GREAT BASIN AND YET HAVE TO BE STUDIED IN MUCH GREATER DETAIL WITH MINERAL-SCALE TECHNIQUES.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED THE DETAILED NATURE OF THIS PROJECT REQUIRES THAT ALL MAPPING IS DONE IN THE FIELD. THE RECIPIENT WILL USE SATELLITE IMAGERY AND OLDER EXISTING MAPS (BODEN 1992) TO PROVIDE GUIDANCE FOR MAJOR CONTACTS OF THE INVOLVED REGIONAL UNITS, DETAILED MAPPING OF SUBUNITS POTENTIALLY INVOLVING TEXTURAL DIFFERENCES WILL REQUIRE ON-THE-GROUND OBSERVATIONS. WHILE COVID-RELATED CONCERNS HAVE BEEN LIFTED THROUGHOUT THE SOCIETY, THE RECIPIENT WILL ENSURE THAT ALL FACULTY AND STUDENTS WILL BE TAKE PRECAUTIONS (E.G. VACCINATION   TESTING) TO MINIMIZE POTENTIAL DOWN TIME. TWO MAJOR TASKS WILL BE PERFORMED BY THE STUDENT MAPPER: 1) A COMPREHENSIVE STUDY OF THE NESTED CALDERA SYSTEM AND HOW MARGINS OF INDIVIDUAL CALDERAS INTERSECT AND INTERACT WITH PRIOR VOLCANIC ACTIVITY. 2) BUILDING A COMPREHENSIVE ERUPTIVE SEQUENCE OF THIS PART OF THE CALDERA SYSTEM AND ADVANCE PRIOR WORK IN THIS AREA. THIS WILL REQUIRE DETAILED PETROGRAPHIC DESCRIPTIONS OF THE FULL RANGE OF MAGMATIC TEXTURES AND ASSEMBLAGES  DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES  THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN A 1:24,000-SCALE GEOLOGIC MAP COVERING THE EQUIVALENT OF  14X8.5 KM (NAD83, ZONE 11, BOUNDING COORDINATES OF ALL CORNERS, SEE OUTLINE IN FIG. 2: 38.875N   116.945W  38.75N   116.945W  38.875N   116.875W  38.75N   116.81W) OF THE TOQUIMA RANGE. THIS MAP WILL INCLUDE CROSS SECTIONS, A CORRELATION DIAGRAM, AND ROCK DESCRIPTIONS. THE MAP WILL BE GIS-LAYERED WITH COMPLETE ATTRIBUTE INFORMATION. THIS WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE IN A HIGH-RESOLUTION GEOPDF FORMAT (ON THE USGS NATIONAL GEOLOGIC MAP DATABASE WEBSITE  HTTP:  NGMDB.USGS.GOV   AND THE PIS PERSONAL WEBSITE) AND UPON REQUEST. THE GEOLOGIC MAP AND ASSOCIATED REPORT WILL BE SUBMITTED ELECTRONICALLY TO THE EDMAP PROGRAM OFFICER THROUGH THE EDMAP DROPBOX, AS REQUESTED IN PART IV SECTION F OF THE FY23  EDMAP PROGRAM ANNOUNCEMENT  G23AS00051. PI ALSO ANTICIPATES THAT THIS WORK WILL RESULT IN A PEER-REVIEWED PUBLICATION IN A JOURNAL SUCH AS THE GEOLOGICAL SOCIETY OF AMERICA BULLETIN.  INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)  THE BENEFITS OF THIS MAPPING PROJECT AND ASSOCIATED SCIENTIFIC INVESTIGATIONS WILL BE: GUIDING A STUDY OF THE CRYSTAL CARGO IN THE VARIOUS IGNEOUS UNITS IN THIS AREA. MINERAL CHEMISTRY HAS BEEN PROVEN TO BE EFFECTIVE IN FURTHER SUBDIVIDING MAGMATIC COMPONENTS AND THEREFORE RECOGNIZING COMPOSITIONAL. AS A RESULT, ONE CAN DEVELOP NEW MODELS OF MAGMA ASSEMBLY IN CALDERA SYSTEM AND CONSTRAIN THE LENGTH AND TIMESCALES OF THE MAGMATIC PROCESSES (MIXING, MELT EXTRACTION, MAGMA STORAGE AND ASCENT) THAT LEAD TO MOBILIZATION AND ERUPTION. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESNONE

PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARY PROJECT TITLE: GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THE DIAMOND JOE INTRUSIVE COMPLEX, HUALAPAI MOUNTAINS, MOHAVE COUNTY, AZ: UNRAVELLING MAGMATIC AND HYDROTHERMAL PROCESSES AT THE ROOT OF A PORPHYRY CU-MO SYSTEM.PROJECT PERIOD: 09 01 2023  08 31 2024ABSTRACTTHE PROPOSED EDMAP PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A STATE-OF-THE-ART GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE LARAMIDE DIAMOND JOE STOCK FORMED IN THE HUALAPAI MOUNTAINS IN NORTHWESTERN ARIZONA, WHICH HAS BEEN INTERPRETED AS THE ROOT OF A PORPHYRY COPPER-MOLYBDENUM SYSTEM. THE RECOGNITION OF COPPER, MOLYBDENITE, LEAD, AND SILVER MINERALIZATION IN SEVERAL LOCATIONS THROUGHOUT THE DIAMOND JOE STOCK INDICATES SUCCESSIVE ORE-FORMING EVENTS THAT ARE NOT ALL RELATED TO A TYPICAL PORPHYRY COPPER-MOLYBDENUM SYSTEM. HERE, THE RECIPIENT PROPOSE A DETAILED 1:24,000-SCALE MAP OF THE VARIOUS INTRUSIVE PHASES COMBINED WITH A MAP OF HYDROTHERMAL FEATURES AIMING TO UNDERSTAND THE RELATIVE TIMING AND GEOCHEMICAL CHARACTERISTICS OF MAGMATIC AND HYDROTHERMAL EVENTS. THE ULTIMATE GOAL IS TO IMPROVE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE PORPHYRY COPPER SYSTEMS OF NORTHWESTERN ARIZONA AND CONTRIBUTE TO ONGOING MAPPING EFFORTS IN THE BIG SANDY VALLEY. THE METHODS WILL CONSIST OF (1) A DETAILED FIELD MAPPING OF INTRUSIVE ROCKS, HYDROTHERMAL VEINS, AND RELATED ALTERATIONS, AND (2) DETAILED PETROGRAPHY OF POLISHED THIN SECTIONS TO CHARACTERIZE IGNEOUS ROCKS AND HYDROTHERMAL OVERPRINT. THIS EDMAP PROJECT MAY REVEAL THE OCCURRENCES OF SEVERAL ORE-FORMING HYDROTHERMAL EVENTS UNRELATED IN TIME, AND HENCE OPEN NEW MINERAL EXPLORATION PERSPECTIVES RELATED TO THE ORE-FORMING POTENTIAL OF LARAMIDE INTRUSIONS IN NORTHWESTERN ARIZONA. CONSIDERING THAT THE BIG SANDY VALLEY HAS BEEN ONE OF THE MOST ACTIVE AREAS IN ARIZONA FOR MINERALS EXPLORATION IN THE LAST FEW YEARS, THIS PROJECT WILL CONTRIBUTE FOR A BETTER ASSESSMENT OF THE ORE-FORMING POTENTIAL OF THE STUDY AREA, A FRAMEWORK THAT CAN BE EXPANDED TO SURROUNDING AREAS TO INFORM FUTURE MINERAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT. FURTHERMORE, THIS PROJECT WILL SET THE GROUND FOR QUANTITATIVE GEOCHEMICAL CHARACTERIZATION TO UNRAVEL PETROLOGICAL AND ORE-FORMING PROCESSES IN THE DIAMOND JOE STOCK WITHIN THE FRAME OF AN EARTH MRI-FUNDED MS RESEARCH THESIS. THE RECIPIENT EXPECTS TO SHOW THE TELESCOPING OF TWO MINERALIZING SYSTEMS, I.E., AN EARLY PORPHYRY CU-MO SYSTEM AND A SUBSEQUENT EPITHERMAL BASE METAL SYSTEM. THE PROPOSED MAPPING AREA CORRESPONDS TO THE NORTHEASTERN  OF THE DIAMOND JOE PEAK 7   QUADRANGLE. THE PROJECT WILL DELIVER TO THE USGS A 1:24,000-SCALE GEOLOGIC MAP OF THIS AREA AS A HIGH- QUALITY DIGITAL PDF FILE.

THESE SKILLS WILL BE IMPORTANT FOR A LARGE PART A PH.D. THESIS, WHICH WILL FOCUS ON A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF MAGMATIC DIFFERENTIATION PROCESSES AND THEIR TEMPOS OPERATING IN SUBSURFACE MAGMA RESERVOIRS.ACTIVITIES: THE MAPPING STRATEGY INVOLVES INVESTIGATION OF AERIAL PHOTOGRAPHY IMAGES PRIOR AND DURING MAPPING TO IDENTIFY AREAS OF POTENTIAL DIFFERENT LITHOLOGY (E.G., AREAS OF PREDOMINANTLY MAGMA MIXING APPEAR DARKER ON AERIAL PHOTOGRAPHY IN COMPARISON TO GRANITE). FIELD NOTES WILL BE REVIEWED AT THE END OF EACH DAY AND DIGITIZED IN A TIMELY MANNER.DELIVERABLES: THE DELIVERABLES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: (1) A DETAILED GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE PYRAMID PEAK PLUTON ON A TOPOGRAPHIC CONTOUR BASE MAP (2) DETAILED MAPS OF THE MAUD LAKEAND LAKE SYLVIA AREAS 3) AN ACCOMPANYING REPORT TO THEMAPS, WHICH WILL DESCRIBE THE ROCK TYPES (INCLUDING THIN-SECTION OBSERVATIONS), FIELD RELATIONS, STRUCTURES,AND OTHER OBSERVATIONS MADE DURING MAPPING.

PRODUCED 4 63 MILLION OUNCES OF GOLD VALUED AT  6 8 BILLION IN 2020, LEADING THE NATION IN GOLD PRODUCTION AS WELL AS NON FUEL MINERAL RESOURCES OVERALL VALUED AT  7 7 BILLION  RECENT GEOLOGIC MAPPING BY NBMG GEOLOGISTS, LARGELY SUPPORTED BY STATEMAP FUNDS, HAS BEEN A PRIMARY FACTOR IN DEFINING THE GEOLOGIC SETTING AND ORIGIN OF GOLD DEPOSITS  NEVADA IS THE 2ND LEADING PRODUCER OF GEOTHERMAL ENERGY AND WILL CONTINUE TO PRIORITIZE MAKING OUR GEOLOGIC MAPS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC IN ACCESSIBLE DATA FORMATS  DELIVERABLES FOR FY2022 INCLUDE EIGHT 1 24,000 SCALE 7 5  QUADRANGLE GEOLOGIC MAPS AND ILLINOIS STATEMAP PROPOSAL  FY 2022  PROJECT PERIOD  09 20 2022 THROUGH 09 19 2024THE ILLINOIS STATE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY WILL UNDERTAKE HIGH RESOLUTION MAPPING OF 3 QUADRANGLES AND REVISE AND UPDATE AREAS PREVIOUSLY MAPPED AT LOWER RESOLUTION INTO MODERN DIGITAL DATA SETS  THE QUADRANGLE MAPPING  1 24,000 SCALE  IS MOST USEFUL FOR LOCAL ANALYSES, WHEREAS THE REGIONAL   1 100,000 SCALE  AND STATEWIDE  1 500,000 SCALE  COMPILATIONS ARE SUITED TO REGIONAL  TO NATIONAL SCALE ANALYSES  IN PROJECT 1, THE BEDROCK GEOLOGY OF THE HANOVER QUADRANGLE, JO DAVIESS COUNTY, NORTHWESTERN ILLINOIS, WILL BE MAPPED BY STUDYING BEDROCK EXPOSED IN VALLEY WALLS AND MINES, AND BY DRILLING 100 S OF FEET INTO THE BURIED LAYERS  THE MAPPING FOCUSES ON THE OCCURRENCE OF ECONOMIC AND INDUSTRIAL MINERALS, E SPECIALLY PHOSPHORITE DEPOSITS WHICH ARE SOURCES OF RARE EARTH ELEMENTS FOR WHICH THERE IS HIGH DEMAND IN ELECTRONICS MANUFACTURING  PROJECT 2 ENTAILS MAPPING THE SURFICIAL GEOLOGY OF THE LAKE CALUMET AND JACKSON PARK QUADRANGLES IN THE SOUTH CHICAGO METROPOLITAN AREA  COOK COUNTY  NEW GEOLOGIC MAP DATA ARE NECESSARY FOR A RANGE OF REDEVELOPMENT ISSUES, MANY OF WHICH ARE MOTIVATED BY SOCIAL JUSTICE NEEDS  USING EXISTING AND NEW BORING RECORDS, ILLINOIS STATE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY WILL CHARACTERIZE THE EXTENT, AGE, AND PHYSICAL AND CHEMICAL PROPERTIES OF THE LAYERS OF LARGELY GLACIAL ERA SEDIMENT, WHICH TOTAL UP TO 100 FEET THICK  IN PROJECT 3, BEDROCK GEOLOGY OF GALLATIN AND SALINE COUNTIES, SOUTHEASTERN ILLINOIS, WILL BE DIGITALLY COMPILED FROM 23 PREVIOUSLY MAPPED QUADRANGLES  THE THAT HAS BEEN INTERPRETED FROM FIELD AND MAGNETOMETER DATA  RARE EARTH ELEMENT AND COAL CONTENTS WILL BE DETERMINED ON THE CORE SAMPLES  THE MAPS WILL SUPPORT FUTURE MINERAL AND PETROLEUM EXPLORATION AND A COMPILATION OF RECENT MAP RESULTS FROM THE SURFICIAL GEOLOGY OF LOWER WABASH VALLEY ALONG THE ILLINOIS INDIANA STATE LINE  THE STATEWIDE PROJECT UPDATES THE EXISTING MAP FROM 1979 WITH NEW CONCEPTS IN DEFINING MAP UNITS, IN UNDERSTANDING OF GLACIAL HISTORY, AND WITH NEW DATA ESPECIALLY HIGH RESOLUTION ELEVATION DATA  THE THIRD PHASE WILL FOCUS ON THE AREA ALONG THE BOUNDARY OF THE LAST GLACIATION  FIELDWORK WILL INCLUDE OUTCROP STUDIES, GEOPHYSICAL SURVEY, AND SHALLOW CORING THE RESULTING MAP WILL BE USEFUL IN REGIONAL STUDIES OF GEOLOGIC HISTORY, EARTHQUAKE HAZARD ANALYSIS, AND GROUNDWATER STUDIES  SIX OF THE 7 MAPS DESCRIBED ABOVE WILL BE DELIVERED TO THE U S  GEOLOGICAL SURVEY AS PDFS AND IN STANDARDIZED AND QUALITY ASSURED DIGITAL DATABASES  THE STATEWIDE SURFICIAL GEOLOGY WILL STILL BE IN DRAFT FORM PENDING COMPLETION OF THE FINAL TWO PHASES  IN ADDITION, THE 23 QUADRANGLE MAPS FROM GALLATIN AND SALINE COUNTIES WILL BE DELIVERED AS DIGITAL DATABASES  THE DELIVERABLES WILL BE AVAILABLE FROM THE ILLINOIS STATE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY WEBSITE SOON AFTER DELIVERY, SUBMITTED TO THE U S  GEOLOGICAL SURVEY NATIONAL GEOLOGIC MAP DATABASE, AND WILL BE PUBLISHED WITHIN THE ENSUING YEAR

PLANNING, HAZARD MITIGATION PLANS, SITE EXPLORATION, AND BUILDING CODES  DETAILED GEOLOGIC MAPPING CAN ASSIST WITH THE PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE GADSDEN AREA  BECAUSE OF THE RAPID URBAN, MANAGEMENT SYSTEM  IN ADDITION TO THE DELIVERABLE GEOLOGIC MAPS AND DATABASES, THE GSA WILL COMPARE THE STRATIGRAPHIC NOMENCLATURE USED IN THE MAP PRODUCTS WITH THE ENTRIES IN THE U S  GEOLOGIC NAMES LATE PALEOZOIC TECTONISM AND SEDIMENTATION AT SPRUCE MOUNTAIN, ELKO COUNTY, NEVADAPROJECT PERIOD: 07/26/2022 THROUGH 07/25/2023AWARD PURPOSE NEVADA IS AND HAS BEEN ONE OF THE MOST GEOLOGICALLY COMPLEX REGIONS OF THE UNITED STATES. THE STATE HAS UNDERGONE A SERIES OF DEFORMATION EVENTS FOR MUCH OF THE PAST 350 MILLION YEARS. HOWEVER, TO UNDERSTAND THE OLDER DEFORMATION EVENTS DETAILED GEOLOGIC ANALYSIS NEEDS TO BE USED TO SEE PAST ALL OF THE MORE RECENT DEFORMATION EVENTS. THESE ANALYTICAL TECHNIQUES INCLUDE GEOLOGIC MAPPING, DETAILED DESCRIPTION AND ANALYSIS OF ROCK UNITS AND FOSSILS, AND MEASUREMENT AND ANALYSIS OF GEOLOGIC STRUCTURES. UNDERSTANDING THESE OLD EVENTS IS IMPORTANT BECAUSE IT HELPS US UNDERSTAND THE EVOLUTION OF THE EARTH'S CRUST THROUGH TIME AND ACT AS A GUIDE FOR POTENTIAL LOCATIONS OF ECONOMIC RESOURCES.FOR THIS STUDY AN UNDERSTANDING THE FORMATION AND EVOLUTION OF THE HOGAN BASIN, DEPOSITS OF WHICH ARE EXPOSED IN SEVERAL MOUNTAIN RANGES IN NORTHEASTERN AND EAST-CENTRAL NEVADA. THE BASIN FORMED AROUND 310 MILLION YEARS AGO FOLLOWING AN EVENT OF FAULTING AND FOLDING. THE BASIN EXISTED FOR A FEW MILLION YEARS AND THEN ITSELF WAS UPLIFTED AND ERODED. HOWEVER, DETAILED INFORMATION ON THE BASIN FROM A FEW AREAS IN THE SOUTHERN AND NORTHERN PARTS OF THE BASIN. THEREFORE, TO FILL IN A LARGE GAP OF INFORMATION ON THE HOGAN BASIN, PLANS TO MAP THE SPRUCE MOUNTAIN 7.5 MINUTE QUADRANGLE IN NORTHEASTERN NEVADA. IN ADDITION TO MAPPING A DETAILED DESCRIPTIONS AND ANALYZE FOSSILS FROM THE HOGAN BASIN. UNDERSTANDING THIS BASIN WILL HELP US TEST COMPETING MODELS OF DEFORMATION AND PLATE TECTONICS IN WESTERN NORTH AMERICA AT THAT TIME AND POTENTIALLY CAN BE USED FOR NEW CONCEPTS FOR RESOURCE EXPLORATION. ADDITIONALLY THE PROJECT WILL RESULT IN DIRECT TRAINING OF ONE GRADUATE AND THREE UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS IN GEOLOGIC MAPPING.- ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED AS PART OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE:FIELD MAPPING WITHIN THE SPRUCE MOUNTAIN, NV 7.5 MINUTE QUADRANGLEMEASURING STRATIGRAPHIC SECTIONS WITHIN THE QUADRANGLE, FOCUSED ON MIDDLE TO UPPER PENNSYLVANIAN ROCKSMEASUREMENT AND STRUCTURAL ANALYSIS OF FAULTS AND FOLDS IN THE SPRUCE MOUNTAIN QUADRANGLE THIN SECTION PETROGRAPHIC AND BIOSTRATIGRAPHIC ANALYSIS OF SAMPLES FROM THE MIDDLE PENNSYLVANIAN HOGAN FORMATION AND OVERLYING UPPER PENNSYLVANIAN RIEPE SPRING LIMESTONE DIGITIZATION OF MAP AND CROSS-SECTION(S)IMPORTING STRATIGRAPHIC COLUMNS ANNOTATED WITH THIN SECTION PHOTOS AND BIOSTRATIGRAPHIC DATA INTO THE STRABOSPOT ONLINE DATABASE- DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES; GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE SPRUCE MOUNTAIN, NV QUADRANGLE AT 1:24,000 SCALE, INCLUDING CROSS-SECTION(S), MEASURED STRATIGRAPHIC COLUMNS, AND ROCK DESCRIPTIONS.

NEW GEOLOGIC MAPPING AND GEMS COMPILATION WORK IN SUPPORT OF THE USGI IN THE MOUNTAINS, PIEDMONT, AND COASTAL PLAIN IN NORTH CAROLINAPROJECT PERIOD: 07/01/2022 - 06/30/2023: (1) TRAIN, UNCW M.S. GEOLOGY GRADUATE STUDENT, IN TRADITIONAL AND DIGITAL GEOLOGIC MAPPING IN THE VA PIEDMONT TO LEARN HOW TO CONDUCT MINERAL ANALYSES ON METAMORPHIC ROCKS AND FAULT ZONES; (2) ADDRESS STRUCTURAL, ENVIRONMENTAL, AND GEOHAZARD QUESTIONS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND VA GEOLOGY; (3) IDENTIFY GEOLOGICALLY ORIENTED SOCIOECONOMIC ISSUES FOCUSED ON ENVIRONMENTAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL PATTERNS, AND MINERAL RESOURCE POTENTIAL; AND (4) ENHANCE COLLABORATION AND DATA COLLECTION EFFORTS BY VA ENERGY, AND THE NORTH CAROLINA AND U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEYS.BEGINS 11/1/2022 AND ENDS 10/31/2023. OUR EDMAP FY22 STUDY LINKS TRADITIONAL GEOLOGIC MAPPING WITH DIGITAL DATA CAPTURE AND STORAGE ON A 32 GB WIFI+CELLULAR IPAD TABLET. USE OF TOPO MAPS FOR IPAD AND AVENZA PDF MAP APPS ADAPTED FOR GEOLOGIC MAPPING, WHICH LINK GEOREFERENCED DATA LOCATIONS TO DAILY TRAVERSES, AND THE NUMBERS APP, WHICH HAS DROPDOWN MENUS FOR LISTING ROCK OUTCROP FIELD ATTRIBUTES. ALL APP DATA IMPORT INTO ARCGIS FOR FUTURE MAP DELIVERABLE CONSTRUCTION. THE GRADUATE STUDENT WILL USE THE IPAD CAMERA AND SKETCHBOOK APP TO DIGITALLY ANNOTATE FIELD PHOTOS, AND HE WILL COLLECT ROCKS SAMPLES FOR LAB ANALYSES. WHILE MAPPING, THE GRADUATE STUDENT WILL HIKE ROADSIDES AND STREAMS USING THE IANNOTATE APP TO MAP ON PDF FIELD SHEETS REGISTERED TO SECTIONS OF HIS FIELD AREA. IANNOTATE APP ALLOWS DRAWING OF COLORED POLYGONS, LINES, AND STRUCTURE DATA AND CONDUCTING FIELD EVALUATION OF MAP RESULTS. ROCK CONTACTS ARE TRANSFERRED TO ARCGIS FILES FORMATTED TO USGS MAP CRITERIA. OUR GEOLOGIC MATERIALS LAB IS EQUIPPED FOR ROCK ANALYSES.THE FIELD AREA IN BRUNSWICK COUNTY LIES JUST SOUTH OF THE RICHMOND METROPOLITAN STATISTICAL AREA, HOME TO 1.4 MILLION PEOPLE, AND IN BETWEEN EMPORIA AND SOUTH BOSTON, VA. SURROUNDING COUNTIES ARE MECKLENBURG, LUNENBURG, NOTTAWAY, DINWIDDIE, AND GREENSVILLE WHERE CITIZENS COMMUTE ALONG THE I-85, I-95, U.S. 1, AND U.S. 58 URBAN CORRIDORS TO RICHMOND, PETERSBURG, HOPEWELL, COLONIAL HEIGHTS, EMPORIA, AND SOUTH BOSTON, VA, AS WELL AS ROANOKE RAPIDS, NC. RESIDENTS INTERESTED IN GEOLOGY BENEFIT FROM MAPPING FOCUSED ON VA ENERGY CRITERIA THAT EVALUATE THE CONNECTIONS AMONG: (1) ONGOING CHANGE IN URBAN AND SUBURBAN LAND-USE DEVELOPMENT, 2) MINERAL RESOURCES POTENTIAL, 3) GEOLOGIC HAZARDS, 4) POPULATION CENTERS OR HIGHLY DEVELOPED AREAS, AND 5) EXPANSION OF EXISTING OR DEVELOPING NEW INTERSTATE AND STATE HIGHWAYS. THE GEOLOGIC MAPPING POTENTIALLY LEADS TO: (1) INFORMED GEOTECHNICAL AND INFRASTRUCTURE ASSESSMENTS FOR ROADWAYS, BRIDGE AND BUILDING FOUNDATION STABILITY, AND SOLID WASTE AND WATER-SEWER FACILITIES; (2) DATA ON LOCAL SURFACE AND SUBSURFACE ROCK-WATER INTERACTIONS THAT AFFECT GROWTH, DEVELOPING CRITICAL AND STRATEGIC MINERALS, AND ROCKS EMITTING RADON GAS, AND (3) MAXIMIZING AND UNDERSTANDING OF ROCK AND MINERAL RESOURCES AND COMMODITIES SUCH AS ROCK AGGREGATE. PROFITABLE COUNTY ROCKS WOULD BENEFIT JOB OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE LOCAL ECONOMY.

UTAH 2022 STATEMAP PROPOSALPROJECT PERIOD: 07/01/2022 THROUGH 06/30/2024IS ABSTRACT SUMMARIZES THE FY 2022 USGS NATIONAL COOPERATIVE GEOLOGIC MAPPING PROGRAM STATEMAP AWARD FOR THE UTAH GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (UGS). FOR THIS AWARD THE UTAH GEOLOGICAL SURVEY PROPOSES PROJECTS IN BOTH PARTS OF THE NATIONAL COOPERATIVE GEOLOGIC MAPPING PROGRAM STATEMAP OPPORTUNITY. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS WORK INCLUDE VARIOUS GEOLOGICAL RESOURCE INTEREST GROUPS SUCH AS OIL AND GAS, CRITICAL MINERALS, METALLIC MINERALS, INDUSTRIAL MINERALS, LAND USE PLANNING, EARTHQUAKE HAZARD REDUCTION, WATER RESOURCES BOTH SURFACE WATER AND GROUNDWATER, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC OF THE STATE OF UTAH.IN PART I (NEW MAPPING), GUIDANCE CATEGORY 1 (GC1), THE UGS PROPOSES TO COMPLETE NEW GEOLOGIC MAPS OF SEVEN 7.5' QUADRANGLES. ALL ARE TOP PRIORITIES OF THE UTAH STATE MAPPING ADVISORY COMMITTEE (SMAC) BASED ON LONG- AND SHORT-RANGE GOALS, AND ALL HAVE A SIGNIFICANCE RANKING OF 5 OUT OF 5 IN OUR RECENT EVALUATION OF QUADRANGLES IN UTAH.IN PART II (US GEOFRAMEWORK INITIATIVE), WE PROPOSE PROJECTS IN SIX OF THE NINE CATEGORIES. IN GC3 WE PROPOSE TO COMPLETE THE FINAL MAPPING OF THREE MULTI-YEAR 30'X60' QUADRANGLES, FOR COMPILATION INTO OUR STATEWIDE INTERMEDIATE-SCALE MAP SERIES. IN GC4 WE PROPOSE TO COMPLETE DATA COMPILATION AND SUBSURFACE 3D MAPPING USING SHALLOW ENGINEERING BOREHOLES IN ONE 7.5' QUADRANGLE IN SALT LAKE VALLEY. IN GC6 WE PROPOSE TO COMPLETE LEVEL-3 GEMS GEODATABASE COMPILATIONS OF PUBLISHED GEOLOGIC MAPS RANGING FROM 1 TO 20 YEARS OLD OF FIRE 7.5' AND ONE 30'X60' QUADRANGLES.

GEOLOGIC MAPPING IN IOWA FY2022 PROJECT PERIOD: 07/01/2022 - 06/30/2023THE IOWA GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (IGS) IS PROPOSING FOUR SUBPROJECTS FOR FY22 (FIGURE 1). SUBPROJECT 1CONTINUES THE IGS'S MAPPING EFFORTS IN SOUTHEAST IOWA AND WILL INCLUDE BEDROCK AND SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAPSOF DES MOINES COUNTY (CATEGORY 1 - GUIDANCE CRITERIA 1). GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF NW 1/2 OF CHESTNUT HILL, DYERSBURG, NW 1/2 OF RUSSELLVILLE, WILDER, DRILLING IN LANE, TN 7.5' QUADRANGLES, COMPILATION OF 3 DERIVATIVE MAPS, AND CONVERSION OF 2 GEOLOGIC MAPS  PROJECT PERIOD: 07/01/2022 - 06/30/2023GEOLOGY OF THE LEAPWOOD 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE, MCNAIRY COUNTY, TENNESSEEAN EDMAP PROPOSAL BY WILLIAM T. JACKSON, JR.PLAIN LANGUAGE DESCRIPTIONTHE LEAPWOOD 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE, IN WESTERN TENNESSEE, CONTAINS SEDIMENTARY ROCKS IMPORTANT TO UNDERSTANDING EASTERN NORTH AMERICA DURING THE CRETACEOUS PERIOD (~ 80 TO 65 MILLION YEARS AGO). CONDUCTING GEOLOGIC MAPPING AND HEAVY MINERAL ANALYSIS OF ROCKS WITHIN THE LEAPWOOD QUADRANGLE WILL PROVIDE VALUABLE INFORMATION ABOUT THE SPATIAL DISTRIBUTION OF SAND UNITS THAT CAN BENEFIT THE SAND AND GRAVEL INDUSTRY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SAFETY ASSESSMENTS IN WESTERN TENNESSEE. A COLLABORATIVE TEAM FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF MEMPHIS AND THE UNIVERSITY OF TENNESSEE AT MARTIN WILL CONDUCT THIS WORK. TO COMPLETE THIS WORK GEOLOGIC MAPPING AND GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SOFTWARE (GIS) WILL BE COUPLED WITH HEAVY MINERAL ANALYSIS. RESULTS FROM THIS WORK WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH DISTRIBUTION OF A GEOLOGIC MAP, CROSS SECTION, AND WRITTEN REPORT BY THE U.S. GEOLOGIC SURVEY, THE TENNESSEE GEOLOGIC SURVEY, AND THE COON CREEK SCIENCE CENTER (LOCATED WITHIN THE LEAPWOOD QUADRANGLE).ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDDEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT & CONSERVATION TENNESSE WILL CONDUCT BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAPPING, AS WELL AS SURFICIAL MAPPING OF UNCONSOLIDATED QUATERNARY DEPOSITS THROUGHOUT THE LEAPWOOD QUADRANGLE IN WESTERN TENNESSEE. SUBSURFACE 3D PROJECTIONS OF STRATIGRAPHIC UNITS IN THE LEAPWOOD QUADRANGLE WILL BE PERFORMED FROM GEOLOGIC MAPPING DATA. HEAVY MINERAL ANALYSIS OF SAND UNITS THROUGHOUT THE QUADRANGLE WILL BE CONDUCTED ON SAMPLES COLLECTED DURING GEOLOGIC MAPPING.DELIVERABLES AND INTENDED OUTCOMESTHIS WORK WILL RESULT IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF A GEOLOGIC MAP, STRATIGRAPHIC COLUMN, CROSS SECTION, AND WRITTEN REPORT FOR THE LEAPWOOD QUADRANGLE IN WESTERN TENNESSEE. IN ADDITION, HEAVY MINERAL CHARACTERIZATION OF SAND UNITS FROM DETRITAL-ZIRCON GEOCHRONOLOGY AND X-RAY DIFFRACTION WILL BE DETERMINED.INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES) AS WELL AS SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESTHIS WORK IS INTENDED TO BENEFIT THE SAND AND GRAVEL INDUSTRY OF WESTERN TENNESSEE, AS WELL AS ENVIRONMENTAL AND GOVERNMENTAL HAZARDOUS WASTE MITIGATION PLANNING EFFORTS. THE PUBLIC WILL ALSO BENEFIT FROM THE PRODUCTION OF BASIC GEOLOGIC INFORMATION FOR THE LEAPWOOD QUADRANGLE THROUGH SCIENCE EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH EFFORTS, PLANNED THROUGH THE COON CREEK SCIENCE CENTER (LOCATED WITHIN THE QUADRANGLE). UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF TENNESSEE MARTIN WILL BENEFIT FROM TRAVEL SUPPORT FROM THIS GRANT, WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR TRAINING IN GEOLOGIC MAPPING TECHNIQUES.

NEW AND DERIVATIVE MAPPING IN WASHINGTON STATEPROJECT PERIOD: 06/30/2022 THROUGH 06/29/2023DETAILED SURFICIAL AND BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THREE AND A HALF 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLES IN TWO GEOGRAPHIC AREAS. ALL OF THESE AREAS WILL BENEFIT FROM DETAILED GRAVITY STUDIES AND MODELING OF POTENTIAL-FIELD GEOPHYSICS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND SUBSURFACE CONDITIONS. OUR MAPPING EFFORTS WILL HAVE CONSIDERABLE IMPACT ON THE PUBLIC THROUGH THE CHARACTERIZATION OF GEOLOGIC HAZARDS AND THE RESPONSIBLE USE OF NATURAL RESOURCES. THE NEW GEOLOGIC MAPPING WILL ALSO PROVIDE MUCH-NEEDED INFORMATION TO TEST MODELS OF HOW STRAIN FROM AN OBLIQUE SUBDUCTION ZONE DEFORMS THE UPPER CRUST AND IS TRANSFERRED BETWEEN THE FOREARC AND BACKARC.FIELD MAPPING WILL OCCUR FROM JULY 1, 2022 THROUGH NOVEMBER 15, 2022. SAMPLES WILL BE SENT FOR ANALYSIS DURING THIS TIME. MAP CREATION, ANALYSIS OF NEW AND EXISTING DATA, AND REPORT GENERATION WILL OCCUR FROM NOVEMBER, 2022 THROUGH JUNE, 2023. EDITING AND MAP PRODUCTION WILL OCCUR FROM JUNE, 2023 THROUGH DECEMBER, 2023.OUR FINAL DELIVERABLES WILL BE GEOLOGIC MAPS AT 1:24,000-SCALE, AN ASSOCIATED MAP PAMPHLET, AND A ISOSTATIC GRAVITY MAP AND MODEL FOR EACH OF THE FOLLOWING AREAS: HARTS LAKE 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE; BALD HILL 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE; KITTITAS 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE; AND THE SOUTH HALF OF THE EAST KITTITAS 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE.

2022-2024 VERMONT GEOLOGICAL SURVEY STATEMAP AWARD PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYPROJECT PERIOD: 06/07/2022 THROUGH 06/06/2024VERMONT WILL DELIVER TWO PROJECTS; THE FIRST ("PROJECT 1") IS FOCUSED ON NEW SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAPPING AT 1:24,000 SCALE FOR FIVE 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLES, THREE OF WHICH REQUIRE JUST PARTIAL MAPPING TO FILL IN DATA GAPS WITHIN THOSE QUADRANGLES. DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE FULL QUADRANGLES AND LEVEL-3 GEMS-COMPLIANT GEODATABASES. THE FIVE QUADRANGLES REPRESENT THE ONLY AREAS REMAINING WITHIN THE GREATER MONTPELIER 30-MINUTE X 60-MINUTE QUADRANGLE ("ONE-DEGREE SHEET") THAT REQUIRE NEW MAPPING; THE SECOND PROJECT ("PROJECT 2") FOCUSES ON COMPILING ALL THIRTY-TWO 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE MAPS WITHIN THE MONTPELIER ONE-DEGREE SHEET ALONG WITH DERIVATIVE MAPS AND A LEVEL-3 GEMS-COMPLIANT GEODATABASE.THE DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH PROJECT 1 INCLUDE DIGITALLY-PREPARED SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAPS, CROSS-SECTIONS AND LEVEL-3 GEMS-COMPLIANT GEODATABASES FOR THE MOUNT WORCESTER, WATERBURY, MIDDLESEX, PEACHAM, AND WARREN 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLES. THE DELIVERABLES FOR PROJECT 2 INCLUDE ONE DIGITALLY-PREPARED 1:100,000-SCALE SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAP COMPILATION OF THE MONTPELIER ONE-DEGREE SHEET (INCLUDING THE FIVE NEW 1:24,000 SCALE SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAPS FROM PROJECT 1) AND THREE SEAMLESS DERIVATIVE MAPS OF THE ABOVE COMPILATION, INCLUDING A DEPTH-TO-BEDROCK MAP (ISOPACH), A BEDROCK SURFACE CONTOUR MAP AND A GLACIAL STRIATION MAP. FOR PROJECT 2, THE DELIVERABLE PACKAGE WILL ALSO INCLUDE ONE LEVEL-3 GEMS-COMPLIANT GEODATABASE OF ALL THIRTY-TWO EDGE-MATCHED 7.5' SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAP QUADRANGLES WITHIN THE MONTPELIER ONE-DEGREE SHEET PLUS ALL DERIVATIVE MAPPING DATA. ADDITIONALLY, ONE README FILE WILL BE PREPARED THAT CONTAINS METADATA FOR HOW THE COMPILATION AND DERIVATIVE MAPS WERE CONSTRUCTED.THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF OUR PROJECT WORK INCLUDE PRIVATE CONSULTANTS, GOVERNMENT SCIENTISTS, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC ENGAGED IN IDENTIFYING WATER RESOURCES, CHARACTERIZING CONTAMINATED SITES, INFORMING MANAGEMENT PRACTICES TO AVOID GROUNDWATER CONTAMINATION, CREATING GROUNDWATER PROTECTION OVERLAY DISTRICTS, PREPARING TRANSPORTATION RESILIENCE PLANS, IDENTIFYING LANDSLIDE-PRONE AREAS, DEFINING GROUNDWATER RECHARGE AREAS AND POTENTIAL FUTURE PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY AREAS, AND LOCATING MINERAL RESOURCES. THE COMPILED DERIVATIVE MAPS IN THE MONTPELIER ONE-DEGREE SHEET WILL ALSO BE OF VALUE TO THE USGS FOR COMPILING A TOP-OR-ROCK MAP FOR NEW ENGLAND AND FOR A NEW GLACIATED REGIONS GEOLOGIC MAPPING PROJECT.THE SUBRECIPIENTS OF FUNDING FOR PROJECTS 1 AND 2 INCLUDE ONE CONTRACTOR AND ONE GRANTEE WHO WILL LEAD THE FIELD-MAPPING EFFORTS, WITH ASSISTANCE FROM STUDENTS AND THE VERMONT GEOLOGICAL SURVEY STAFF. FOR PROJECT 1, SUBRECIPIENTS WILL USE TRADITIONAL FIELD-MAPPING TECHNIQUES ALONG WITH MODERN DIGITAL MAPPING TOOLS TO ESTABLISH SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC CONTACTS AND IDENTIFY ICE-FLOW INDICATORS WITHIN THE SURFICIAL GEOLOGY AND BEDROCK OUTCROP SURFACES. CROSS SECTIONS WILL BE CONSTRUCTED USING EXISTING WATER-WELL LOGS, BORINGS, SOILS DATA, AND FIELD DATA. VERMONT GEOLOGICAL SURVEY STAFF WILL PREPARE THE LEVEL- 3 GEMS-COMPLIANT GEODATABASES. FOR PROJECT 2, OUR GRANTEE WILL SUBSTANTIALLY SUPPORT THE COMPILATION OF THE MONTPELIER ONE-DEGREE SHEET, TO INCLUDE TRANSFERRING SURFICIAL MAPS COMPLETED IN 1999-2018 FROM TOPOGRAPHIC BASE MAPS TO A LIDAR BASE, EDGE-MATCHING INDIVIDUAL 7.5-MINUTE SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAPS, IMPLEMENTING CONSISTENT UNITS, NOMENCLATURE AND SYMBOLOGY FOR MAP UNITS, AND PREPARING THE LEVEL-3 GEMS-COMPLIANT GEODATABASE.

STATEMAP 2022: GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF PRIORITY AREAS IN WISCONSINPROJECTPERIOD: 06/06/2022 THROUGH 06/05/2024AWARD PURPOSETHIS AWARD PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE WISCONSIN GEOLOGICAL AND NATURAL HISTORY SURVEY TO COMPLETE GEOLOGIC MAPPING PROJECTS IN PRIORITY AREAS AS IDENTIFIED BY THEIR LONG-RANGE MAPPING PLAN AND SUPPORTED BY THE WISCONSIN GEOLOGIC MAPPING ADVISORY COMMITTEE. FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE AWARD IS MATCHED BY AT LEAST 1:1 WITH STATE-PROVIDED FUNDING.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDPLANNED ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MAPPING OF QUATERNARY AND BEDROCK GEOLOGY, FIELD WORK AND SAMPLING, DRILLING OF ROCK AND SEDIMENT CORES, LABORATORY ANALYSIS OF THE MINERALOGY/GEOCHEMISTRY OF ROCK SAMPLES AND THE RADIOCARBON AGE OF ORGANIC SAMPLES, TRAVEL TO CONFERENCES TO PRESENT WORK AND ENGAGE IN PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND THE PREPARATION AND PUBLICATION OF THE RESULTING GEOLOGIC MAPS AND REPORTS.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMESDELIVERABLES FOR THIS AWARD INCLUDE PRELIMINARY GEOLOGIC MAPS AND AN ACCOMPANYING TECHNICAL REPORT FROM SAUK, LAFAYETTE, LA CROSSE, JEFFERSON AND SOUTHWESTERN JUNEAU COUNTIES IN WI. NON-MAP DELIVERABLES INCLUDE DIGITAL GEOLOGIC MAP DATABASES OF PREVIOUSLY-PUBLISHED (PAPER ONLY) GEOLOGIC MAPS FROM MARATHON, PORTAGE, ADAMS, AND JUNEAU COUNTIES, A DIGITAL RASTER SURFACE OF A NEW BEDROCK ELEVATION MODEL OF THE ENTIRE STATE, AND NEW AND REVISED CATALOG ENTRIES INTO A NATIONAL DATABASE OF GEOLOGIC SURVEY PUBLICATIONS OF SOME 520 PAST WGNHS PUBLICATIONS.FUTURE OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE THE PUBLICATION OF THE PRELIMINARY GEOLOGIC MAPS LISTED ABOVE FOLLOWING COMPLETION OF THE MAPPING AND SUCCESSFUL PEER REVIEW.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESINTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE, BROADLY, ALL RESIDENTS OF WISCONSIN INCLUDING PUBLIC, PRIVATE, AND ACADEMIC ORGANIZATIONS. SPECIFICALLY, THE PRODUCTS WILL BENEFIT LAND USE PLANNERS, ENVIRONMENTAL CONSULTANTS, SCIENTISTS INTERESTED IN THE GEOLOGIC HISTORY OF THE REGION, INTERESTED RESIDENTS, AND STATE AND FEDERAL GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIESA COLLABORATOR AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA-DULUTH WILL PROVIDE EXPERTISE CHARACTERIZING AND INTERPRETING PETROGRAPHY AND MINERAL COMPOSITION OF PRECAMBRIAN UNITS WITHIN THE BARABOO(SAUK COUNTY) PROJECT MAP AREA, WITH PARTICULAR FOCUS ON IRON FORMATION LITHOLOGIES.

WYOMING STATE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY'S PROPOSAL TO PRODUCE GEOLOGIC MAPS IN TWO PROJECT AREAS: THE RAMSHORN WEST, AND FIREHOLE CANYON.PROJECT PERIOD: 06/03/2021 THROUGH 06/02/2022PURPOSETHE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO CONDUCT GEOLOGIC MAPPING IN THE WYOMING QUADRANGLE, DELAWARE AND PRODUCE A DELIVERABLE OF A SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAP WITH ACCOMPANYING DIGITAL DATA THAT SUPPORT THE MAPPING.ACTIVITIESMAPPING IS TO BE CONDUCTED AT 1:24,000 SCALE FOR CONTINUITY WITH OTHER SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAPS IN THE STATE.NEW DATA WILL BE COLLECTED THROUGH THE NUMEROUS DRILLING AND HAND AUGER HOLES PLANNED FOR THIS PROJECTNEW DRILL DATA WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY THE RESULTS OF ACTIVE AND RECENTLY COMPLETED GEOLOGIC PROJECTS AT THE DGS.DELIVERABLES SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE WYOMING QUADRANGLELEVEL THREE GEMS DATABASE FOR THE GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE WYOMING QUADRANGLE, DELAWAREEXPECTED OUTCOMESENHANCED GEOLOGIC INTERPRETATIONS AND DATA TO INFORM POLICY AND MITIGATION RELATED TO THE FOLLOWING ISSUES.MANAGEMENT OF THE NORMAN G. WILDER WILDLIFE AREA COMPRISED OF UPLAND MATURE FOREST, SWAMPS, AND WOODY WETLANDS.WITH GROWING POPULATION IN THIS AREA COMES AN INCREASED DEMAND FOR GROUNDWATER. OVER PUMPING OF AQUIFERS IN THIS AREA IS A CONCERN.THE MAP AREA IS DIRECTLY DOWN-DIP OF NUMEROUS REGIONAL AND LOCAL ENVIRONMENTALLY-CHALLENGED AREAS INCLUDING THE DOVER AIR FORCE BASE THAT HAS PFAS CONTAMINATION ISSUES AND THE DOVER GAS LIGHT COMPANY SUPERFUND SITE. INVESTIGATING INCREMENTAL GROWTH SHEET-BY-SHEET: GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THE JACKASS LAKES PLUTON IN THE CENTRAL SIERRA NEVADA OF CALIFORNIAPROJECT PERIOD 06/01/2022 - 05/31/2023AWARD PURPOSE THIS PROJECT PROVIDES SUPPORT TO TRAIN ONE GRADUATE AND ONE UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT PRIMARY MAPPER AND EACH OF THEIR FIELD ASSISTANTS IN GEOLOGIC FIELD MAPPING OF IGNEOUS ROCKS IN THE HIGH SIERRA NEVADA MOUNTAINS IN CALIFORNIA. COLLECTIVELY, THEY WILL PRODUCE A CA. 70 KM2 NEW GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE NORTHWESTERN AND CENTRAL PART OF THE JACKASS LAKES PLUTON IN 1:10,000 SCALE OVER FOUR TO FIVE WEEKS IN THE SUMMER. IGNEOUS ROCK SAMPLES OF PLUTONIC AND VOLCANIC NATURE WILL BE TAKEN TO THE LABS AT CAL STATE FULLERTON AND COLLABORATING INSTITUTIONS TO ANALYZE FOR MINERAL COMPOSITIONS, AGE DATES AND ELEMENT GEOCHEMISTRY TO DETERMINE THE COMPOSITIONS AND SOURCES OF THESE MAGMAS THROUGHOUT THE FOLLOWING ACADEMIC YEAR. DURING THIS TIME FRAME, ALL MAPS WILL BE DIGITIZED AND SYNTHESIZED IN ARCGIS. THE MAPPING AND ANALYTICAL WORK WILL BE IMPORTANT FOR UNDERSTANDING THE FORMATION AND SPATIAL AND TEMPORAL EVOLUTION OF THE ORIGINAL JACKASS LAKES PLUTON MAGMAS AND THEIR RELATIONSHIP TO THE ERUPTED VOLCANIC MATERIALS PRESERVED IN BETWEEN SEGMENTS OF THE PLUTONIC ROCKS. THIS EDMAP PROJECT IS THE MS STUDENT'S THESIS PROJECT FOR HER FIRST YEAR OF GRADUATE STUDIES AND ALL THREE UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT'S SENIOR THESIS PROJECTS. THE MAPS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO CALIFORNIA STATE AND USGS NATIONAL MAPPING EFFORTS.- ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED; 4-5 WEEKS OF FIELD MAPPING AND SAMPLING IN THE SIERRA NEVADA MOUNTAINS DURING THE FALL AND SPRING SEMESTERS: ROCK PREPARATION AND MICROSCOPIC ANALYSIS (PETROGRAPHY), STRUCTURAL ANALYSIS OF FIELD DATA, U-PB ZIRCON GEOCHRONOLOGIC ANALYSIS FOR AGE DATES OF PLUTONIC AND VOLCANIC ROCKS, XRF AND LA-ICPMS ELEMENT GEOCHEMISTRY, ALL WILL BE USED TO CHARACTERIZE THE PLUTONIC AND VOLCANIC UNITSDIGITIZE AND SYNTHESIZE ALL MAPS IN ARCGIS WITH AID OF ANALYTICAL DATA FOR A COMPREHENSIVE GEOLOGIC MAP DELIVERY TO EDMAP, AND TO CALIFORNIA STATE AND USGS FOR MAP COMPILATIONS- DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES;GRADUATE MAPPER: 42 KM2 OF NEW MAPPING IN THE NORTHCENTRAL PART OF THE JACKASS LAKES PLUTON AND VOLCANIC HOST ROCKS; THEY WILL ALSO BE IN CHARGE TO COMPILE TWO SMALL 1:10,000 MAPS ALREADY PUBLISHED (CA. 10 KM2 COMBINED) AND HER OWN AND THE UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT'S MAP INTO ONE CA. 70 KM2 FINAL GEOLOGIC MAP AT 1:10,000 SCALE IN ARCGIS. THIS EDMAP PROJECT REPRESENTS A SIGNIFICANT PART OF THE UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT'S SENIOR THESIS.THE TWO UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT FIELD ASSISTANTS WILL EACH BE COMPLETING A LAB-FOCUSED SENIOR THESIS AS PART OF THIS PROJECT.THE 7.5' QUADRANGLES TO BE MAPPED INCLUDE 40% TIMBER KNOB, AND <10% OF EACH SING PEAK, MERCED PEAK, AND MT LYELL TOPOGRAPHIC MAPS

TITLE: STRUCTURAL STYLE AND EXHUMATION HISTORY OF THE FRISCO THRUST SHEET, SEVIER FOLD-THRUST BELT, WEST-CENTRAL UTAHPROJECT PERIOD: 05/25/2022 THROUGH 05/24/2023THIS STUDY EXPLORES THE GEOMETRY, KINEMATICS, AND SEQUENCE OF FAULT DEVELOPMENT IN THE SAN FRANCISCO MOUNTAINS, WEST-CENTRAL UTAH, THROUGH 1:24,000-SCALE GEOLOGIC MAPPING. THE MAP DATA AND ASSOCIATED STRUCTURAL ANALYSES WILL BE USED TO TEST CORRELATIONS OF THE FRISCO THRUST WITH THE CANYON RANGE-WILLARD THRUST TO THE NORTH AND THE WAH WAH THRUST TO THE SOUTH, AND ARE COMPLIMENTED BY EFFORTS TO MORE QUANTITATIVELY CONSTRAIN THE UPLIFT AND EROSION HISTORY OF THE REGION THROUGH RADIOMETRIC DATING OF THE BEDROCK.THE PRIMARY ACTIVITIES FOR THE STUDY ARE GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THE BEDROCK AND SURFICIAL GEOLOGY, STRUCTURAL ANALYSIS VIA STEREOGRAPHIC PROJECTIONS AND RETRODEFORMABLE CROSS-SECTION CONSTRUCTION, AND GEOCHRONOLOGIC AND THERMOCHRONOLOGIC DATING OF BEDROCK UNITS. THE MAIN DELIVERABLES FOR THE STUDY ARE TWO 1:24,000-SCALE DIGITAL GEOLOGIC MAPS (~50 SQ. KM EACH) AND GIS DATABASES ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE FRISCO PEAK, HIGH ROCK, BROWN KNOLL, AND IRON MINE PASS 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLES. A MASTER'S STUDENT WILL BE THE FIRST AUTHOR FOR ONE OF THE MAPS AND A PH.D. STUDENT WILL BE FIRST AUTHOR FOR THE OTHER. A SUMMARY TECHNICAL REPORT THAT INCLUDES STRUCTURAL ANALYSIS PRODUCTS, NEW AGE AND SEDIMENTOLOGIC DATA, AND AN INTERPRETATION OF THE STRUCTURAL AND TECTONIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE FRISCO THRUST AND OTHER FAULTS IN THE STUDY AREA WILL ALSO BE PROVIDED.OUTCOMES OF THE PROJECT INCLUDE A MORE ROBUST UNDERSTANDING OF THE TIMING AND DEVELOPMENT OF CONTRACTIONAL AND EXTENSIONAL FAULTS IN THE REGION. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF QUATERNARY FAULTS ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE SAN FRANCISCO MOUNTAINS, WHICH COULD AID IN FUTURE PALEOSEISMIC AND HAZARD STUDIES OF THESE YOUNG FAULTS. THE STUDY WILL BE LED BY A FEMALE ASSISTANT PROFESSOR AND PROVIDES TRAINING AND SUPPORT FOR TWO GRADUATE STUDENTS (ONE FEMALE) AND TWO UNDERGRADUATE FIELD ASSISTANTS; THEREFORE, THE STUDY ALSO HAS LONG-TERM BENEFITS BY CONTRIBUTING TO THE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND ADVANCEMENT OF AN EARLY CAREER FACULTY MEMBER AND AT LEAST FOUR STUDENTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THE STUDY INCLUDE THE GEOLOGIC RESEARCH COMMUNITY AND INDUSTRY AND GOVERNMENT ENTITIES INVOLVED IN LAND-USE PLANNING AND SEISMIC HAZARD ASSESSMENTS.

DETAILED REMOTE SENSING AND GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THE IRON SPRINGS FORMATION AND THE THREE PEAKS LACCOLITH IN THE SOUTHERN PORTION OF THE THREE PEAKS 7.5-MINUTE QUADRANGLE, IRON COUNTY, UTAH.PROJECT PERIOD: 05/15/2022 THROUGH 05/14/2023PROJECT ABSTRACT PLAIN LANGUAGE SUMMARYGEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THE "THREE PEAKS" AREA, JUST WEST OF CEDAR CITY, IN IRON COUNTY, UTAH, WILL SERVE THE PUBLIC, AND OTHER STAKEHOLDER INTERESTS, BY PROVIDING GEOLOGIC INFORMATION ON THE PRESENCE, ABUNDANCE, DISTRIBUTION, AND AGE OF MINERALS, ROCK TYPES, FAULTS, GRAVEL, AND SAND. THIS FUNDAMENTAL KNOWLEDGE OF THE GEOLOGY OF THE THREE PEAKS AREA IS NECESSARY AND ESSENTIAL TO DEVELOPING PLANS FOR SUSTAINABLE UTILIZATION AND MANAGEMENT OF THESE LANDS. THE GEOLOGIC MAPPING WILL USE DATA COLLECTED FROM SATELLITES, GOOGLE EARTH, AERIAL PHOTOGRAPHY, AND IN-PERSON DIRECT OBSERVATION AND MEASUREMENT OF GEOLOGIC FEATURES IN THE FIELD (E.G., IDENTIFICATION OF ROCK TYPES, MINERAL ABUNDANCE, LOCATION OF FAULTS, ETC.). THESE DATA WILL BE COLLECTED BYA PH.D. STUDENT AND AN UNDERGRADUATE FIELD ASSISTANT UNDER THE SUPERVISION WITH THE UTAH GEOLOGICAL SURVEY. UPON COMPLETION OF THE GEOLOGIC FIELD MAPPING, A GEOLOGIC MAP, OVERLAIN ON A TOPOGRAPHIC BASE, WILL BE DELIVERED TO THE EDMAP PROGRAM OFFICER AND THE UTAH GEOLOGIC SURVEY. THE GEOLOGIC MAP WILL SHOW THE SPATIAL DISTRIBUTION OF ROCK TYPES, GEOLOGIC CONTACTS SUCH AS FAULTS, AND SURFICIAL DEPOSITS SUCH AS SAND AND GRAVEL, IN THE SOUTHERN PORTION OF THE THREE PEAKS 7.5 MINUTE QUADRANGLE IN IRON COUNTY, UTAH. IT WILL INCLUDE AN INTERPRETIVE GEOLOGIC CROSS-SECTION SHOWING THE SUBSURFACE (I.E., UNDERGROUND) DISTRIBUTION OF ROCK TYPES IN A VERTICAL PLANE, A DESCRIPTION OF GEOLOGIC ROCK TYPES THAT DEFINE THE MAP UNITS, AN EXPLANATION OF MAP SYMBOLS USED, THE AGE OF THE ROCK TYPE PRESENT, ARRANGED FROM OLDEST TO YOUNGEST, IN A STRATIGRAPHIC COLUMN, AND A SUMMARY OF GEOLOGIC DATA COLLECTED. THE RESULTS OF THIS MAPPING WILL PROVIDE FUNDAMENTAL DATA FOR THE STUDENT TO USE IN THEIR PH.D. RESEARCH ON UNDERSTANDING THE GEOLOGIC HISTORY OF THIS PORTION OF SOUTHWEST UTAH. THE UTAH GEOLOGIC SURVEY CAN USE THIS GEOLOGIC MAP TO EVALUATE THE ECONOMIC POTENTIAL OF THE IGNEOUS ROCKS AS SOURCES OF ELEMENTS (REES) OF STRATEGIC IMPORTANCE TO THE NATION AS WELL AS TO EVALUATE POTENTIAL IMPACTS ON GROUND WATER QUALITY. THE THREE PEAKS AREA IS A POPULAR DESTINATION FOR OUTDOOR RECREATION. THIS AREA HAS A RICH GEOLOGIC AND MINING HISTORY. THE GEOLOGIC MAP CAN FACILITATE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR EXPANDING TOURISM BY EVALUATING THE THREE PEAKS POTENTIAL AS A GEOHERITAGE SITE, FOR EXAMPLE BY DOCUMENTING THE IMPORTANCE OF MINING TO THE AREA OR IDENTIFY SUITABLE LOCATIONS FOR MINERAL COLLECTING. FINALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL SERVE TO TRAIN THE NEXT GENERATION OF GEOSCIENTISTS NEEDED TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY GEOLOGIC MAPS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE NATION.

THESIS OF A FIRST-YEAR GRADUATE STUDENT AT IDAHO STATE UNIVERSITY. IN PARTICULAR, THE STUDENT WILL REEVALUATE COMPETING KINEMATIC MODELS OF THRUSTING AND LATER HIGH MAGNITUDE EXTENSIONAL COLLAPSE BY CONTRIBUTING NEW DETAILED MAPPING, STRUCTURAL ANALYSIS, BALANCED CROSS-SECTION CONSTRUCTION, AND GEOCHRONOLOGIC DATA IN A KEY QUADRANGLE WHERE PREVIOUS STUDIES PARTIALLY OVERLAP. STUDENT'S THESIS.EXPECTED OUTCOMESTHE PRIMARY EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SOME RESOLUTION TO SEVERAL OUTSTANDING TECTONIC PROBLEMS IN SOUTHEAST IDAHO. HOWEVER, AN ADDITIONAL OUTCOME WILL BE A REFINED GEOLOGIC MAP PUBLISHED THROUGH THE IDAHO GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, THAT WILL BE FREELY AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC. SUCH PRODUCTS MAY PROVIDE VALUABLE INFORMATION FOR LAND-USE DECISIONS BY PROPERTY OWNERS, LOCAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS, OR FEDERAL LAND MANAGEMENT.

THE SURFICIAL GEOLOGY OF THE HARRISBURG 7 5 MINUTE QUADRANGLE, POINSETT COUNTY, ARKANSAS  USING GEOPHYSICS AND GEOLOGIC FRAMEWORK MAPPING TO CHARACTERIZE SURFACE INFILTRATION AND THE RECHARGEPROJECT PERIOD  09 07 2022 THROUGH 09 06 2023              AWARD PURPOSE THE HARRISBURG 7 5 MINUTE QUADRANGLE IN NORTHEASTERN ARKANSAS STRADDLES CROWLEY RIDGES WHERE IT IS RELATIVELY NARROW, AND WITHIN THE QUAD THE RIDGE CUTS THE MISSISSIPPI ALLUVIAL PLAIN INTO THE REGIONS KNOWN AS THE EASTERN AND WESTERN LOWLANDS  FIG  1   THE UPLAND AREAS OF CROWLEY S RIDGE INCLUDE COARSE GRAVEL DEPOSITS THAT ARE AN IMPORTANT ECONOMIC RESOURCE FOR THE AREA  ADDITIONALLY, LARGE, COARSE GRAINED ALLUVIAL FANS EMANATE FROM CROWLEY RIDGE INTO THE ALLUVIAL PLAIN, AND SOME COALESCE INTO LARGER COMPOSITE FANS   ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED THIS PROJECT WILL TEACH THE STUDENT HOW TO MAP AND CREATE A COMPREHENSIVE GEODATABASE, SO THE PROJECT WILL BEGIN IN THE OFFICE WITH THE POPULATION OF A USGS GEMS GEODATABASE WITH EXISTING DATA  THE PI WILL WORK WITH CLOSELY THE STUDENT ON COMPILING EXISTING DATA, TEACHING THE STUDENT HOW TO LOCATE AND ACCESS PRE EXISTING GEOLOGIC DATA FROM FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL ONLINE SOURCES, INCLUDING WATER WELL AND PETROLEUM DATABASES, DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION GEOTECHNICAL REPORTS, EPA DATA, USDA SOIL DATA, FEMA DATA, AND OLDER PAPER GEOLOGIC REPORTS   DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES 1  A 1 24,000 SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE HARRISBURG 7 5 MINUTE QUADRANGLE, WITH AT LEAST ONE CROSSSECTION2  ACCOMPANYING EXPLANATORY TEXT 3  ONE OR MORE ESRI GEODATABASES WITH ALL DIGITAL FILES 4  A 3D GEOLOGIC FRAMEWORK MODEL OF AN ALLUVIAL FAN, MADE IN A PETREL OR ARCMAP GEODATABASE

BEDROCK MAPPING OF SE BRANFORD QUADRANGLE, CTPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 05/15/2022 - 05/14/2023- AWARD PURPOSE THIS AWARD PROVIDES PARTIAL SUPPORT FOR STUDENT GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF A ~25 SQUARE MILE AREA IN SOUTH-CENTRAL CONNECTICUT- ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED; GEOLOGIC MAPPING, CHEMICAL AND PHYSICAL ROCK DESCRIPTION AND ROCK AGE DETERMINATION- DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES; BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAP AND ASSOCIATED REPORT- INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)UNITED STATES GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION, WESLEYAN UNIVERSITY, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC-PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYTHIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE MASTER'S THESIS RESEARCH OF A GRADUATE STUDENT AT WESLEYAN UNIVERSITY WHO WILL BE MAPPING THE GEOLOGY OF THE SOUTHEASTERN HALF OF THE 7.5-MINUTE BRANFORD QUADRANGLE IN SOUTH-CENTRAL CONNECTICUT. ROCKS EXPOSED IN THE MAP AREA ARE IMPORTANT TO UNDERSTANDING THE TECTONIC EVOLUTION OF SOUTHERN NEW ENGLAND FROM APPROXIMATELY 600 MILLION TO 65 MILLION YEARS AGO AS THEY WERE BROUGHT UP FROM MORE THAN 20 KM DEPTH TO NEAR THE EARTH'S SURFACE. THERE IS CURRENTLY NO PUBLISHED DETAILED (1:24000-SCALE) BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE QUADRANGLE.THE WORK WILL TRAIN A PROMISING GRADUATE STUDENT WHILE ADDRESSING GEOLOGICAL GOALS THAT INCLUDE: IDENTIFYING AND MAPPING A MAJOR TECTONIC BOUNDARY BETWEEN ANCIENT VOLCANIC ARC ROCKS AND CONTINENTAL ROCKS AND DESCRIBING FEATURES IN THE ROCKS THAT FORMED DURING THEIR JOURNEY FROM DEEP IN THE CRUST TO THE NEAR SURFACE AS THE REGION WAS EXTENDED FORMING THE NEARBY HARTFORD BASIN AND ULTIMATELY THE ATLANTIC OCEAN.COMPLETING THIS WORK WILL REQUIRE CAREFUL GEOLOGIC MAPPING AND THOROUGH ROCK DESCRIPTION, INCLUDING MICROSCOPIC STUDY, CHEMICAL ANALYSIS, AND AGE DETERMINATION. THIS ANALYTICAL WORK IS CRITICAL FOR IDENTIFYING THE ENVIRONMENTS WHERE THE ROCKS ORIGINALLY FORMED AND THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN ADJACENT BODIES OF ROCK. THE MAPPING WILL BE COMPLETED BY THE GRADUATE STUDENT OVER 100 FIELD DAYS WITH AN UNDERGRADUATE FIELD ASSISTANT, AND ANALYTICAL WORK WILL CONTINUE THROUGHOUT THE REMAINDER OF THE SCHOOL YEAR.IMPACTS OF THIS WORK ARE BROAD. MAPS AND CHEMICAL ANALYSES OF SOME ROCKS WILL HELP PREDICT HAZARDS SUCH AS NATURAL RADIATION IN WATER WELLS AND HOMES. DETAILED MAPS OF OPEN SPACE IN THE MAP AREA WILL BE USED BY THE PUBLIC FOR HIKING AND EDUCATION. ANALYSIS OF FRACTURES WILL AID IN PREDICTING WATER QUALITY AND WATER WELL YIELDS. PRODUCTS WILL INCLUDE A BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAP AT 1:24,000 SCALE FOLLOWING GUIDELINES OF THE UNITED STATES GEOLOGICAL SURVEY THAT INCLUDES ALL OF THE COLLECTED DATA. ASSOCIATED REPORTS WILL BE SUBMITTED TO THE STATE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY AND FOR PUBLICATION IN SCIENCE JOURNALS. MOST IMPORTANTLY THE PROJECT WILL HELP TO TRAIN A YOUNG WELL-ROUNDED EARTH SCIENTIST.

PROPOSED PROJECT TITLE: BASALTIC MAGMATIC MAPPING IN THE SPRINGERVILLE VOLCANIC FIELD, EAST-CENTRAL ARIZONAPROJECT PERIOD 05/25/2022 - 05/24/2023THE SPRINGERVILLE VOLCANIC FIELD (SVF), IN EAST-CENTRAL ARIZONA IS A WELL-DOCUMENTED VOLCANIC FIELD THAT ERUPTED PREDOMINATELY BASALTIC MAGMAS BETWEEN 2.1 AND 0.3 MILLION YEARS AGO. THIS FIELD, OFFERS A LOOK INTO THE RELATIVELY COMPLETE ERUPTIVE HISTORY AND EVOLUTION OF A MONOGENETIC FIELD WHERE SEVERAL HUNDRED ERUPTIVE VENTS EXPERIENCED SHORT PERIOD OF ERUPTIVE HISTORY, SOMETHING THAT CAN'T BE STUDIED IN REAL TIME. SIMILAR MONOGENETIC VOLCANIC FIELDS POSE DISTINCT THREATS TO SURROUNDING POPULATION INCLUDING LARGE POPULATION CENTERS SUCH AS AROUND MEXICO CITY, MEXICO, AUCKLAND, NEW ZEALAND OR THE EIFEL VOLCANIC FIELDS IN WESTERN GERMANY, BUT THE LONG INTERVAL BETWEEN ERUPTIONS MAKES IT IMPOSSIBLE TO STUDY THESE FIELDS IN REAL TIME, ILLUSTRATING THE NEED FOR DETAILED MAPPING AND UNDERSTANDING OF A SIMILAR FIELD, LIKE THE SVF, FROM THE BEGINNING OF ITS MAGMATIC HISTORY TO THE END.THIS PROJECT AIMS TO ADD TWO NOTABLE AREAS INTO THE STORY OF THE SVF THAT ARE CURRENTLY LACKING DETAILED MAPPING AND SAMPLING, THE BLUE RIDGE MOUNTAIN SHIELD VOLCANO IN THE WESTERN PART OF THE FIELD AND THE CENTRAL AREA OF THE GREER QUADRANGLE IN THE SOUTHEASTERN AREA OF THE FIELD. THE BLUE RIDGE MOUNTAIN SHIELD VOLCANO IS NOTABLE, BECAUSE IT IS A RARE AREA OF POLYGENETIC VOLCANISM, WHERE A SINGULAR VENT EXPERIENCED MULTIPLE ERUPTION, WITHIN THE FIELD, WHILE THE AREA IN THE GREER QUADRANGLE ARGUABLY CONTAINS SOME OF THE YOUNGEST FLOWS IN THE FIELD, BASED ON PREVIOUSLY OBSERVED AGE TRENDS, ADDING AN IMPORTANT TEMPORAL PIECE TO THE EVOLUTION OF THE FIELD. DETAILED MAPPING OF BOTH AREAS WILL BE COMPLETED BY WALKING OUT EDGES OF EACH LAVA FLOW, REPRESENTATIVE OF AN INDIVIDUAL MAGMA BATCH, SAMPLING OF EACH UNIT, AS WELL AS, STRATIGRAPHIC AND PALEOMAGNETIC ANALYSIS TO DETERMINE RELATIVE AGES OF THE LAVA FLOWS. THIS PROJECT IS AFFILIATED WITH SONOMA STATE UNIVERSITY AND INCLUDES TWO STUDENTS AND A FACULTY MEMBER. ONE PRIMARY STUDENT WILL AUTHOR THE MAP OF THE BLUE RIDGE MOUNTAIN AREA WHILE THE OTHER WILL AUTHOR THE MAP OF THE AREA AROUND GREER IN THE SOUTHEAST PART OF THE FIELD. FOLLOWING WORK IN THE FIELD, MINERALOGICAL STUDY OF THE SAMPLES AND GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSES, CORROBORATED WITH FIELD MAPPING DATA, WILL FURTHER AID IN THE UNDERSTANDING OF DEVELOPMENT OF THESE MAGMA BATCHES. DIGITAL MAPS WILL BE COMPLETED FOR THE BLUE RIDGE MOUNTAIN SHIELD VOLCANO (LAKESIDE QUADRANGLE) AND THE PROPOSED AREA IN THE GREER QUADRANGLE, ALONG WITH ACCOMPANYING UNIT DESCRIPTIONS FOR EACH MAP. THESE MAPS ARE PLANNED TO BE INTEGRATED INTO THE EXISTING DYNAMIC DIGITAL MAP OF THE FIELD (DDM; DDM.GEO.UMASS.EDU/DDM-SVFV2; CONDIT 1995 AND 2018). THE STUDENTS WILL LIKELY TURN THIS MAPPING PROJECT INTO SENIOR THESIS PROJECTS, BASED ON THE DATA THEY HAVE COLLECTED, AS WELL AS THE PREEXISTING DATASET FOR THE FIELD.

MAPPING SPATIO-TEMPORAL GROUNDWATER STORAGE CHANGES IN MEMPHIS AQUIFER: INTEGRATION OF GRACE SATELLITE, GROUND-BASED ESTIMATES AND HYDROLOGIC MODELING APPROACHPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 05/15/2022 - 05/14/2023AWARD PURPOSE:WATER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT REQUIRES BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF TREND AND SEASONALITY OF GROUNDWATER THAT HAS HISTORICALLY RELIED ON A NETWORK OF WELL LEVELS OR HYDROLOGICAL MODELS. THE MEMPHIS AQUIFER IS THE MAIN SOURCE FOR PUBLIC SUPPLY WATER IN WESTERN TENNESSEE; HOWEVER, SPATIO-TEMPORAL MAPPING OF GROUNDWATER IN THIS REGION IS LACKING. NASA'S GRAVITY RECOVERY AND CLIMATE EXPERIMENT (GRACE) HAS BEEN PROVIDING A POWERFUL DATA SOURCE FOR LARGE SCALE GROUNDWATER ASSESSMENTS ALTHOUGH ITS NATIVE SPATIAL RESOLUTION (1- BY 1-) HAS BEEN INCOMPATIBLE FOR LOCAL TO REGIONAL SCALE WATER MANAGEMENT PURPOSE. THIS PROPOSAL AIMS TO DOWNSCALING GRACE-DERIVED GROUNDWATER STORAGE (GWS) AT A TARGET RESOLUTION OF 0.25- BY 0.25- FROM JANUARY 2003 TO DECEMBER 2016 IN SHELBY COUNTY, TENNESSEE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:TO OBTAIN THE DOWNSCALED GWS, MACHINE LEARNING-BASED MODELS (ARTIFICIAL NEURAL NETWORK AND RANDOM FOREST MODEL) WILL BE APPLIED FOR BETTER CAPTURING THE NON-LINEAR RELATIONSHIP AMONG THE VARIOUS HYDROLOGICAL AND GEOSPATIAL INPUT VARIABLES AND TARGET VARIABLE OF TOTAL WATER STORAGE THEN GWS WILL BE OBTAINED BY ISOLATING OTHER VERTICAL WATER COMPONENTS OF SOIL MOISTURE, SURFACE WATER STORAGE, AND SNOW WATER EQUIVALENT. CREATION OF A GEODATABASE OF GEOPHYSICAL LOGS USEFUL FOR VALIDATING DOWNSCALED GRACE GWS PRODUCT. GEOPHYSICAL LOG DATA ARE CRITICAL IN SITE INFORMATION TO INFER WATER-BEARING STRATA, DEPTH OF CONFINING CLAYS, AND WILL SERVE AS A USEFUL REFERENCE FOR GROUNDWATER VULNERABILITY AND CONTAMINANT TRANSPORT IN THIS REGION.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:IN JUNE 2023, THE UNIVERSITY WILL UPLOAD TO THE EDMAP FILE TRANSFER SITE THE DIGITAL TIME-SERIES (MONTHLY AND YEARLY FROM JANUARY 2003 TO DECEMBER 2016) GROUNDWATER STORAGE MAPS AS PDF FILES OF THE SHELBY COUNTY, TN. THE UNIVERSITY WILL ALSO SUBMIT THE SOURCE CODE AND REPRODUCEABLE DATA SETS TO THE NATIONAL COOPERATIVE GEOLOGIC MAPPING PROGRAM (NCGMP) IN A FORMAT DESIRED FOR REVIEW AND PUBLICATION. THE MAPS WILL BE RASTER FILE AT THE RESOLUTION OF 0.25- BY 0.25-. GEOPHYSICAL LOG DATABASE WILL BE STORED AT THE CENTER FOR APPLIED EARTH SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING RESEARCH (CAESER) AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MEMPHIS.INTENDED BENEFICIARY:THIS DATA SYNTHESIS APPROACH OF DOWNSCALING GRACE GWS WILL BE ASSIMILATED INTO THE OPEN-SOURCE HYDROLOGICAL MODELS TO DETERMINE THE SPATIO-TEMPORAL CHARACTERISTICS OF LONG-TERM WATER STORAGE TRENDS USEFUL FOR LOCAL GROUNDWATER MANAGEMENT AND EVALUATION OF THE IMPACT OF CLIMATE CHANGE IN WEST TENNESSEE.

PROJECT TITLE: MAPPING STRUCTURAL AND SURFICIAL FEATURES RELATED TO THE NORTH MOUNTAIN FAULT IN THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE RAWLEY SPRINGS 7.5' QUADRANGLE, WESTERN VIRGINIAPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 05/15/2022 THROUGH 05/14/2023AWARD PURPOSETHIS PROJECT WILL INCORPORATE FIELD INVESTIGATIONS AND PRODUCE NEW BEDROCK AND SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAPS FOR THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE RAWLEY SPRINGS 7.5' QUADRANGLE IN NORTHWESTERN VIRGINIA. THE RAWLEY SPRINGS QUADRANGLE HAS NOT BEEN MAPPED AT THE 1:24,000 SCALE, BUT IT IS ADJACENT TO THE BRIERY BRANCH AND SINGERS GLEN QUADRANGLES, WHICH ARE CURRENTLY BEING MAPPED BY GEOLOGISTS FROM THE UNITED STATES GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (USGS) AND THE VIRGINIA ENERGY: GEOLOGY AND MINERAL RESOURCES PROGRAM. THEREFORE, OPPORTUNITIES EXIST FOR STUDENT MENTORING AND COLLABORATIONS WITH FIELD-BASED GEOSCIENCE PROFESSIONALS. PRELIMINARY INVESTIGATIONS IN THE RAWLEY SPRINGS QUADRANGLE DOCUMENT SHALLOWLY DIPPING SEDIMENTARY ROCKS IN THE WEST AND SUBVERTICAL FOLDED AND FAULTED ROCKS IN THE EAST, WHICH LIKELY REPRESENT THE FOOTWALL OF THE NORTH MOUNTAIN THRUST SYSTEM. IN ADDITION, THE FIELD AREA IS DISSECTED BY FLUVIAL SYSTEMS AND OVERLAIN BY FREQUENT DEBRIS FLOWS. THUS, THIS FIELD AREA PROVIDES OPPORTUNITIES TO EVALUATE DEPOSITIONAL ENVIRONMENTS, DEFORMATIONAL STRUCTURES, AND SURFICIAL FEATURES, WITH THE POTENTIAL TO ILLUSTRATE TO STUDENTS HOW FIELD-BASED MAPPING CAN HIGHLIGHT POTENTIAL AREAS OF NATURAL HAZARDS (E.G. LANDSLIDES, DEBRIS FLOWS, FLOODING) FOR LOCAL RESIDENTS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDTHE PROPOSED RESEARCH WOULD INVOLVE THREE UPPER-LEVEL UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS FROM THE DEPT. OF GEOLOGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE AT JAMES MADISON UNIVERSITY (JMU), AS WELL AS THREE JMU STUDENT ASSISTANTS. THE STUDENTS WILL BE MENTORED AND SUPERVISED BY THREE JMU FACULTY MEMBERS (THE PROPOSAL PIS) WITH BACKGROUNDS IN STRUCTURAL GEOLOGY AND TECTONICS, SURFICIAL GEOLOGY, AND GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEMS (GIS) ANALYSES. STUDENTS WILL MAP BEDROCK AND SURFICIAL FEATURES IN THE FIELD USING MODERN DIGITAL METHODS, INCLUDING DATA COLLECTION AND MAPPING WITH IPADS AND THE STRABOSPOT APP. STUDENTS WILL SYNTHESIZE FIELD DATA AND PREPARE GEOLOGIC MAPS USING ARCGIS PRO, AND ALL FIELD DATA AND MAP PRODUCTS WILL BE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE VIA ARCGIS ONLINE AND THE STRABOSPOT.ORG COMMUNITY DATABASE.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMESJMU STUDENTS INVOLVED IN THE PROJECT WILL PRODUCE THE FINAL PROJECT DELIVERABLES, WHICH WILL INCLUDE PDF FILES OF: 1. A PROFESSIONAL GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE RAWLEY SPRINGS, VIRGINIA 7.5' QUADRANGLE (BOUNDING COORDINATES: NORTH: 38?33'45"N, SOUTH: 38?30'00"N, EAST: 79?00'00"W, WEST: 79?7'30"W), INCLUDING AN EXPLANATION WITH BASIC DESCRIPTIONS OF LITHOLOGIC UNITS AND SYMBOLOGY, AND AT LEAST ONE INTERPRETIVE CROSS-SECTION THROUGH THE MAPPING AREA; AND 2. A PDF DOCUMENT THAT DESCRIBES THE GEOLOGY AND FEATURES OF THE MAPPING AREA, WITH FIELD PHOTOS AND DIAGRAMS AS NECESSARY, AND PROVIDES AN INTERPRETATION OF THE GEOLOGY IN THE CONTEXT OF DEVONIAN-MISSISSIPPIAN DEPOSITIONAL ENVIRONMENTS, ALLEGHANIAN TECTONICS, AND SUBSEQUENT EROSION, DENUDATION, AND DEPOSITION OF SURFICIAL DEPOSITS.INTENDED BENEFICICIARIESSTUDENTS INVOLVED IN THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT BY LEARNING MODEL METHODS OF FIELD DATA COLLECTION AND GEOLOGIC MAP PREPARATION. THE USGS AND THE VIRGINIA GEOLOGY AND MINERAL RESOURCES PROGRAM WILL BENEFIT BY RECEIVING THE DELIVERABLES OF THE PROJECT.

DATA SYNTHESIS: FAULT AND SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAPPING ALONG THE CREEPING SECTION OF THE CENTRAL SAN ANDREAS FAULT FROM LIDAR TOPOGRAPHY AND TOPOGRAPHIC DIFFERENCINGPROJECT PERIOD 06/01/2022 - 05/31/2023- AWARD PURPOSE;THIS IS A DATA SYNTHESIS PROJECT FOR THE CENTRAL SAN ANDREAS FAULT (CSAF) FROM PARKFIELD TO THE SANTA CRUZ MOUNTAINS AND THE SOUTHERN PORTION OF THE CALAVERAS FAULT IN THE DIABLO RANGE OF CALIFORNIA. ARIZONA STATE UNIVERSITY WILL DELIVER TWO MAIN STRIP MAPS (~3KM WIDE AND <240 KM TOTAL LENGTH): 1) SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAP (EMPHASIS ON QUATERNARY UNITS AND LANDFORMS WITH GENERAL SEPARATION OF BEDROCK UNITS), AND 2) ACTIVE FAULT MAP (PRIMARY AND SECONDARY TRACES AND MAJOR LANDFORM INDICATORS). THIS WILL BE A SIGNIFICANT MAPPING UPDATE ACCOUNTING FOR NEW DATA AND WILL PROVIDE A TEMPLATE FOR ADDITIONAL FAULT MAPPING EFFORTS. THE FAULT AND SURROUNDING SURFICIAL GEOLOGY HAVE NOT BEEN MAPPED SINCE IT WAS IMAGED WITH AIRBORNE LASER SCANNING (LIDAR) IN 2007. DETAILED LIDAR-BASED FAULT AND SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAPS PROVIDE UNDERSTANDING OF FAULT ZONE HAZARDS AND CONTEXT FOR SITE SPECIFIC SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING. COMPARING BEHAVIOR OF ACTIVE FAULT TRACES AS INDICATED OVER THE LAST DECADE FROM TOPOGRAPHIC DIFFERENCING WITH THE GEOMORPHIC AND SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC INDICATORS FROM THE MILLENNIAL OR LONGER TIME SCALE IS A VALUABLE CHARACTERIZATION OF THE FAULT TRACES IN THE SHEAR ZONE. THE PRODUCTS WILL SYNTHESIZE EXISTING MAP DATA WITH NEW QUALITY-CONTROLLED DESKTOP MAPPING AND FOCUSED FIELD REVIEW. THIS EDMAP PROJECT WILL COMPRISE THE BULK OF THE THESIS FOR MASTER OF SCIENCE STUDENT AT ARIZONA STATE UNIVERSITY.- ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED;THE UNIVERSITY WILL BEGIN BY REVIEWING THE DATA AND DATA STRUCTURES TO ENSURE CLEAR FILE SCHEMES AND NAMING CONVENTIONS. THE UNIVERSITY WILL SET RELATIVE PATHWAYS SO ARCGIS CAN RUN SMOOTHLY ON MULTIPLE PLATFORMS. THE UNIVERSITY SET THE PROJECTION COORDINATE REFERENCE SYSTEM TO NAD 1983 UTM ZONE 10N AND PROJECT ALL DATA TO THIS COORDINATE SYSTEM. THE UNIVERSITY WILL GEOREFERENCE DATA AS NEEDED (E.G., BROWN, 1970 AND SARNA-WOJKICKI, ET AL., 1975) RELATIVE TO THE LIDAR DIGITAL TERRAIN USING THE GEOREFERENCING TOOLS INARCMAP. THE UNIVERSITY WILL PERFORM REGULAR DATA BACKUPS AND TAKE GOOD NOTES AS SO THAT ARISING QUERIES CAN BE ADDRESSED IN FREQUENT MEETINGS.- DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES;1) SURFICIAL GEOLOGIC MAP (EMPHASIS ON QUATERNARYUNITS AND LANDFORMS WITH GENERAL SEPARATION OF BEDROCK UNITS), AND 2) ACTIVE FAULT MAP(PRIMARY AND SECONDARY TRACES AND MAJOR LANDFORM INDICATORS).-PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYSYNTHESIS PROJECT FOR THE CENTRAL SAN ANDREAS FAULT (CSAF) FROM PARKFIELD TOTHE SANTA CRUZ MOUNTAINS AND THE SOUTHERN PORTION OF THE CALAVERAS FAULT IN THE DIABLO RANGE OF CALIFORNIA.
