BEDROCK GEOLOGICAL MAPPING OF THE NORTHERN TABLE MOUNTAIN D-5 QUADRANGLE, BROOKS RANGE, ALASKAPROJECT PERIOD: 06/15/2022 THROUGH 06/14/2023AWARD PURPOSE THIS AWARD WILL FUND BEDROCK GEOLOGICAL MAPPING AND GRADUATE/UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT TRAINING IN THE BROOKS RANGE OF ALASKA.- ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED; BEDROCK GEOLOGICAL MAPPING- DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES; THE PUBLICATION OF A NEW GEOLOGICAL MAP OF THE TABLE MOUNTAIN D-5 NW 7.5' QUADRANGLE.- INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)THE GEOLOGICAL RESEARCH COMMUNITY, THE UNITED STATES GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, THE ALASKA DIVISION OF GEOLOGICAL AND GEOPHYSICAL SURVEY, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.-PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYTHIS FUNDING IS FOR A USGS-SUPPORTED EDMAP PROJECT IN THE NORTHERN TABLE MOUNTAIN D-5 NW 7.5' QUADRANGLE. THE MAPPING PROJECT WILL SUPPORT A GRADUATE STUDENT, AND WILL CAPITALIZE ON ACTIVE EDMAP AND NATIONAL SCIENCE FOUNDATION (NSF)-FUNDED PROJECTS IN ADJACENT QUADRANGLES WITH COLLABORATORS FROM UNIVERSITY OF IOWA, WASHINGTON, AND LEE UNIVERSITY. THE TABLE MOUNTAIN D-5 NW MAP SHEET BORDERS FOUR 1:250,000-SCALE QUADRANGLES (ARCTIC, TABLE MOUNTAIN, MOUNT MICHELSON, AND DEMARCATION POINT), ALL OF WHICH WERE MAPPED AT A RECONNAISSANCE LEVEL IN THE 1960-1980S AND SUFFER FROM SIGNIFICANT INCONSISTENCIES ACROSS THEIR BORDERS; THUS, THIS EDMAP PROJECT WILL ULTIMATELY RECTIFY KEY INCONSISTENCIES IN MULTIPLE 1:250,000-SCALE QUADRANGLES. DURING THE SUMMER OF 2022, DARTMOUTH COLLEGE WILL SPEND SIX WEEKS MAPPING THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE TABLE MOUNTAIN D-5 NE QUADRANGLE. THIS DETAILED MAPPING WILL BE COUPLED WITH A REGIONAL SAMPLING CAMPAIGN FOR FUTURE PETROLOGICAL, GEOCHEMICAL, AND GEOCHRONOLOGICAL STUDIES SUPPORTED THROUGH OUR NSF GRANT, THEREBY PROVIDING CRITICAL NEW DATA FOR PALEOZOIC TECTONIC RECONSTRUCTIONS OF THE CIRCUM-ARCTIC.

USING SOIL GEOCHEMISTRY TO MAP HISTORIC AND LATE HOLOCENE FLOODPLAINS, FOUR MILE CREEK, OHIOPROJECT PERIOD: 05/15/2022 THROUGH 05/14/2023- AWARD PURPOSE SOIL CHEMISTRY WILL BE USED TO MAP HISTORIC AND LATE HOLOCENE FLOODPLAINS IN THE FOUR MILE CREEK VALLEY IN SOUTHWEST OHIO. THIS DATA IS CRITICALLY NEEDED TO IMPLEMENT ZONING RESTRICTIONS AND REESTABLISH CONNECTIVITY BETWEEN THE STREAM CHANNEL AND ITS FLOODPLAIN. THE GREAT MIAMI WATERSHED, OF WHICH FOUR MILE CREEK IS A PART OF, HAS SOME OF THE HIGHEST NUTRIENT LOADS IN THE U.S DUE TO THE COMBINATION OF INDUSTRY AND AGRICULTURE, AND THIS REGION HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED AS BEING A SIGNIFICANT CONTRIBUTOR TO HYPOXIA IN THE GULF OF MEXICO. IMPORTANTLY, THIS PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE METHODOLOGICAL DEVELOPMENT OF UTILIZING NEW TECHNOLOGY (E.G. PORTABLE XRF) FOR THE GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF FLOODPLAINS AND INFORMING STREAM RESTORATION- ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED; IN THIS MAPPING PROJECT SOIL GEOCHEMISTRY WILL BE USED TO DELINEATE HISTORIC AND LATE HOLOCENE FLOODPLAINS. THE GEOCHEMICAL DATA WILL THEN BE USED IN CONJUNCTION WITH A RELATIVE ELEVATION MODEL, DERIVED PREVIOUSLY TO DELINEATE PALEO-CHANNELS AND TERRACES IN FOUR MILE CREEK (TENISON AND RECH, 2021), TO IDENTIFY POTENTIALLY ACTIVE PORTIONS OF THE FLOODPLAIN AND CHANNEL MIGRATION ZONES. THE RESULTS WILL DEMONSTRATE THE UTILITY OF USING GEOLOGIC MAPPING TO INFORM STREAM RESTORATION DESIGN. THIS PROJECT IS ALSO IMPORTANT FOR TRAINING THE NEXT GENERATION OF GEOLOGIC MAPPERS THAT CAN UTILIZE STATE-OF-THE-ART TECHNIQUES TO MAP HIGH-RESOLUTION SURFICIAL GEOLOGY IN FLOODPLAINS.- DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES; THE FINAL OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE THE PRODUCTION OF THE GIS FLOODPLAIN MAP OF THE ENTIRE MAPPING AREA (NORTHWEST CORNER 39-31'39" N, 84-44'10" W; SOUTHEAST CORNER 39-30'29" N, 84-42'45" W) AND THE ACCOMPANYING TECHNICAL REPORT.- INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)THERE ARE MULTIPLE BENEFICIARIES TO THIS PROJECT. RESULTS FROM THIS WORK ARE IMPORTANT FOR PLANNING AND ZONING AS WELL AS INFORMING STREAM RESTORATION PROJECTS IN THE MIDWEST. AS SUCH, OUR PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES ARE RESIDENTS IN THE US. HOWEVER, HIGH NUTRIENT LOADS IN STREAMS IN THE MIDWEST ARE ADVERSELY AFFECTING THE GULF OF MEXICO. THEREFORE INFORMING STREAM RESTORATION DESIGN AND IMPROVING WATER QUALITY MAY HAVE BENEFICIARIES OUTSIDE OF THE MIDWEST.

EXTENSIONAL FAULTING IN A CONVERGENT OROGEN, WESTERN NORTH CAROLINAPROJECT PERIOD: 05/15/2022 THROUGH 05/14/2023THE GOAL OF OUR PROJECT IS TO DOCUMENT THE EXTENT, DEFORMATION CONDITIONS, TIMING, AND DISPLACEMENT OF THE FIRST REGIONAL-SCALE NORMAL FAULT TO BE DISCOVERED IN THE EASTERN BLUE RIDGE PROVINCE OF WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDGEOLOGIC MAPPING IN THE TODD, DEEP GAP, GLENDALE SPRINGS, AND MINERAL SPRINGS, NC QUADRANGLES IS AIMED AT DETERMINING THE EXTENT AND MAGNITUDE OF DUCTILE EXTENSION IN THE EBR ASSOCIATED WITH THE GRASSY CREEK FAULT. THE MAPPING WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH GEOCHRONOLOGY AND THERMOBAROMETRY TO CLARIFY THE TIMING, MAGNITUDE AND TECTONIC SETTING OF THE EXTENSIONAL DEFORMATION. IN ADDITION TO MAPPING PALEOZOIC STRUCTURES THERE WILL BE MAPPED SURFICIAL DEPOSITS AND BRITTLE STRUCTURES. THE SEISMOGENIC LITTLE RIVER FAULT IS LOCATED ABOUT 30 KM NORTHEAST OF OUR PROPOSED MAPPING AREA AND BRITTLE STRUCTURES THAT WILL BE MAPPED MAY BE RELATED TO THAT FAULT, WHICH RUPTURED IN AUGUST 2020. SURFICIAL MAPPING WILL IDENTIFY LANDSLIDES IN AN AREA THAT IS KNOWN TO HAVE HAD ABUNDANT AND DAMAGING LANDSLIDES IN THE PAST.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMESTHE APPROXIMATELY 70 KM2 MAPPING AREA WILL BE COMPILED INTO A 1:12,000 SCALE GEOLOGIC MAP. THE DIGITAL COMPILATION WILL BE DONE USING ARCMAP 10.8, AND THE FINAL PRODUCT WILL BE DELIVERED AS AN ARCMAP GIS AND A GEOPDF, FOLLOWING THE FGDC CARTOGRAPHIC STANDARD AND THE GEMS DATABASE SCHEMA.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESTHIS WORK IS BEING DONE IN COLLABORATION WITH THE NORTH CAROLINA GEOLOGICAL SURVEY AND WILL BENEFIT THEIR ONGOING EFFORTS IN GEOLOGIC MAPPING. THE MAPS WILL ALSO BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS OF THE PROPOSED MAPPING AREA BY PROVIDING AN UP-TO-DATE GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE REGION INCLUDING LANDSLIDE HAZARDS.ABSTRACT SUMMARYTHE GOAL OF OUR PROJECT IS TO DOCUMENT THE EXTENT, DEFORMATION CONDITIONS, TIMING, AND DISPLACEMENT OF THE FIRST REGIONAL-SCALE NORMAL FAULT TO BE DISCOVERED IN THE EASTERN BLUE RIDGE (EBR) PROVINCE OF WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA. DEFORMATION IN THE EBR IS DOMINATED BY CONTRACTIONAL STRUCTURES CREATED DURING THREE PALEOZOIC OROGENIES. EACH OF THESE OROGENIC EVENTS WAS ASSOCIATED WITH EITHER TERRANE ACCRETION OR SUPERCONTINENT ASSEMBLY AND THERE ARE NO DOCUMENTED PALEOZOIC RIFTING EVENTS IN THE EBR. OUR RECENT WORK, HOWEVER, HAS REVEALED THE EXISTENCE OF A MAJOR DUCTILE FAULT WITH EXTENSIONAL (NORMAL) MOTION. KINEMATIC INDICATORS SHOW THIS FAULT, WHICH HAVE BEEN NAMED THE GRASSY CREEK FAULT, IS A TOP-TO- THE-SOUTHEAST NORMAL FAULT THAT WAS INITIALLY ACTIVE UNDER AMPHIBOLITE-FACIES CONDITIONS WITH A LATER GREENSCHIST FACIES OVERPRINT. IN SOME OROGENIC BELTS, EXTENSION DURING ACCRETION AND COLLISION CAN ACCOMMODATE OVER-THICKENING OF THE OROGENIC WEDGE. IN OTHERS, EXTENSION HAS BEEN SHOWN TO OCCUR PRIOR TO TERRANE ACCRETION. IN BOTH CASES, EXTENSION HAS PLAYED A FUNDAMENTAL ROLE IN THE EXHUMATION OF HIGH- PRESSURE METAMORPHIC ROCKS, SUCH AS ECLOGITE. THE EBR CONTAINS THE LARGEST BODIES OF ECLOGITE IN THE APPALACHIANS YET THE MECHANISM BY WHICH THESE BODIES WERE EXHUMED REMAINS UNKNOWN. OUR MAPPING IN THE TODD, DEEP GAP, GLENDALE SPRINGS, AND MINERAL SPRINGS, NC QUADRANGLES IS AIMED AT DETERMINING THE EXTENT AND MAGNITUDE OF DUCTILE EXTENSION IN THE EBR ASSOCIATED WITH THE GRASSY CREEK FAULT. THE MAPPING WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH GEOCHRONOLOGY AND THERMOBAROMETRY TO CLARIFY THE TIMING, MAGNITUDE AND TECTONIC SETTING OF THE EXTENSIONAL DEFORMATION. IN OTHER CONVERGENT OROGENS, LARGE-DISPLACEMENT NORMAL FAULTS WERE INSTRUMENTAL IN THE EXHUMATION OF ECLOGITE. THE GRASSY CREEK FAULT MAY HAVE PLAYED A SIMILAR ROLE IN THE EXHUMATION OF THE EBR ECLOGITE. I

THREE DIMENSIONAL MAPPING OF THE UPPER LEXINGTON LIMESTONE, INNER BLUEGRASS REGION,PROJECT PERIOD  08 08 2022 THROUGH 08 07 2023THE UPPER ORDOVICIAN LEXINGTON LIMESTONE UNDERLIES MOST OF CENTRAL KENTUCKY, FORMING A GENTLY ROLLING PLAIN THAT HAS BEEN IDEAL FOR AGRICULTURE AND TRANSPORTATION INTO THE AREA FOR BUSINESS AND LIGHT INDUSTRY  THE LEXINGTON LIMESTONE WAS THOUGHT TO BE A RELATIVELY TABULAR,  LAYER CAKE  UNIT, BUT U S  GEOLOGICAL SURVEY MAPPING THAT ENDED IN THE 1990S SHOWED THAT UPPER PARTS OF THE LEXINGTON REPRESENT A COMPLEXLY INTERTONGUING FACIES MOSAIC WITH ABRUPT FACIES CHANGES, DISJUNCT UNIT DISTRIBUTION, AND FREQUENT UNCONFORMITIES  WORK SINCE THE 1990S HAS SUGGESTED THAT MANY OF THESE ANOMALIES MAY BE RELATED TO BASEMENT STRUCTURES THAT WERE REACTIVATED BY FAR FIELD FORCES DURING THE COEVAL TACONIAN OROGENY  THE ORGANIZATION OF THIS COMPLEX FACIES MOSAIC IS STILL NOT UNDERSTOOD, AND HENCE, THIS DATA SYNTHESIS EDMAP PROJECT IS PROPOSED IN ORDER TO DEVELOP A THREE DIMENSIONAL GEOFRAMEWORK TO DETERMINE WHETHER THREE DIMENSIONAL MAPPING BE USED TO CHARACTERIZE COMPLEX GEOLOGIC SURFACES LIKE THOSE IN THE UPPER LEXINGTON LIMESTONE OF CENTRAL KENTUCKY, AND IN SO DOING, CONFIRM THE PRESENCE OF STRUCTURAL CONTROL ON THE DISTRIBUTION OF FACIES IN THE UPPER LEXINGTON LIMESTONE  AT THE SAME TIME, THE PROJECT IS PROVIDING AN EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY FOR A GRADUATE STUDENT TO USE MAPS FOR DATA COLLECTION AND THEN LEARN TO MANIPULATE THAT DATA USING GIS TOOLS TO MAKE THREE DIMENSIONAL GEOFRAMEWORK MAPS THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE COLLECTION OF LOCATION AND ELEVATION DATA FOR KEY STRATIGRAPHIC HORIZONS FROM LOCAL EXPOSURES, CORES, WELL LOGS, GEOLOGIC QUADRANGLE MAPS, AND STUDENT THESES, FOLLOWED BY THE USE OF ESRI ARC PRO AND ARC ONLINE TO MANAGE AND INTERPOLATE THIS DATA TO VISUALIZE SUBSURFACE GEOLOGIC CONTACTS, FAULTS, AND OTHER GEOLOGIC DATA ON THREE DIMENSIONAL GEOLOGIC MAPS  THE GRADUATE STUDENT WILL PRODUCE A ROBUST GEMS COMPLIANT GEODATABASE OF ISOPACHS AND CONTOURS OF THE BOUNDARIES AND INTERNAL SUBDIVISIONS OF THE LEXINGTON LIMESTONE, RASTER DATA OF THE RELEVANT SURFACES  FORMATTED AND TRANSMITTED IN CONSULTATION WITH NCGMP STAFF , AND A REPORT SUMMARIZING METHODS, CORRELATIONS, AND SOURCES USED IN THE PROJECT  A GEOLOGIC MAP WITH APPROPRIATE MAP POLYGON CONTENT,DESCRIPTIONS, COLLAR INFORMATION, NOMENCLATURE, AND SYMBOLOGY WILL BE PRODUCED TO COMMUNICATE THE KEY STRATIGRAPHIC AND CORRELATION OUTCOMES OF THE PROJECT THIS EDMAP PROJECT WILL COMPLEMENT ONGOING 3D GEOFRAMEWORK PROJECTS AT THE KENTUCKY GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, AND THE RESULTS WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR INCLUSION WITH REGIONAL OR NATIONAL COMPILATIONS THROUGH THE KGS GEOFRAMEWORK DATABASE  THE EXPECTED THREE DIMENSIONAL MAPS OF THE UPPER LEXINGTON LIMESTONE WILL NOT ONLY PROVIDE AN EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY AND CONTRIBUTE TO AN ONGOING KGS STATEWIDE GEOFRAMEWORK PROJECT, BUT WILL ALSO HAVE MAJOR GEOTECHNICAL IMPLICATIONS FOR UNDERSTANDING THE DISTRIBUTION OF KARST, GROUNDWATER, AND AGRICULTURALLY PRODUCTIVE SOILS IN THE BLUEGRASS REGION OF CENTRAL KENTUCKY

DOCUMENTING COLLAPSE OF THE NORTHERN PALEO-TETON RANGE AND NORTHERN EXTENSION OF THE MODERN TETON FAULT BETWEEN GRAND TETON AND YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARKS, WYPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 05/25/2022 - 05/24/2023AWARD PURPOSEPROVIDE SUPPORT FOR GEOLOGICAL MAPPING DIRECTLY RELATED TO EXPLORATION FOR AND ASSESSMENT OF GRAPHITE MINERALIZATION IN ALABAMA.DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMESTHE PRIMARY DELIVERABLE WILL BE A NEW DIGITAL GEOLOGICAL MAP FOR THE MITCHELL DAM NW QUADRANGLE IN ALABAMA. THE SECONDARY DELIVERABLE WILL BE AN M.S. STUDENT TRAINED IN GEOLOGICAL MAPPING TECHNIQUES. TWO ADDITIONAL DELIVERABLES, WILL BE ESTIMATES FOR THE CONDITIONS AND TIMING OF METAMORPHISM AND MINERALIZATION IN THE BLUE RIDGE OF ALABAMA.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESTHE MAJOR BENEFICIARIES WILL BE EVERYONE IN THE U.S. BECAUSE NEW INFORMATION WILL BE GAINED ABOUT GRAPHITE RESOURCES IN ALABAMA. IN ADDITION, WESTWATER RESOURCES WILL GAIN KNOWLEDGE ABOUT GRAPHITE RESOURCES THAT THEY ARE PLANNING TO MINE, STUDENTS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA WILL GAIN KNOWLEDGE ABOUT MAPPING TECHNIQUES AND ANALYTICAL TECHNIQUES RELATED TO UNDERSTANDING MINERALIZATION AND METAMORPHISM.PROJECT ABSTRACTRECENT GROWTH IN THE USE OF ELECTRICAL VEHICLES AND SUSTAINABLE ENERGY HAVE CREATED A HIGH DEMAND FOR RESOURCES USED IN BATTERIES, AND SOLAR AND WIND ENERGY PRODUCTION. AS A RESULT OF THIS AND THE NEED TO ENHANCE DEVELOPMENT OF U.S. SOURCES FOR IMPORTANT NATURAL RESOURCES, THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR RELEASED A LIST OF 35 CRITICAL MINERALS WHICH INCLUDES CHEMICAL ELEMENTS, MINERALS, AND ROCKS. SEVERAL OF THESE CRITICAL MINERALS ARE FOUND IN ALABAMA. THIS INCLUDES GRAPHITE, RARE EARTH ELEMENTS (REE), AND VANADIUM WHICH ARE WIDESPREAD IN METASEDIMENTARY AND IGNEOUS ROCKS OF THE ALABAMA PIEDMONT. THE METAMORPHIC ROCKS IN ALABAMA ARE POORLY UNDERSTOOD WITH VERY FEW ESTIMATES FOR THE CONDITIONS AND AGES OF METAMORPHISM AND MINERALIZATION. THIS LACK OF INFORMATION HINDERS EVALUATION OF IMPORTANT MINERALIZATION SOME OF WHICH IS ASSOCIATED WITH REGIONAL METAMORPHISM. THE STATE OF ALABAMA LACKS NUMEROUS 7.5-MINUTE GEOLOGICAL QUADRANGLE MAPS FOR THE METAMORPHIC ROCKS WHICH CONTAIN CRITICAL MINERALS IN THE BLUE RIDGE AND PIEDMONT GEOLOGICAL PROVINCES AND THE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY OF ALABAMA, IS NOW MAPPING IN THIS AREA IN ORDER TO GUIDE RESOURCE EVALUATION. THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON MAPPING THE 1:24,000 MITCHELL DAM NW QUADRANGLE IN CENTRAL AL. THIS QUADRANGLE IS KNOWN TO INCLUDE GRAPHITE-RICH AND VANADIUM-BEARING ROCKS WHICH ARE CURRENTLY BEING EXPLORED BY WESTWATER RESOURCES FOR POSSIBLE MINING. IN ADDITION, THIS QUADRANGLE IS DIRECTLY ADJACENT TO THE FLAG MOUNTAIN AND MITCHELL DAM QUADRANGLES THAT ARE CURRENTLY BEING MAPPED BY THE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY OF ALABAMA.

TWO TESTS OF SPECTRAL IMAGING IN ALASKA-A SPATIAL RESOLUTION STUDY AND MAPPING PLATINUM-GROUP ELEMENT MINERALIZATIONSPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 07/15/2022 - 07/14/2023DESCRIPTION AWARD PURPOSETHERE ARE STILL SOME PARTS OF ALASKA THAT ARE GEOLOGICALLY LITTLE UNDERSTOOD BECAUSE THEY ARE RUGGED AND REMOTE. THERE ARE PLANS TO USE THIS AWARD TO ACQUIRE AND PROCESS A PARTICULAR TYPE OF IMAGERY, CALLED HYPERSPECTRAL IMAGERY, WHICH IS USEFUL IN DETECTING THE MINERAL ALTERATIONS THAT ARE ASSOCIATED WITH GOLD AND OTHER RARE METAL DEPOSITS. BECAUSE THE IMAGING IS DONE FROM A PLANE, IT COVERS WIDE SWATHS OF GROUND IN A MUCH SHORTER TIME THAN IT WOULD TAKE TO MAP BY FOOT. THE SPECTRA THAT ARE COLLECTED ARE MATCHED TO LIBRARIES OF KNOWN MINERAL SPECTRA, CREATING A MINERALS MAP. THERE ARE TWO ASPECTS TO THIS PROJECT. THE FIRST IS TO COLLECT DATA AT DIFFERENT ELEVATIONS OVER A RELATIVELY FLAT AND MINERALIZED AREA IN ALASKA NEAR OUR HOME BASE (FAIRBANKS) IN ORDER TO TEST THE SPECTRAL RESOLUTION AT DIFFERENT ALTITUDES. THE SECOND IS TO CAPTURE NEW HYPERSPECTRAL DATA FROM THE SOUTH-CENTRAL ALASKA RANGE, FROM A HIGH PEAK FOR WHICH EXISTING MAPPING COVERS ONLY THE BIG PICTURE. THIS AREA IS THOUGHT TO CONTAIN PLATINUM-GROUP ELEMENTS, WHICH ARE OF ECONOMIC SIGNIFICANCE, AND TO SEEK TO UNDERSTAND THE ALTERATIONS SO THAT A MODEL OF MINERALIZATION FOR THIS AREA CAN BE BUILT.- ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED; (1) HYPERSPECTRAL IMAGE ACQUISITION(2) HYPERSPECTRAL DATA ANALYSIS(3) LIMITED FIELD SAMPLE COLLECTION(4) LIMITED GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSIS - XRAY FLUORESCENCE AND XRAY DIFFRACTION- DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES; (1) ALTERATION MAPS, INTENDED FOR PUBLICATION: (A) COMPOSITION DISRUPTION OF AG, AU, AS, AND PGE-RELATED CONCENTRATIONS; (B) FE-BEARING MATERIALS SPECTRAL MAP; (C) AN ALTERATION MAP THAT INCLUDES PHYLLOSILICATES, CARBONATES, AND SULFATES; (D) A WHITE-MICA ALTERATION MAP; (E) A TRUE-COLOR HYPERSPECTRAL MAP; AND (F) A SERIES OF 3D MAPS FOCUSED ON INTERPRETING MAIN ZONES OF DESIRABLE MINERALS. THE UNIVERSITY WILL ENSURE THAT ALL DELIVERABLES MEET DGGS PUBLICATION STANDARDS, AS WILL INTEND TO MAKE THE MAPS AVAILABLE.(2) REPORT/AMNUSCRIPT DESCRIBING THE SAMPLED ROCKS OF THE 2ND FIELD SITE (MOUNT HAJDUKOVICH), INCLUDING GEOCHEMICAL AND ANY OTHER SUPPORTING ANALYSES(3) AN MS THESIS(4) SPECTRAL DATA AS REQUESTED.- INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES)(1) THE UNIVERSITY OF ALASKA HAS PARTNERED WITH METALLOGENY, INC., AN ALASKA-BASED EXPLORATION SUPPORT COMPANY, FOR FIELD SUPPORT AND ACCESS TO THE REMOTE FIELD SITE. THEY WILL GET COPIES OF THE SPECTRAL MAPS.(2) THE MAPS WILL ALSO BE SHARED WITH THE ALASKA DIVISION OF GEOLOGICAL & GEOPHYSICAL SURVEYS (DGGS).(3) USGS AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS AS REQUESTED.(4) THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY THROUGH INTENDED PUBLICATIONS.

EDMAP AWARD TITLE: GEOLOGY AND MINERAL DEPOSITS OF THE PHILIPSBURG MINING DISTRICT, GRANITE COUNTY, MONTANAPERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 06/01/2022 THROUGH 05/31/2023PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARYTHE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS AWARD IS TO CREATE A DIGITAL GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE HISTORIC PHILIPSBURG MINING DISTRICT IN SOUTHWEST MONTANA. PHILIPSBURG IS THE 2ND MOST PRODUCTIVE POLYMETALLIC MINERAL DISTRICT IN MONTANA (AFTER BUTTE), WITH OVER 24 MILLION OUNCES OF SILVER, 36 MILLION KG OF ZINC, 408 MILLION KG OF BATTERY-GRADE MANGANESE-OXIDE, AND SIGNIFICANT LEAD, COPPER, AND GOLD PRODUCED FROM OVER 40 INDIVIDUAL MINES. THE DEPOSITS CONSIST OF VEINS AND REPLACEMENTS CUTTING GRANITE AND METASEDIMENTARY ROCK, AND ARE SPATIALLY ASSOCIATED WITH AN ALTERED INTRUSION THAT HOSTS PORPHYRY-STYLE MOLYBDENUM MINERALIZATION. THE MINES ARE SHUT DOWN, AND THE DISTRICT IS AT RISK OF BECOMING SUBDIVIDED AS A SUBURB OF THE SCENIC TOWN OF PHILIPSBURG. BEFORE THIS HAPPENS, IT IS IMPORTANT TO DOCUMENT THE GEOLOGY OF THE MINING DISTRICT, AS WELL AS THE DISTRIBUTION OF HISTORIC MINE FEATURES, INCLUDING ADITS, SHAFTS, OPEN PITS, TRENCHES, MINE DUMPS, TAILINGS PILES, AND MILL SITES. A SET OF SAMPLES FROM EACH MINE AND/OR MINE DUMP WILL BE COLLECTED FOR PROCESSING AND GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSIS TO EXAMINE DISTRICT-SCALE ZONATION OF METALLIC ELEMENTS, AS WELL AS ORE AND ALTERATION MINERALS. PRELIMINARY RESULTS SHOW HIGHLY ELEVATED CONCENTRATIONS OF SEVERAL CRITICAL METALS IN ROCK THAT WAS DISCARDED, INCLUDING GALLIUM (GA), GERMANIUM (GE), INDIUM (IN), AND TUNGSTEN (W).ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: 1) DIGITIZATION OF EXISTING INFORMATION ON THE GEOLOGY OF THE DISTRICT, INCLUDING DETAILED MAPS OF UNDERGROUND MINE WORKINGS; 2) NEW GEOLOGIC MAPPING, FOCUSING ON THE PRECISE LOCATIONS OF GEOLOGIC CONTACTS, STRUCTURES (FAULTS, JOINTS, FRACTURES), AND HYDROTHERMAL ALTERATION; 3) COLLECTION OF REPRESENTATIVE SAMPLES FROM OUTCROPS, MINES, MINE DUMPS, AND TAILINGS DEPOSITS; AND 4) MINERALOGICAL AND GEOCHEMICAL ANALYSIS OF THE ROCK SAMPLES.THE MAIN DELIVERABLE OF THE EDMAP PROJECT WILL BE A DIGITIZED GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE PHILIPSBURG DISTRICT, WITH OVERLAYS SHOWING THE DISTRIBUTION OF MINE FEATURES AS WELL AS GEOCHEMICAL AND/OR ALTERATION TRENDS. ANY CHEMISTRY DATA FUNDED THROUGH THIS PROJECT WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE AS A SEPARATE EXCEL FILE, INCLUDING SAMPLE LOCATIONS (LAT-LONGS). THIS WORK WILL BE INCORPORATED INTO THE PH.D. DISSERTATION, AND WILL SUPPORT TWO OR MORE TECHNICAL PAPERS IN SCIENTIFIC JOURNALS AS WELL AS REPORTS OF THE MONTANA BUREAU OF MINES AND GEOLOGY.

PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARY: BEDROCK GEOLOGIC MAPPING OF THE UPPER NUTRIA QUADRANGLE,PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 05/15/2022 THROUGH 05/14/2023PLAIN LANGUAGE DESCRIPTION OF AWARD PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO TRAIN THE NEXT GENERATION OF GEOSCIENTISTS THROUGH A GUIDED EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE. THIS PROPOSAL WILL FUND AN EDUCATION-FOCUSED GEOLOGIC MAPPING PROJECT WITH IMPLICATIONS FOR GROUNDWATER MANAGEMENT IN RURAL AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES IN NEW MEXICO. SPECIFICALLY, TWO UNDER-GRADUATE STUDENTS WILL BE TRAINED TO CONDUCT GEOLOGIC MAPPING IN THE ZUNI MOUNTAINS OF NEW MEXICO. THE STUDENTS WILL CONDUCT GEOLOGIC MAPPING WITH THE GOALS OF: 1) UNDERSTANDING THE GEOLOGIC HISTORY OF THE AREA, AND 2) ASSESSING THE EFFECTS OF ROCK FRACTURES ON GROUNDWATER FLOW IN THE AREA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE EXTENT, ORIENTATION, AND DISTRIBUTION OF DIFFERENT ROCKS IN THE WESTERN ZUNI MOUNTAINS OF NEW MEXICO WILL BE DESCRIBED. THIS MAPPING EFFORT WILL INVOLVE: EXTENSIVE HIKING; DETAILED MEASUREMENTS OF ROCKS WITH BRUNTON COMPASSES AND/OR IPADS; ROCK UNIT THICKNESS MEASUREMENTS WITH JACOBS STAFFS; GEOGRAPHIC LOCATION MEASUREMENTS WITH GPS UNITS; PHOTOGRAPHING KEY/INTERESTING GEOLOGY AND FIELD RELATIONSHIPS; COLLECTING GEOLOGIC SAMPLES WITH HAMMER AND CHISEL; AND MAPPING WITH PENCIL/PEN ON PAPER BASE MAPS. UPON RETURNING FROM THE FIELD, THE STUDENT WILL CUT ROCK SAMPLES AND PREPARE THIN SECTIONS FOR PETROGRAPHIC (MICROSCOPE) ANALYSIS, AND CONDUCT IMAGE ANALYSIS OF FRACTURE SETS.DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL PRODUCE A 1:10,000 SCALE GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE NORTHERN UPPER NUTRIA 7.5 MINUTE QUADRANGLE, NEW MEXICO. ONE BALANCED CROSS SECTION DRAWN PERPENDICULAR TO THE AXIS OF THE NUTRIA MONOCLINE AND ACROSS STRIKE OF THE STINKING SPRINGS AND MCGAFFEY FAULTS WILL ALSO BE INCLUDED IN THE MAP REPORT. THE FINAL REPORT SUBMITTED AT THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD WILL BE THE PRIMARY UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT MAPPER'S SENIOR THESIS.INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES): WEST TEXAS A&M UNIVERSITY

WE EXPECT TO CONSTRAIN THE STRUCTURE OF A THRUST DUPLEX THAT ACCOMMODATES A VERTICAL STEP IN THE STRATIGRAPHIC LEVEL OF THE NMTZ FROM THE BASAL CAMBRIAN HORIZON (THE SOLE THRUST OF THE BLUE RIDGE PROVINCE), TO THE ORDOVICIAN DECOLLEMENT HORIZON IN THE VALLEY AND RIDGE PROVINCE. HOW DOES IT END?: MAPPING THE TERMINATION OF THE GARLOCK FAULT IN THE AVAWATZ MOUNTAINS, CAPROJECT PERIOD:07/26/2022 - 07/25/2023- AWARD PURPOSETHE AVAWATZ MOUNTAINS, SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA, ARE AT THE JUNCTION OF THE ACTIVE WEST-STRIKING LEFT-SLIP GARLOCK FAULT AND THE NORTHWEST-STRIKING RIGHT-SLIP DEATH VALLEY FAULT SYSTEM. THE RANGE BROADLY CONSISTS OF A CONTRACTIONAL THRUST BELT THAT MAY HAVE FORMED PRIMARILY AS AN EAST-DIRECTED TERMINATION THRUST BELT THAT PARTITIONS STRAIN OFF THE GARLOCK FAULT OR A COMPLEX RESTRAINING BEND THAT DEVELOPED AS A LEFT-STEP IN THE DEATH VALLEY FAULT SYSTEM. THRUST FAULTS CUTTING PLEISTOCENE FAN SURFACES DEMONSTRATE THE RECENCY OF FAULT ACTIVITY IN THIS AREA. FOR THIS PROJECT, THE PI AND A GRADUATE STUDENT WILL TEST THE HYPOTHESIS THAT THE AVAWATZ MOUNTAINS PRIMARILY DEVELOPED AS A TERMINATION THRUST BELT FOR THE GARLOCK FAULT VIA NEW GEOLOGIC MAPPING AND GEOCHRONOLOGY, WHICH PREDICTS (1) PRIMARILY WEST-DIPPING, DIP-SLIP THRUST FAULTS THAT PARTITION STRAIN OFF OF THE GARLOCK FAULT, (2) FAULT ACTIVITY THAT INITIATED AT CA. 10 MA, COEVAL WITH ESTIMATES FOR THE GARLOCK FAULT, AND (3) SHORTENING MAGNITUDES AND RATES THAT ARE COMPARABLE WITH ESTIMATES ALONG THE GARLOCK FAULT. THE RESTRAINING BEND MODEL PREDICTS (1) COMPLEX RESTRAINING BEND FAULT GEOMETRIES WITH VARIABLE DIPS AND STRIATION ATTITUDES, (2) CA. 5 MA INITIATION STRUCTURES DEFINING THE RANGE, AND (3) MORE NORTHWEST-STRIKING RIGHT-SLIP ACTIVITY THAN WEST-STRIKING LEFT-SLIP FAULTING. THE UNIVERSITY WILL MAP THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE "SHEEP CREEK SPRING 7.5' QUADRANGLE" IN SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA AT 1:24,000 SCALE, IN CLOSE COORDINATION WITH THE CALIFORNIA GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (CGS). THE PROPOSED WORK HAS BASIC AND APPLIED IMPLICATIONS, INCLUDING: (1) DOCUMENTATION AND CHARACTERIZATION OF PLEISTOCENE THRUST SCARPS FOR SEISMIC HAZARD ASSESSMENT; (2) ASSESSMENT OF WHETHER THE EASTERN GARLOCK FAULT IS A SIGNIFICANT AND RECENTLY ACTIVE FAULT STRUCTURE THAT STILL CONTROLS THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE AVAWATZ MOUNTAINS OR WHETHER THE EASTERN STRAND IS TECTONICALLY QUIESCENT; AND (3) BETTER CONSTRAINTS ON THE PRIMARY TECTONIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE GARLOCK FAULT WITHIN THE CONTEXT OF THE SAN ANDREAS-EASTERN CALIFORNIA SHEAR ZONE DISTRIBUTED PLATE BOUNDARY SYSTEM.- ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED; THIS PROJECT WILL INVOLVE NEW GEOLOGIC MAPPING, GEOCHRONOLOGY TO DATE EXPOSED IGNEOUS ROCKS, THIN-SECTION OBSERVATIONS TO HELP IDENTIFY ROCK UNITS AND AID IN GEOCHRONOLOGY, STRUCTURAL ANALYSES, AND GEOLOGIC MAP AND CROSS-SECTION PRODUCTION.- DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES; THE PROJECT WILL DELIVER A 1:24,000-SCALE GEOLOGIC MAP OF THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE SHEEP CREEK SPRING 7.5' QUADRANGLE IN SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA. THIS MAP WILL INCLUDE TWO CROSS SECTIONS (ONE WEST-EAST ACROSS THE RANGE AND ONE NORTH-SOUTH ACROSS PROBABLE STRIKE-SLIP FAULTS, DEPENDING ON OBSERVED GEOLOGY), CORRELATION DIAGRAM, AND UNIT DESCRIPTION. THE STUDENT WILL BE FIRST AUTHOR. THE MAP WILL BE GIS LAYERED WITH COMPLETE ATTRIBUTE INFORMATION, SAVED AS A HIGH-RESOLUTION GEOPDF AND STANDALONE ARCGIS FILE. THE UNIVERSITY WILL ANTICIPATE MAKING OBSERVATIONS THAT CAN DIRECTLY TEST HYPOTHESES FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE AVAWATZ MOUNTAINS AND THE TERMINATION OF THE GARLOCK FAULT. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO SUPPORT MS RESEARCH BY THE GRADUATE STUDENT.
